loans.name: Sara Esther

texts.es: Sara Con su credikiva anterior compró productos que vienen en sus guias especializadas y ganó descuentos por el volumen y es sistema de su compra, pues recurrió a los que presentaban grandes descuentos. En la actualidad comprará productos al pormayor para obtener descuentos por volumen , pues se acerca la temporada de mayor movimiento comercial, el final del año,  y espera aprovecharla para hacer de esta inversión todo un éxito. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva : " Estoy muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida"
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Sara bought merchandise to sell in her specialized catalogues. She received discounts due to the large volume and her system of purchasing, and she returns to those who offer the larger discounts. Sara will now continue to purchase wholesale products in order to receive bulk discounts - the busiest end-of-year shopping season is approaching which she hopes to take advantage of and make this investment a success. Sara tells her Kiva funders; "I am very grateful for the help I have received"

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cosmetics in order to obtain discounts

loans.name: Martin Njuguna

texts.en: Martin is a 25-year-old married man. He describes himself as vigilant. He operates a transportation service where he provides "tuk tuk" transport services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in Nakuru. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the traffic police disturbance. He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy spare parts and save for buying another "tuk tuk". His business goal is to own more "tuk tuk"s within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and save to buy another "tuk tuk" (small transport vehicle).

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria sells "wakye" (cooked beans and rice), "banku" (maize dumplings) and cocked rice and stew at Besease. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer.  

Victoria has been selling "banku" and rice for seven years. She assists her husband to provide for the family. She will use her loan to buy rice and maize in bulk for food preparation and sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize in bulk for food preparation and sale.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela, de 19 años, es una señorita muy amable, buena y trabajadora, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive a lado de sus padres y sus cuatro hermanos a quienes apoya mucho en sus estudios y algunas necesidades que tienen y son propias de su edad. El trabajo de Graciela consiste en la venta de comida, desde muy temprano trabaja yendo al mercado en busca de los mejores ingredientes y las verduras más seleccionadas, de ahí en su casa prepara los distintos platos para que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes, por lo que se va a los aserraderos de la ciudad en donde tiene contrato con algunos trabajadores a quienes les brinda pensión. Recién lleva tres meses en el negocio, antes trabajaba en su bodega, pero con el tiempo tuvo que cambiar su actividad ya que no le brindaba muchas ganancias, ahora trabaja tranquila junto a su tia y su madre quienes la apoyan en todo.
Al principio tenía muchas dudas y dificultades, pero gracias al apoyo de su familia pudo superarlos, ahora esta muy contenta ya que trabaja tranquila con el apoyo de todos ellos, actualmente atiende un promedio de 30 platos diarios solo pedidos y hace unos 20 más que son su respaldo. Desea mas adelante poner su restaurante y así seguir trabajando a lado de su familia y progresando juntos. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, además se compromete a ser una cliente responsable y sobre todo colaboradora con su banco comunal al que esta muy feliz de pertenecer ya que le brindan mucha confianza y solidaridad. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará materiales, ingredientes e insumos para seguir haciendo su trabajo ya que tiene mayor demanda y desea satisfacer a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Graciela is 19 years old.  She is a very pleasant, kind, and hardworking young woman.  She is single and does not have any children.  She lives with her parents and her four siblings, whom she helps with their studies and with some of the difficulties they have which are typical of their age.  

Graciela makes a living selling meals.  She begins her work very early, going first to the market in search of the best ingredients and the choicest vegetables, then going home to prepare various meals that she can offer her customers.  She then goes off to the city’s sawmills, where she has a contract with some of the workers to bring them meals daily.  Graciela has only been in business for three months; she previously had a bodega, but she had to change her economic activity because it was not bringing in much profit.  She now works happily with her aunt and her mother, who help her with everything.

At first Graciela had numerous doubts and difficulties, but thanks to help from her family she was able to overcome these problems.  She is now very happy, since her work is easier with all of their help.  She currently serves an average of 30 pre-ordered meals per day, and prepares about 20 more meals as backup.  Graciela would like to set up a restaurant eventually, which would allow her to continue working with her family and to improve their lives together.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and she hopes that working with the organization will help her continue toward her goals.  She promises to be a responsible customer and is very happy to belong to her communal bank, since the other members bring much confidence and solidarity.  Graciela will use the amount she is asking for, 2000 soles, to purchase materials, ingredients, and supplies so that she can continue with her work, since demand has increased and she wants to meet all of her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for preparing meals.

loans.name: Nemie

texts.en:
Nemie is 45 years old, and married with six children. With two children in school, Nemie works very hard to provide for them.  Nemie runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Nemie has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, milk, shampoo, bread, sardines, etc. In the future, Nemie would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her two children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. 

Anabella has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Anabella has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Anabella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary O., a 38 years old woman sells food items to people. She is married with five (5) children. She is proud of her business and promise to effectively use the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Madame K. lives in Nkurankan, Ghana and sells a variety of pharmaceutical products.  She attends to a lot of customers in a day. She needs a Kiva loan of $1100.00 to enable her to buy more drugs to stock her shop.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamed M. is 26 years and had no opportunity for formal education.  During the civil war in Sierra Leone, M. was a refugee in Guinea where he learned tailoring.  When he returned from Guinea, M. settled in a village with his family and life was not easy for him.  He then came to Kabala and began to sew clothes for people using a friend’s sewing machine.

M. joined SMT and with his first loans purchased two sewing machines and rented another two.  He asked four other young men to assist him in his sewing business.  M.’s business has continued to progress and he would like to expand it.  With a new loan he plans to buy a embroidery machine and specialized thread.  M. has made himself responsible for his young sisters' and brothers’ education expenses, and his business has managed to provide continuing employment for the four other young men.

loans.use: Purchase emboidery machine and specialized thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more fish and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Mrs. Soum N. is a 57 year old mother who works with her husband on their plot of farmland growing vegetables. However, she can typically make only a meager sum. To help supplement their household income, one of their children and their son in-law are employed at a garment factory, earning together around $180 per month. Now, Mrs. Soum N. is requesting a loan to purchase fashionable clothes for her children to resell to their coworkers at a good price.

loans.use: To purchase fashionable clothes to sell to their coworkers at a good price.

loans.name: Shamsi

texts.en: Shamsi H. is a 39-year-old man who owns a small farm and raises livestock in the southern Azerbaijani region of Sattli. Shamsi is married and has three sons. He does everything possible to improve the conditions of his family. He has more than ten years of experience in this field. But during the last two years this business brings him less and less income. Currently Shamsi has two calves. As soon as they are raised he will sell them. Selling claves for meat production is the only o financial source of income in his family and he works very hard. Beef is in very high demand among Azerbaijani people and people use meat in their everyday cuisine. Shamsi decided to expand his business and purchase three calves each for 300 USD. For this purpose he has applied for 900 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase three calves

loans.name: María Bertola

texts.es:
María belongs to the Las Esmeraldas Communal Bank, AA. HH. San Juan Ucayali Pasaje José Balta S/N, Calleria District, Ucayali state. She is 62 years old and is mother to 11 children. Her husband is a farmer, but the income doesn't meet the household expenses, so María, with the first loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles (US $100.00), decided to invest in beauty products.

To date, her beauty product sales and customers have increased, and now she sells various well-known brands of beauty products. She gets up very early to do her household chores, then she dedicates herself to selling products. She sells to customers house to house and also from her home.

With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos for 1,500 Soles (approximately US $502.00), which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy a large quantity of beauty products (500 Soles in 5 fragrances, 8 powders, 5 lotions, 10 deoderants, 15 creams, 4 shampoos, etc.), all of which will help her have a good supply of stock.

María is very happy to have her 11 healthy children and to have achieved that they have finished their studies. The older children now have their own families but she still has to educate the youngest children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Esmeraldas, AA. HH. San Juan Ucayali Pasaje José Balta S/N, del Distrito de Calleria del departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre de 11 hijos, su esposo es agricultor, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que María, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en productos de belleza.

A la fecha, la venta de productos de belleza ha incrementado así como su clientela, ahora vende productos de belleza de varias marcas conocidas, se levanta muy temprano para atender las labores de la casa, luego de ello se dedica a la venta de sus productos. La venta la realiza casa por casa pero también atiende a sus clientes en su propio domicilio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500 (US$ 502.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza (S/. 500.00 en 5 fragancias, 8 talcos, 5 lociones, 10 desodorantes, 15 cremas, 4 champúes, etc.), todo esto le servirá para contar con un buen stock.

María está muy contenta de tener a sus 11 hijos sanos y haber logrado que terminen sus estudios. Los mayores ya tienen familia pero aun falta educar a los más pequeños.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products (cosmetics and perfumes)

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en: Teddy is 43 years old. Her current business is brick-making and selling her own bricks. She wants to use the profits from her business to construct a bigger house.

loans.use: To make and burn more bricks

loans.name: Aliagha

texts.en: Aliagha F. is a 56 year old man, married, with four children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He owns and operates a small butcher shop. Aliagha established his business last year, and he does not have many customers. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $1100, and he plans to purchase some sheep and sell the meat at his butcher shop. He thinks this loan will help his business be very successful.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Having to support her children made Flor rent a small stand in the market and begin selling food. In those days she was having serious problems in her marriage.

For 4 years now Flor gets up very early to begin her sales during breakfast hours. This is what she does every morning, sell her most requested dishes, red noodles and ceviche. She alone, with her 12 year-old sister’s help, tends to her stall. Although she incurred costs to start her business, she says that it has been worthwhile and today she is motivated to work as she now has a newborn son.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La necesidad de mantener a sus hijos llevó a Flor a alquilar un pequeño puesto en el mercado y a empezar a vender comida. En aquel momento pasaba serios problemas en su matrimonio.

Desde hace cuatro años Flor amanece muy temprano para empezar con sus ventas a la hora del desayuno. Es así que todas sus mañanas transcurren vendiendo sus platos más requeridos, tallarines rojos y ceviche. Ella sola, con la ayuda de su hermana de doce años atiende su puesto. Aunque le costo empezar, dice que todo valió la pena y hoy tiene más motivos por el cual trabajar ya que acaba de dar a luz un nuevo hijo.

loans.use: Buy a larger stove and food supplies.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Sr. Justo A. is 56 years old, and his wife, Sra. Blanca González, is 47 years old. They have four young children. They live together in a house that he managed to build after a great deal of effort.

Sr. Justo makes planters, tables, and laundry tubs out of stones. He makes these products by cutting and working with the stones. His wife has a nursery where she sells various kinds of plants that she also delivers to her customers.

They tell us that the income from these activities is used to give their children a better quality of life. The money was also used to complete the construction of their house that at the moment also serves as their place of work.

Sr. Justo’s dream is for his children to complete their education and become professionals. He is asking for a loan to buy cement and stones.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Justo A. de 56 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Blanca González de 47 años, tienen cuatro hijos menores de edad y todos viven juntos en una casa que logro construir con mucho sacrificio.

Don Justo se dedica a la fabricación de macetas, mesas y lavaderos de piedra. Justo elabora estos productos tallando y trabajando las piedras, su esposa tiene un vivero donde comercializa plantas de distintas variedades y se encarga de la distribución de los mismos.

Ellos nos cuentan que gracias a los ingresos que adquirieron de estas actividades logrorom dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y construir su casa en donde hoy día también constituye su local comercial.

Sueña que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios y llegar a ser profesionales. Solicita el préstamo para compra de cemento y piedras.

loans.use: Purchase cement and stone

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam K. is 29 year old resident of Kinondoni in Dar Es Salaam. She runs a tie and dye-making store, which she has been doing for five years. She makes traditional attire, commonly known as vitenge, at her store and usually bought by ladies. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her traditional clothing business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou S., aged 58, is married with three children in her care, and has been a member of the Manguiline Santhiaba Village Bank in Bignona for seven years. She sells fans and pearls that she buys in Ndiassane. Fatou wants to strengthen her business. With her income she provides for herself and contributes towards the family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou S., 58 ans, mariée, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Santhiaba à Bignona depuis 7 ans. Elle vend des éventails et des perles qu’elle achète à Ndiassane. Fatou veut renforcer son commerce. Avec ses revenus elle se prend en charge et participe aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Business selling fans and pearls

loans.name: Salafai

texts.en: Salafai U., 72, is married with eight children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business growing taro, yams, and bananas. She sells to the village and general public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD).  SPBD loans are Salafai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve her business and help out with family expenses.

loans.use: Salafai would like to make home improvements and pay for her kids' school fees.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort C. sells Banku, a local meal which she prepares for public sale. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a farmer but does not earn enough money to support the family. Demand for Comfort's goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business in order to increase her profits.

She is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her Banku business.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.es:
Asteria tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que cursan estudios universitarios, vive junto a su esposo. 
Desde hace 12 años, se dedica a la venta de medicinas, negocio en el que le va muy bien y atiende casi durante todo el día, recibiendo el apoyo de su esposo Mariano, quien es médico. . Gracias a este negocio está solventando los gastos de la universidad de sus hijos, le gusta su trabajo porque puede tratar con muchas personas, sobre todo darles una buena atención y acogida. Como para toda madre, para Asteria es difícil tener lejos a sus hijos (por la universidad) y no verlos a diario. 
Con el dinero del préstamo quiere ampliar e implementar su negocio, posteriormente, junto a su esposo, tener un consultorio médico.
texts.en:
Asteria is 47 years old, and she has two children that are currently attending college. For the past 12 years she has been selling medicines, a business that she attends most of the day and in which she gets the support from her husband, Mariano, who is a doctor . Thanks to this business she is able to provide for her sons' education. She likes her work because she gets to talk to people, and she is able to provide them good attention and care. For Asteria it is very difficult (like for any mother) to be apart from her children, and to not see them daily. With the money that she will get from the loan she would like to expand her business so that later on she can open a medical practice with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount and variety  of the medicines that she sells, and in the future open a medical practice.

loans.name: Mrs. Phum Pheng's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phum P.'s Village Bank has 14 members and each will use their loan for different purposes. The members live in Peareach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Phun P., president of the village bank and leader of this loan group, owns a small grocery store in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Oak Sam Art, is a farmer who now faces a small problem because his plantation field has infertile soil which has reduced crop yields. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Phun P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for the field. Mrs. Phun P. is 28 years old and does not have children.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her husband's farm land

loans.name: Loa

texts.en:
Loa V., 55, is a widow and lives with two of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 1998, she has been working selling food to earn a living and is able to make US$ 6 each day. One of her children is married and one stays at home and helps manage the housework.

Loa would like to take out a loan of US$ 200 to install a public phone for extra profit. She will purchase a few cell phones with different lines of companies to serve the people in the area. In Cambodia, some people purchase a small booth and then install many kinds of phone lines to serve people. Normally, they charge US 10-15 cents per minute.

loans.use: To install a phone line.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn O. is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Evelyn sells foodstuffs and she has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Evelyn appreciates the efforts of Kiva lenders in eradicating poverty. She says "thank you" to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lufuka C- Nansubuga Aisha Group

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 28 years old. She is a single mother of two and a hardworking and polite person. She sells charcoal and also fries snacks like cassava chips, mandazi, pancakes, and samosas in Lufuka. Her businesses are still at a crawling stage and hence earn her UGX 50,000 per week. From the profits, she pays rent of UGX 15,000 per month.

She would use this loan to boost her business by purchasing more sacks of charcoal and also stocking some matooke for sale. Her dreams are to sell second-hand clothes in Owino market, educate her children, and build a decent home for them.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal and stock some matooke to sell.

loans.name: Marithza

texts.en:
Marithza is a member of the Paraíso (Paradise) Village Bank. Marithza is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Marithza sells catalog cosmetics on credit to her family and friends. Marithza also travels to different markets to sell sweets. Marithza needs a loan of 600 soles to buy cosmetics. Marithza dreams of building her own house, of having a store, and of going to school to study accounting.  
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Marithza es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Marithza es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, Marithza vende cosméticos por catálogos a amigos familiares al crédito. Además Maritza viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde vende golosinas.
Marithza necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
Los sueños de Marithza son construir su casa, tener una tienda y estudiar contabilidad.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou S. est une brave commerçante qui tient un shop au marché central Saint Maures des Fossés. Cette veuve vend divers articles et entretient sa famille.
Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is an honest tradeswoman with a shop in the Saint Maures des Fossés central market. She is a widow supporting her family, and she sells various items. Madame S. is requesting this loan to grow her business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 39 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la casa de su suegra. El arte del bordado siempre fue lo que le llamaba la atención desde jovencita, tuvo la oportunidad de trabajar bordando hace 4 años desde que conoció a su mejor amiga, quien le enseñó esta labor y la impulsó para trabajar bordando prendas para exportación, pues todos los días tienen grandes cantidades pedidos que realizar. Desde entonces, viene trabajando todos los días dentro de su hogar donde puede sentirse cómoda junto a sus seres queridos. Lo difícil de su trabajo es cumplir con las grandes cantidades de prendas pues es muy cansado mantener su mano trabajando al mismo ritmo continuamente. Gladys espera que en el fututo pueda tener un taller de bordados, donde las máquinas puedan ayudarla a producir mayores cantidades de prendas. Hace 4 años que trabaja con MFP, y está muy contenta de formar tan bonito grupo de trabajo junto a sus amigas. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará para comprar mayor cantidad de materiales; como hilos y telas para sus bordados.
texts.en:
39-year old Gladys lives with her husband and two children in her mother-in-law’s house. The art of embroidery has always attracted her ever since she was a child. She got the opportunity to work in embroidery four years ago when she met her best friend who taught her how to do it. Her friend encouraged her to embroider clothes for export as they always have a large number of orders to complete. Since then, she has been working every day from her home where she feels comfortable close to her beloved family. The difficult part of her work is to complete the large number of clothing orders since it is very tiring for her hand to maintain the constant rhythm. Gladys hopes in the future to have her own embroidery workshop where machines can help her produce a larger quantity of clothing. Four years ago she started working with Kiva partner MFP and is very happy to be part of such a nice group and to be working alongside her friends. The money she is asking for will be used to buy a larger quantity of supplies such as thread and material for her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy embroidery supplies

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom S. is 24 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and two of her children. To earn a living, she sells vegetables in the local market, and she typically makes US$2.5 every day. Her husband operates a motor taxi business. On average, he earns US$3.5 profit per day. Mom S. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike so her husband can run a motor-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Logotaeao

texts.en: Logotaeao K., 45, is married with nine children. This loan is for bush knives, small taros, fertilizer, and chemicals for weed control. She has three years of experience selling to the general public, six days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (~245 USD). SPBD loans are Logotaeao’s only access to capital because she has  never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase bush knives, small taros, fertilizer, chemicals for weeds

loans.name: Wilber Javier

texts.es: Wilber Javier C. A. tiene la edad de 26 años, su estado civil es soltero. Wilber tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. El se dedica a la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio ofreciendo la venta de productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y frijoles. Ya que su negocio fue una herencia de su abuelo. Por lo que el principal negocio de Wilber es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ofreciéndoles lo que ellos solicitan. Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, bisutería y leche en bolsa. El deseo de Wilber es convertir su negocio en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Wilber Javier C. A. is 26 and single. He has 2 children, both in school. His business is a local store, which he has had for more than 6 years. Since he inherited his business from his grandfather, he started selling basic products such as rice, sugar, oil and beans. Now Wilber's primary business is satisfying the needs of his clients, giving them what they want. So he comes to Foundation Leon 2000 so that the contributing organizations can give him the help he needs. He is requesting working capital to buy basic grains, candies, carbonated and non-carbonated soft drinks, costume jewelry, and containers of milk. Wilber's ambition is to become a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Lucrecia, casada, de 54 años de edad, trabajadora del MINSA desde hace 14 años, esta solicitando su 9no credito el que sera utilizado para la construccion de un dormitorio, ya que no tiene las condiciones suficientes, su casa es de un proyecto aleman que ejecuto la iglesia catolica, pero esta era de madera, con sus creditos anteriores logro hacerla de concreto y construir cocina y letrina, ahora quiere ampliar con un cuarto para tener mas comodidad.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en un complejo lechero, sus hijos esta fuera del pais de quienes tambien recibe ayuda, de ellos dependo un nieto de 2 años quien ha estado al cuidado de ambos.  Se ha caracterizado por su responsabilidad y moral de pago, pues en sus creditos anteriores no ha presentado mora, y esta consciente que los creditos sirven de mucho, sobre todo a los asalariados que es su unica fuente economica, siempre ha preferido a AFODENIC por su buena atencion y calor humano.
texts.en:
Maria Lucrecia, married and 54 years old, has been working in MINSA for 14 years. She is requesting her 9th loan, which will be used to build a room since she doesn’t have enough space. Her house was originally from a German project implemented by the Catholic Church. It was, however, made of wood but with previous loans she managed to convert it to concrete as well as build a kitchen and bathroom. She now needs to expand by adding one room to live more comfortably. She counts on the support of her husband, who works at a dairy complex. Her children are outside of the country and also send assistance to her. She also supports a 2-year old grandson, who is in their care. She has characterized herself by being punctual and principled in her previous loan repayments, and she is conscious that the credits are a great deal of help to her. She has always preferred AFODENIC for its attentive service and kindness to people.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of a room.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester C. owns and operates a manicure and pedicure business for local community members at the same time as a RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing business. She is 42 years old, married and has two adult children. They are from the village of Katipunan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Ester has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ester joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Ester is now requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Valérie

texts.fr:
N. Valérie est née le 28 Avril 1975 à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Valérie est mariée à ZOHOUN Archille, un technicien en bâtiment. Valérie est mère de quatre enfants dont deux jumelles. Valérie a été à l’école jusqu’en classe CM2 c’est-à-dire le cours primaire. Ensuite, Valérie a appris la couture qu’elle a exercée pendant une deux ans. Valérie a abandonné la couture parce que ça ne lui permettait pas de subvenir à ses besoins.

Actuellement, Valérie vend de la friperie de façon ambulante. Valérie a déjà bénéficié e deux crédits de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ces crédits. Valérie a besoin de moyens  financiers pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de faire plus de revenus pour ses besoins. C’est pourquoi Valérie sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
N. Valérie was born on April 28, 1975 in Cotonou, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to ZOHOUN Archille, a building technician, and is the mother of four children, of whom two are twins. Valérie attended school through the 5th grade, that is, through primary school. Then she learned how to sew and did so for two years. She dropped sewing because it did not allow her to support herself. Currently, Valérie sells second-hand clothing door-to-door. She has already benefited from two loans with Alidé and has repaid them. Valérie needs funding to augment her working capital in order to produce more income for supporting herself. This is why she’s requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bale of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 48 years old and married to Cayetano.  They have four children, and three of them are already married.  Angelita hopes that she can access a loan amounting PHP 5,000 for the improvement of her vegetable vending business.  Managing her business gave her the opportunity to help her husband in uplifting their status of living. She wants her children to grow with a progressive and comfortable living.  She said that “with patience and unity, life can be meaningful and successful”.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Basiliana

texts.en:
Basiliana M. is 59, married with 10 children ranging from 14  to 40 years old and a resident of Old Fabrica in La Castellana, Negros Occidental.

Raising 10 children while depending on the income that her husband could generate made life very hard of Basiliana and her family. When a friend invited her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000, she was very apprehensive because she did not want to be in debt, but she was determined to help her family, so with the agreement of her husband, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon and with her first loan she started a small general store and to make sure that she could pay back her loan she went around her community selling specialty goods house to house. The business nets around PHP1,600.00 ($33) per month, but is able to feed her family.

She has used subsequent loans to slowly but steadily build her business. Now on her 11th loan cycle, the PHP 15,000 she is borrowing will allow her to widen the variety of goods that she could sell in her store. She continues to strive hard to provide for her family and dreams that all her children will have a more comfortable life.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: additional inventory and working capital for the borrower's General Store

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
U. Shahnoza is 22-years old, married and the loving mother of three children. She works purchasing and reselling cows with her husband. She would like to request a loan of $800 USD in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. Shahnoza believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business in order to purchase additional cows and increase their income further. You could become an important part of Shahnoza family's life and she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su familia y lo que más desea es darles una buena calidad D. vida. El puesto D. venta D. zapatos D. Ana está ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donD. se hacen ferias en la ciudad D. Juliaca), pero ella no sólo se dedica a vender calzados, sino que también los confecciona, es muy buena realizando su trabajo, motivo por el cual también reparte sus calzados a otras vendedoras. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es confeccionar los zapatos, por lo cual le pone mucho empeño, lleva 11 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los zapatos hasta los puestos D. venta, ya que tiene que visitar muchos puestos. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda muy granD. donD. pueda vender los zapatos que confecciona. Es el cuarto préstamo D. Ana con MFP, ella ha pagado puntualmente sus anteriores créditos y este último espera pagarlo a tiempo también, en su banco comunal es muy participativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales para confeccionar una mayor cantidad D. zapatos.
texts.en:
Ana, 41, is a very hard working woman. She lives with her family in her own house. What she wishes for the most is to give them a good quality of life. Ana’s stall for selling shoes is located in the Laguna Temporal plaza (place where there are fairs in the city of Juliaca). But, she does not just sell shoes. She also makes them. She is very good at her work, which is why she also distributes her footwear to other sellers. What she likes the most about her work is making shoes, which she does with much effort. She has been doing this for 11 years. The most difficult part is transporting the shoes to the sales locations because she has to go to many locations. In the future she hopes to have a very large store where she can sell the shoes she makes. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has paid her previous loans punctually. She expects to pay this last one on time as well. She is very active in her community bank. She will use the 2,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy new materials to make a larger quantity of shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for making shoes

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 36 years old and married with two children. She is a tailor and has been in the business for some years. She is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase tailoring materials to sell. It will also help her to deliver prompt service. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi is 42 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells frozen foods like fish, beef, chicken, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Atoma

texts.en:
Atoma I. is currently in the business of selling maize flour at the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase Irish potatoes and onions to sell. Atoma is 35 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children who both go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy beans, simsim (sesame) and many other items to sell.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase Irish potatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a businesswoman who is now fifty years old. She is married and has three young children. Their family lives in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela.  As a mother, she dreams to give her children the education they deserve. For this reason, she is doing her part to provide for the needs of her children and to help them reach their dreams.

Estrella plants some vegetables in their backyard, which gives her a little source of income. She sells them in their village. Aside from that her family’s daily consumption of vegetables comes from her vegetable garden. In addition, she also manages a livestock business. Estrella is asking to borrow a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fertilizers for her vegetables and feed for her hogs. She hopes that this loan will be granted because it will be of big help towards the maintenance of her businesses.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy fertilizers and feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S. is a 30-year-old married mother who currently lives in the territory of Kampong Chhnang, Cambodia. Chan S. is married and blessed with two children. She is a local rice farmer who learned this business from her grandparents. Her husband currently works with her on the farm.  Chan S. will be using her first loan in order to purchase a motorcycle which will allow her and her family to commute to the fields and to town.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle which will allow her and her family to commute to the fields and to town.

loans.name: Kelly Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Kelly Ruth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas de la Molina II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y es madre de 02  hijos, que aun están a cargo de ella y estudian. 

La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza le motivó a implementar su propio negocio de Servicio de Internet, se inicio con  S/. 800.00 y día a día fue ganando clientela dado el buen trato que les brinda y el precio cómodo en la hora de servicio de Internet. Actualmente continúa con este negocio pero ya ampliando más cabinas y considerando la demanda que tiene entre sus clientes que generalmente son adolescentes y vecinos del barrio donde vive. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará computadoras, para implementarlo mas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en cables,  para mejorar su cableado de red con canaletas, para dar un buen servicio y seguridad.

Kelly Ruth, manifiesta que trabaja con mucho optimismo, agradeciendo la oportunidad de contar con préstamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Kelly Ruth belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Brisas de la Molina II”, in the Banda district of Shilcayo, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is in a common-law union, she is 29 years old and a mother of 2 children, who are still dependent upon her and studying.

The strength and perseverance that are so characteristic of her motivated her to start her own Internet Service business. She began with S/. 800.00 and day by day she attracted her clientele, given the good treatment and affordable price per hour of Internet service she provides. Nowadays she continues with this business, but has increased the number of booths because of the demand she has among her clients, who generally are teenagers and live in her neighbourhood.

With this loan of S/. 1,500.00 she will purchase computers to further expand her business. Part of the money will also be invested in cables, to improve her network wiring with cable racks, in order to provide a good service and safety.

Kelly Ruth says that she works with a lot of optimism, and she is grateful for the opportunity of having loans available that help her grow both as a woman and a small entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of computer accesories

loans.name: Edoe

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a appris l’électronique, en 2000 après sa formation il a ouvert sa propre boutique où il fait la réparation d’appareils électroniques et le vente d’antennes paraboliques, beaucoup de gens lui font confiance à cause de la qualité de ses services. En ce moment il a besoin de quelques matériaux pour son commerce, il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour pouvoir acheter des accessoires et 08 antennes paraboliques.
Il est marié et père de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman trained in electronics and after his studies ended in 2000 he opened his own store where he repairs electronics and sells satellite dishes. Many people trust him because of the high quality service he provides. He currently requires some materials for his business. He is therefore requesting a WAGES loan so that he can purchase electronic accessories and eight satellite dishes. He is married and the father of three children.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of electronics and satellite dishes

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “El Progreso” (The Progress) is comprised of fifteen male and female members dedicated to their respective small businesses. The members sell items such as used clothing, cosmetics, lingerie, perfumes, toys, and hair accessories.

The members of “El Progreso” are from Linares, a city in the Maule region of central Chile. Linares is a city of vibrant commercial activity and has developed as an important center of exports, particularly because of their wine production. Nevertheless, the region is one of the poorest in Chile.

This loan will be invested in merchandise by the “El Progreso” group, in order to increase their supplies and earnings.

Marcela, a representative of the group, is pictured in the front row in a black athletic suit with a fuchsia colored T-shirt. She sells underwear and socks for men, and like the other members of the group, she sells them from a stall on one of the main streets in the city of Linares. These stalls are free to use, as they have been constructed by the government for the use of small business owners.

Marcela’s dream is to achieve economic stability for her family and to continue funding her children’s education, while also caring for her two-year-old nephew.

For Marcela, Fondo Esperanza has been the motivating force behind her business’s growth because, before the loans, Marcela never had the funding to grow her business. Also, Marcela believes she has benefitted greatly from the training courses that are taught at their weekly communal bank meetings.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo habita en el municipio del Coral,  tiene un año de laborar como responsable de Planificaciòn  de la Alcaldia del Coral Chontales, este joven esta felizmente casado tiene dos hijos menores de edad, su esposa  cuida de sus hijos y de los quehaceres del Hogar, esta solicitando su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para ser invertido en mejora de su vivienda, poniendo el piso de su casa y reparando una parte que se encuentra dañada.  Jairo sueña con un porvenir mejor para su familia, tener una casa bonita con mejores condiciones para su familia, según referencias lo consideran como un hombre responsable,  honesto y de buenos valores morales.
texts.en:
Jairo lives in Coral and has worked for the last year in the planning department of the Coral Chontales mayor's office. He is happily married and has two minor children. His wife cares for their children and tends to household chores. He is asking AFODENIC for his first loan do do some home inprovements; he wants to install flooring in his home and to repair a section that is damaged. Jairo dreams with providing a better future for his family, to have a pretty house with better condiditons for his family. According to references, he is considered to be a responsible, honest man with good moral values.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Floor repair.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria Magdalena es una mujer que es emprendedora y trabajadora hace poco inicio su negocio en el que vende abarrotes, refrescos, botanas y mas. La tienda es llamada “Miscelánea Popeye”. La señora María apoya a su marido con lo gasto familiares, el señor trabaja en un maquiladora para seguir supliendo las necesidades económicas que se aproximen. El negocio esta muy surtido y esta en lugar donde la gente lo pueda ver, solo que ahora ella quiere comprar mas mercancía para tener variedad en artículos.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is a resourceful and hardworking woman. She recently launched her own business, where she sells groceries, refreshments, snacks, and more. The store is called “Miscelánea Popeye”. María assists her husband with the household expenses. He works in a factory to meet their economic needs as they arise. The store is well-stocked, and it is in a highly visible location. The only thing that María wants now is to buy more merchandise in order to have a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María G. D. C. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en Cojutepeque, pueblo ubicado en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como mecánico automotriz y junto a sus dos hijos D. 23 y 15 años D. edad, D. los cuales el mayor trabaja y el segundo se dedica a estudiar.  Ana María posee un negocio propio en el cual se encarga D. elaborar y vender pupusas, uno D. los platillos típicos salvadoreños que tienen mayor demanda por parte D. las personas D. este lugar. Su negocio está ubicado en las afueras D. su casa D. habitación, en donD. cada día Ana saca D. su hogar la cocina, mesas, sillas y todos los utensilios necesarios para iniciar su trabajo. Ella es una mujer con mucha experiencia, ya que posee 10 años D. realizar este oficio, razón por la cual posee muchos clientes, los cuales prefieren sus pupusas ya que es una persona la cual se ha ganado la confianza D. sus clientes. Ana María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz, frijoles, chicharrón y queso, los cuales son la materia prima para la elaboración D. las pupusas, así mismo desea surtir el negocio con bebidas heladas y calientes, esto con el fin D. que las personas no solo compren su productos para llevar a sus casa, sino también para que ellas opten por comer en el lugar, esto le brindaría  muchos beneficios a María puesto que aumentaría sus ventas los cual es D. mucha ayuda para su economía familia, la cual necesita mejorar en gran manera.
texts.en:
Ana María G. D. C., age 60, lives in Cojutepeque, a village located in the Cuscatlán department. She lives with her husband; he works as an auto mechanic. They have two children, ages 23 and 15. The older child works, and the second one goes to school. Ana María has her own business making and selling “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables). It is one of the typical Salvadorian dishes that is in the most demand by people here. Her business is located outsiD. of her house. Everyday Ana takes the stove, tables, chairs, and all of the necessary utensils from her house to her business outsiD. in order to start her work. She is a woman with a lot of experience; she has been doing this work for ten years. That is why she has a lot of customers. They prefer her pupusas because she has won her customers’ confidence. Ana María is asking for a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of corn, beans, pork rinds, and cheese. Those are the raw materials to make the pupusas. She also wants to stock her business with cold and hot drinks. This is so that people not only buy her products to take home, but they also opt to eat at her place. This will proviD. many benefits to María. It will increase her sales, and this is a big economical help to the family. The family needs to greatly improve their economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, cheese, rice, and beans

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.es: Baltazar M. T. de 39 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en  el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por tres niñas las cuales se encarga de estudiar. Beltazar es un hombre muy trabajador quien se esfuerza por salir adelante, y que se dedica a la reparación de electrodomesticos, tales como televisores, radios, ventiladores y otros más, contando con muchos clientes los cuales lo buscan por su excelente servicio. Así mismo su esposa se dedica a la venta de tortillas, la cual así mismo esta ubicada en  departamento de La Libertad, es de esta manera en como Baltazar logra solventar todos los gastos del hogar, razón por la cual aprecia mucho su trabajo y solicita un préstamo a Integral con el fin de poder obtener el dinero necesario para comprar todo lo esencial para su negocio.
texts.en:
Baltazar M. T., age 39, lives in Arce City, which is located in the La Libertad department. He lives with his family, which is comprised of three girls who are in school. Batlazar is a very hard-working man who puts forth great effort to get ahead. He repairs home appliances like televisions, radios, fans, and other things. He has a lot of customers who seek him out because of his excellent service. His wife sells tortillas in the La Libertad department. This way Baltazar can pay all of the household expenses. That is why he really appreciates the work. He is asking Integral for a loan to buy everything he needs for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for home appliances

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Soth L., age 39, is married and resides with her husband in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She has no children. She is employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a farmer growing rice and earning an income of $3 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses. 

L. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a mechanical plow to help with the farming business. By doing so, she hopes that her husband will be able to produce more output from his farmland. This is L.’s first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: Buy a mechanical plow

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, popularly called Emma, is truly a hard worker. He is 33 years old and sells building materials like plywood, nails, carpentry tools, paint etc. to customers in his neighborhood in Kumasi. Emma has been operating his trade for ten years and is eager to be taking out this loan. He plans to use this loan to add the sale of cement to expand his product line. It is the dream of almost every Ghanaian to own his own house which makes selling building materials profitable, Emma said.

Emmanuel is married to a woman who is also a trader. They have three children from age 1 – 7 years. He says that his wife dreams of being able to generate enough profits that they will be able to educate their children to at least the tertiary school level.

loans.use: To purchase cement, plywood, nails, carpentry tools, etc.

loans.name: Wilde Evelio

texts.es:
El Sr. Wilde está casado con la Sra. Margarita hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos Menores que aún están cursando la escuela primaria.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como asalariados. 
Además de la despensa tienen una actividad principal que es la de pasero (traslado de mercaderías del Brasil a Paraguay) y vendedor ambulante en la frontera, el señor es el  encargado de esa actividad ya que tienen más experiencia. 
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando Educan a sus hijos y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilde has been married to Sra. Margarita for several years. They have four young children who are enrolled in elementary school. Together they established a food pantry in their home, which is located in one of the most populated neighborhoods in the district. They started with a small amount of capital and continued to work other jobs as salaried employees.

In addition to the food pantry, Wilde has another business in which he works as a “pasero” (someone who transports merchandise from Brazil to Paraguay) and as a traveling merchant along the border. He is in charge of managing this business because he has the most experience. Thanks to his work he has been able to provide his children with an education and purchase all the household necessities.

He is requesting a loan to purchase a vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle for his traveling sales business

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Abejitas Trabajadoras.
Gregoria es soltera, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Gregoria tiene un puesto en el mercado de las Americas en donde vende artículos plásticos, como bolsas y también reparte a tiendas. Además Gregoria vende vino que compra en la ciudad de Ica.
Gregoria necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bolsas y vinos.
Los sueños de Gregoria son mejorar su negocio, construir su casa con material noble y brindar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the "Abejitas Trabajadoras" (Working Bees) communal bank. She is 36 years old, single and has 4 children. Gregoria has a stand in the Americas market where she sells plastic items like bags; she also distributes them to stores. In addition, she sells wine that she buys in the city of Ica. Gregoria needs a 1500 sol loan to buy bags and wine. Gregoria's dreams are to build her house with substantial materials and to provide an education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic bags and wine.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en: Elisabeth R. is a 66-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Bagawines, Vallehermoso, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and an eatery. Elisabeth’s husband, Ernesto, is a 71-year-old retired employee and they have seven children who are between 30 and 47 years old. Six of her children have their own families while one is still single and works to help support the family. Elisabeth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store and an eatery business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 3,000 from her business activities. Elisabeth is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 8,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and eatery business and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now, she is borrowing Php 10,500 as her 17th loan which she intends to use as additional capital for her general store and eatery business. Elisabeth is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida tiene 37 años D. edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos D. los cuales solo dos viven con ella, radica junto a su familia en el sector Santa Rosa del distrito agrícola D. Cayaltí, un distrito que actualmente experimenta un crecimiento comercial moderado, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales desD. hace mas D. cinco años, generalmente cría aves D. corral en la parte posterior D. su domicilio y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo, las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona para adquirirlas y revenderlas en el mismo distrito D. Cayaltí o en la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, el trabaja como obrero agrícola en una empresa agroindustrial D. la zona y juntos tratan D. sacar adelante a su hogar.

Nelida desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento para que estos logren un buen desarrollo D. modo que pueda venderlos a un mejor precio y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 600 nuevos soles.

Nelida es una mujer trabajadora y hogareña, ella diviD. su tiempo entre el cuidado D. sus animales y las tareas D. su casa. En la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer D. confianza.
texts.en:
Nelida is 37 years old and married; she has four children, only two of which live with her. She lives with her family in the Santa Rosa sector of the agricultural district Cayaltí, an area that currently is undergoing moderate commercial growth. Cayaltí is located about one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Nelida has been raising and selling of animals for more than five years; she generally raises poultry birds in the back part of her house. When the birds have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to businesspeople who visit the area to buy the birds and sell them either right in Cayaltí or in the city of Chiclayo. Her income from this activity serves to help her husband with family expenses. He is a worker in an industrial agriculture company in the area, and together they try to get give their family a good quality of life. Nelida wishes to expand her business buy purchasing more animals, and also by purchasing food for the animals so that they can develop better; she could then sell them at a better price and see more earnings. To achieve this goal, she is applying for a loan from Edpyme for the first time. She is asking for a credit of 600 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately 225 USD). Nelida is a good, hard-working woman. She divides her time between the city and her animals and household tasks. In the zone where she lives, her neighbors and friends consider her to be very trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals and food for the expansion of a poultry enterprise

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
M. is a married woman with four children, all adults. Her husband is a businessman and he supports his family financially. She has been operating her food stall for over ten years, selling samosa (fried or baked triangular-shaped pastry shells) filled with spicy potatoes and peas. She sells in a shop and from home to her neighbors and passersby.

With the 30,000 KES loan she wants to start another business, selling cosmetics.

M. faces the challenges of high transport costs and seasonality. She hopes to have a wholesale shop in the future. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity.

loans.use: To start a cosmetic shop.

loans.name: Melgin

texts.en:
Melgin E. is from the village of Burgos. He is 23 years old and is single. Melgin owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP whenever he sells a raised animal.

In 2010, Melgin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Melgin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es: Martha Beatriz R. García de 53 años es una mujer trabajadora que ha dedicado toda su vida a la lucha por superarse y subsistir, ella ha desempeñado muchas actividades de comercio en el pasado pero hace 7 años decidió iniciar una pulpería con algunos cuantos productos, hoy en día, además de tener dicho negocio, también vende ropa, cosméticos, vende fritanga de jueves a domingos y elabora pasteles por encargo. En sus distintas actividades le ayudan 3 de sus 8 hijos los cuales tiene las edades de 25 (mujer), 14 y 12 años (varones). Su objetivo con el crédito es surtir más el negocio y su meta es hacer mejoras en la casa.
texts.en:
Martha Beatriz, 53 years old, is a hardworking woman who has dedicated her life to the struggle of supporting herself and making a better life for herself. She has been involved in many different commercial activities in the past but seven years ago she decided to open a local convenience store to sell a few products. Today, besides having her business she also sells clothing, cosmetics, "fritanga" (a local type of restaurant that sells assorted fried foods) from Thursday to Sunday and bakes cakes by the order. Three of her eight children help her in her different activities. They are 25 (daughter), 14 and 12 (sons) years old. Her goal for this loan is to diversify her business. Her aspiration is to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Petronila Emilia

texts.es: La  Sra. Petronila Emilia L. C.  ella es Trabajadora del colegio público Farabundo Martí Villa el Carmen desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene veinte y cuatro  años de trabajar para el Magisterio es casada actualmente, tiene dos  niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno  los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Petronila Emilia L. C. is an employee of the Farabundo Martí Villa el Carmen public school where she works a primary school teacher; she has worked in education for twenty-four years. Petronila is married and has two school-age children. Petronila has had six loans with CEPRODEL which she used for the purchase of construction materials and for making improvements to her home. The CEPRODEL loans have been of great help to Petronila and have allowed her to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sand, cement, gravel, stone

loans.name: Kunduz's Group

texts.en:
Kunduz T. 20, is not married yet. She is the leader of the group. The family funds are enriched with the help of herself and her parents working. They breed cattle. Kunduz makes an income by selling bottles. The very first salary gave her an opportunity to buy two sheep. She needs a loan in order to buy a calf. In the future she wants to increase cattle stock.

Azat N., 24, is a bachelor. Together with his brother, they have stayed in their homeland, whereas their parents went to Russia. Today Azat is a casino security guard in Bishkek. He has managed to achieve some results: he has equipped his house. Besides his basic job, the young man is earning money additionally by cattle breeding. He needs a loan in order to buy a calf. In future he is planning to increase his cattle stock.

Gulperi N., 20, is not married. She works in a company “Abdysh-ata”, which produces bottles. Four years ago her parents had presented her with a calf. Since that time, she has been breeding cattle. The loan purpose is to buy one more calf for increasing stock. 

Aziza K., 23, is not married. She earns her livelihood by working in a privately owned enterprise, which sells coffee. Last year she received money (5000 soms ) as a birthday gift from her parents. She bought a sheep and since that has been breeding cattle. Her brother has helped her to run her small business. Out of the proceeds she has managed to buy some household appliances. The loan purpose is to buy a calf. Aziza wants to increase cattle stock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf.

loans.name: Zuura

texts.en:
Zuura T. is 57, married and has two children. Zuura was born in Tadjikistan, in a large family where all children helped their parents farm. At the age of 21, she got married and moved to her husband’s place.
 
In 1993, in order to find better life for their children, Zuura and her husband moved to the Kara-Dobo village in Kyrgyzstan. They began to engage in cattle breeding and managed to multiply their cattle to two cows and two calves. However, there wasn’t an appropriate infrastructure in the Kara-Dobo village and Zuura’s family relocated to the town of Kara-Balta. Here, Zuura became the main holder of her small farm, which today needs to be developed. As a result, Zuura is applying for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy one milk cow and sheep. With the revenues from this investment, she plans to broaden her business by purchasing more cattle for fattening. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that aim to increase employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow and sheep

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria R. is from the village of Mapulog, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old, married and has 2 adult children. Candelaria owns & operates a food production/sales business where she sells homemade products like alamang or shrimp paste. She is currently a barangay (village) captain in Mapulog, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. Candelaria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Candelaria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S., age 35 and a married woman, is the group leader, having been selected by the four members, located in Ta Kdol village in Kandal province.  Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.

S. earns her living through selling her Khmer cake in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Prum Sopheak, 32 years old, works as Khmer taxi trailer driver in the local village. With both their occupations, they are able to earn some income to support their family. Now her husband's trailer is old, and she wants to exchange it for a new one, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy a new trailer for her husband's transportation business. This couple has two children: one is attending the local school while the younger one is just 7 months old.

loans.use: To buy a new trailer for her husband's transportation business

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna E. is married and lives in Purok Bombills, Brgy Old Sagay, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running two business: selling ready-to-wear clothes and raising pigs. Her husband, Basilio Endona Jr., is 39 years old and works in construction. They have a child who is five years old. Luna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she wanted to improve her family's life. With the help of six previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luna has been slowly lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. She has applied for a seventh loan, for PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to stock her clothing store. Her long-term goals are to expand her business and repair her house. Luna E. is a Dungganon (or honorable) woman who is following an honest path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable).
