Her weekly net income in her store is PHP300. They have also a half-hectare of rice farm, which is being manage by her husband. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 from KIVA lenders for additional capital in her business. She will use the funds mainly for buying stocks of commodities such as detergent soap, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks and many other products. 

She is married to Aurelio Q., who works as a farmer and a tricycle driver. They have been blessed with a son, named Niloor Bonnil, who is only 4 years of age. They are harmoniously residing at the rural area of Sta. Maria, Alicia, Isabela. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her request of a loan to help her husband in earning money to support their daily needs.

loans.use: Additional capital for buying more commodities for her retail store.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthorn N. is a villager in the village of Trapeang Srangae in Takeo Province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery products to sell. Her husband, Mr. Maen Chan, uses electricity to charge a battery for income. Mrs. Chanthorn N. is 42 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is working in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Motorcycle transport is the primary source of income for Nida and her husband in the village of Barangay Capatan Tuguegarao, City. Aside from her transport business, Nida is also engaged in selling fruits and vegetables as an additional source of income. Carlos, her husband, is the one who operates their motorcycle business to earn an income for their daily basic needs.
For the continuous development of their transport business, Nida is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 from KIVA lenders. She hopes that her loan will again be approved to enable her to repair her motorcycle to keep it working. She will also use some of the loan for her vending business.

The couple is working double time for the welfare of their children. They hope that their children will finish their college degrees.

loans.use: To maintain her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Sotoewa

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère d’un enfant, l’activité qu’elle exerce est le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, son époux est un chauffeur et son revenu ne lui permet pas de couvrir toutes les charges de la famille, avec  son revenu elle apporte sa contribution financière à son foyer. Elle veut profiter des fêtes de fin d’année pour bien vendre, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour compléter son stock avec 15 boîtes de tomates, 3 paniers de tomates naturel et 5 cartons de pâtes alimentaires.
texts.en:
This woman is married and has a child and she buys and sells food. Her husband is a chauffeur but his income does not cover all the family expenses. With her income she contributes to the home finances. She wishes to take advantage of the holidays to improve her sales, therefore she is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to complement her stock with 15 cans of tomatoes, 3 baskets of fresh tomatoes and 5 boxes of pasta.

Translated from French by caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food (tomatoes and pasta)

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Mrs.Trinidad O. is from the village of Calaran in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. She is married and blessed with only one school-aged child. Trinidad is a church worker earning 500 Php per month. Trinidad and her husband are also busy working in a farm in their own cultivated riceland. She has been engaged on her business activities for more than 10 years now. She earned 7,000.00 monthly from the said business. In 1999, Trinidad joined PMPC to access the programs and services of the said Coop. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 30,000.00 PHP which will be used for additional capital of her existing project. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Trinidad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of farm inputs for her rice fields

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn C. is from the village of Salimpuno. She is 23 years old. Remelyn is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Remelyn owns & operates a store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Remelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Remelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Remelyn is requesting a new loan of 55,000 PHP, which will be used to fully pay for a transport vehicle to improve her business. She will also use the loan as additional capital for her mini grocery store. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Remelyn from PMPC and the second loan funded by Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To fully pay for a motorcycle

loans.name: Gerardo Modesto

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandaga, el señor Gerardo G. se dedica a trabajar arduamente en un centro de labores con el fin de obtener los ingresos para el beneficio propio de su familia y su casa de habitación que tanto necesita de él.
Actualmente el señor Gerardo está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de útiles escolares para sus dos pequeños hijos debido a que estos están en la escuela y él debe de mantenerlos para que se desarrollen y lleguen a ser grandes profesionales.
Espera confiadamente que el crédito será otorgado y a lo inmediato comprará los útiles escolares y también pagará la matricula de sus hijos para que estos estudien.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo G. works very hard at a work center in the Department of Chinandanga. His goal is to provide for his family, who depend on his earnings, and his home. Mr. Gerardo has requested this particular loan to buy school supplies for his two small children. They go to school and he supports and provides for them with the goal that they will become important professionals when they grow up. He will use the loan as soon as he receives it to buy school supplies and enroll the children in school.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies for his school age children

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev N., 47, has a business selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province. She earns approximately US$3 each day while her husband, who is a rice farmer, makes less than US$1 a day.

This couple has three children: one is a student and two are employed as garment factory workers. Khiev N. told a loan officer that every month she needs to spend around US$45 on food and US$15 on utilities.

Khiev N. has been making and selling brooms since 1998. Her brooms are made from a kind of long grass which grows in the forest.

Khiev N. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. This will help her children reduce transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her childen to use for commuting

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia T. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Tabao, Zone 2, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by engaging in a retail store selling dried fish, bananas and other products she she can sell. Julia’s husband works as a driver and also helps her in running the business. They have three children between 3 and 12 years old with two of them currently going to school and also helping out in the business as part of their daily chores. Julia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1989 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000 from her business activities. Julia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 25,000 was used to fund operations for her retail business which had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 25,000 for her 13th loan, which she intends to use in her retail business. Julia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additonal working capital

loans.name: Dem

texts.en: Dem C., age 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Daoun Keo District, Takeo province, Cambodia. She and her husband are in the business of selling chickens and ducks, earning a gross income of about USD 60 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has been improved since they have started this business. C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more chickens and ducks for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and ducks for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more indomie noodle, eggs and tea to sell.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Mariluz,  ella tiene 38 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 7  de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de lavar ropa de otras personas los fines de semanas, Nuestra socia es técnica en obstetricia pero por muchas diferentes razones no estaba ejerciendo su carrera, ahora ella está dispuesta a aperturar un consultorio obstétrico en su casa y el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en este nuevo proyecto.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our applicant is a member of the Cristo Moreno communal bank. She lives in the city of Cusco.

Sra. Mariluz is 38 years old and lives with her two children, ages 11 and 7. She alternates her household activities with a weekend job washing the clothes of other people. She is trained as a midwife but for a lot of different reasons has been unable to practice her profession.

Now, she has decided to open an obstetric office in her house, and she will invest the money she is applying for in this new project. Sra. Mariluz appreciates the support offered through the loan and promises to meet all her debt payments according to the established installments.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the opening of an obstetric office.

loans.name: Matias Modesto

texts.es:
Matías de 51 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su esposa vende legumbres. Ellos tienen un hijo de 25 años. Por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperante idea de tener dinero para mantener a su familia el invirtió todos sus ahorros en legumbres para vender afuera de su casa en el suelo (en Ecuador es muy común que la gente venda comida afuera de su domicilio).

Matías al ver que le iba bien en la venta de legumbres hizo una carpa de tablas y compro mas legumbres para vender, el ahora se mantiene en este negocio, su esposa para ayudarlo vende también legumbres en el mercado del suburbio. Ellos trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 14h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cebollas tomates y empezar a vender arroz para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Matías, 51, lives in an urban zone in El Suburbio, Guayaquil. His wife is a vegetable merchant. They have a 25-year-old son. Due to lack of employment opportunities and the maddening need to have money to maintain his family he invested all his savings in vegetables to sell on the ground outside his house (in Ecuador it is very common for people to sell food outside their homes). As Matías realized that the vegetable sales were good he built a shelter out of boards and bought more vegetables to sell. Now, he supports himself with this business and his wife helps him sell vegetables in El Suburbio’s market. They work from 5am until 2pm every day. He will use the loan to buy onions and tomatoes for his business and will start to sell rice too. In the future, he’d like to have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Onions, tomatoes, rice.

loans.name: Felicito

texts.en:
Felicito B. is from the village of Brgy, Gingoog City. He is 48 years old. Felicito is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Felicito owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Felicito has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felicito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Felicito is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Felicito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business and support his children's education.. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, de 44 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive sola en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es tener un mejor futuro. El puesto de comida de María es el más concurrido del mercado Asunción de la ciudad de Tarma, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su puesto para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 36 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que entran a su restaurante, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola.  Con el paso de los meses, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante y así tener más clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas ollas y utensilios, ya que los que usaba, se han deteriorado con el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
María is 44 years old and a hardworking responsible woman. She lives alone in the house of her parents and what she wants most is to have a better future. María operates a food establishment that is the most well-known in the Asunción Market in the city of Tarma. Every day her customers come by her business to taste the delicious food she prepares. She is an expert cook who developed a love for food at a very young age. Now she is very happy to be doing this line of work. What she enjoys most about her job is cooking because she does it with great care. María has been doing this for 36 years and considers the most difficult part to be attending to everyone who comes by her restaurant since she works alone most of the time. Within the next few months, she hopes to improve the infrastructure of her restaurant so that she can serve more customers.

This is her second loan with MFP. María expects to be prompt with her payments so that she can access more loans. In her Communal Bank, she is an extremely active participant. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy new pots and utensils since the ones she has now have deteriorated with use over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pots & utensils

loans.name: Pay As You Call Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Pay As You Call. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four children who range from 15 to 30 years old. She also cares for two siblings. She was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to lack of financial support.

For three years, Elizabeth has been selling charcoal in Congo Town community on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

Elizabeth describes herself as peaceful. Her dream is to improve her business, build a house, and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en:
Enkhbayar, S. is a humble, helpful and open-minded person. She is divorced and lives with her mother and 2 daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in a traditional Mongolian, nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter, Sodgerel, is 10 years old and attends secondary school. Her younger daughter, Khulan, is 5 years old and stays at home with her grandmother. 


Enkhbayar operates a taxi service in her town. She enjoys transporting people. She says, “I must be very responsible and careful when driving my car in order to provide a safe ride for my customers”. Also, she says, “The most important thing to me is to provide a good education for my children". 



She is requesting a loan to purchase four tires and other spare parts for her car.

loans.use: to purchase four tires and other spare parts for her car

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
T. Ngô Thị (20209050027) is a 59-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 4-member group L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Vọng Nguyệt nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).

T. is married and has 1 adult -aged child. She owns and operates a business raising livestock for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from it.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA. This previous L. was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new L. of 7,392,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the 4th L. taken out by T. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  Ngô Thị L. (0) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND L. to support her service-based business.

2.  Chu Thị X. (0) is a 59-year-old female who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.

3.  Ngô Thị T. (0) is a 57-year-old female who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20209050027) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vọng Nguyệt nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03 ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 25 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị L. (0) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  Chu Thị X. (0) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Ngô Thị T. (0) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Yaklin Yessica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, Provincia del Cusco y Departamento Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yaklin ; ella tiene 28 Años de edad y tiene 1 hijos. La socia alterna sus actividades con el arte ella es conviviente y se dedica a la venta de cuadros hechos en oleo, ella tiene un local frente a la escuela de bellas artes en el segundo piso, hay están expuestas las obras de pintores nuevos hechos en oleo. La socia quiere comprar marcos, pinturas.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pinturas y algunos marcos.

La socia agradece y valora esté préstamo el cual le permite realizar sus metas, La socia se compromete a cumplir el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Progreso (Progress) communal bank. This bank is located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Cusco Department. The member is Yaklin; she is 28 years old and has one son. The member divides her time between homemaking and art. She has a live-in partner, and her business is selling oil paintings. She has a second-floor shop in front of the fine arts school, where oil paintings by new painters are exhibited. The member wants to buy frames and paints. She is asking for the loan to buy paints and some frames. She is grateful for and values the loan, which will allow her to reach her goals. The member promises to pay off her loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paints and frames

loans.name: Angelita Paulina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y la calidez de su gente. Se  reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo.

La señora Angelita lleva en el Banco Comunal 16 años dice que le gusta porque dan los créditos sin muchos tramites y los intereses son bajos.

Mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, es una ama de casa que se da tiempo para hacer muchas cosas,  ya que además de atender su hogar también estudia párvulo en la Universidad Eloy Alfaro de Manta los Sábados Y Domingos.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa el cual inicio con uno de los créditos de la Fundación Espoir hace 10 años. Además elabora muñecas las mismas que vende a sus compañeras de la Universidad. Vende ropa 3 días a la semana en Jipijapa su tierra natal. La mercadería la compra en Guayaquil ya que allá salen más baratas y le dejan mejores ganancias.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar ropa de mujeres y ciertos productos para elaborar sus muñecas.7

Su sueño es ser una profesional y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich cultural and the quality of its people, members of the Community Bank Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo (With Love and Faith Toward Development) meet every 15 days. Angelita has been a member for the past 16 years and says she enjoys it because she gets the loan without many formalities and the interest rates are low. She lives with her partner and has two children. She is a housewife and spends her time doing many things because along with tending to her home she also is studying child care at the local university on Saturdays and Sundays. She has a business selling clothing, which she started with a loan from Kiva partner Fundación Espoir 10 years ago. She also makes dolls, which she sells to her classmates at the university. She sells clothing three days a week in Jipijapa, her hometown. She buys the merchandise in Guayaquil because it's cheaper there and gives her better profits. She plans to use this loan to purchase women's clothing as well as certain supplies to make her dolls. Her dream is to earn a degree and practice her profession.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase skirts, blouses, pants, dresses, fabric, buttons, thread, etc.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov P. has had a farming job for many years. She owns a piece of land where she plants various crops from which she always gets an income to serve the needs of her family. Pov P. has a life partner who works with her at the farm, and they have four children: one child is already married and the other three are single. 

Pov P. wishes to invest in another business. Through this new business, she believes she will be able to generate extra income to ensure that her family attains a better standard of living. Because she lacks money to use as capital, Pov P. has requested a loan from Kiva’s project partner so she can buy salt and fish paste to resell.

loans.use: To buy salt and fish paste

loans.name: Eloglan

texts.ru:
Eloglan A. 39 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, sin kotormu 10 let on uchitsya v shkole, i doch kotoroy 8 let ona uchitsya v shkole. Eloglan yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli region vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Eto uje vtoroy ssud Eloglana,  koqda on bral perviy loan on pomenyal svoy bizness, no uje proyda vremya on opat reshil zanatsya skotovodstvom potomu chto on tak lubit svoyu rabotu chto uje ne smoq bez neyo. Eloglan etomu bizneesu skotovodstva nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas Eloglan nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupi korovi.
texts.en:
Eloglan A. is 39 years old. He is married and has two children: a 10-year old son who attends school and an 8-year old daughter who is also in school. Eloglan is an Internally Displaced Person. He is a refugee from [the town of] Fuzuli. Now he lives in Fuzuli region with his family.

This is already Eloglan second loan. After taking out his first loan,  he had changed his line of business but after some time he decided to return to raising cattle again because he enjoys this work and cannot abandon it. He learned this trade from his father. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: Hab

texts.en: Hab C., 65, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. C. is a housewife while her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about USD $2.50 per day. One of her children is employed as a sale person for a private company, earning an income of about USD $3 per day. The family has to spend USD $33 on food, USD $10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD $15 on other necessary expenses every month.  C. is requesting a loan of USD $800 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s husband and son appear in the photograph because C. was not available.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Liwanag

texts.en:
Since joining ASHI, Liwanag B. has ventured into selling fish and a fishing business. The idea of having this kind of business crossed her mind when her husband who is also fisherman caught more fish in the lake, located in Talim Island, in the province of Rizal. Liwanag sold those in their neighborhood and she realized that selling fish earns profits bigger and faster than any other kind of business she had had in the past years of her life using her loan from ASHI. Unlike other products sold, fish is salable because it is one of the most basic needs of the human being, especially for people who live in very remote areas of the province. They are far from the municipal market thus the possibility of buying from vendors who come to their community is very high. Also, most people choose to buy fish rather than any other meat because it is cheaper and healthier.

From then on, Liwanag used her loans from ASHI in her fishing business. From the profits she earned, she was able to invest in her home and support her family financially, specially the tuition fees of her five children which are very expensive. 

She kept on borrowing from ASHI to keep her business growing. Now, she plans to use her newly received loan in buying additional materials needed for her fishing business such as fishing nets and other supplies so that her husband will catch more fish to sell. If ever the couple gets better output, they will be able to invest more in their home.

Her greatest dreams are for her four younger children to attain a degree, just like her eldest child, Raynan, who graduated from computer courses and has a successful job with the coastguard. Education is wealth that other people can’t steal. The couple believes that education is the only inheritance they can offer their children. To make this happen, they help each other in order for them to achieve their dreams of giving their children the best in life.

loans.use: purchase additional materials needed for her fishing business

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina G. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Rizalina is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Rizalina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting coconut for sale. Rizalina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Rizalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rizalina is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 26th loan taken out by Rizalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Jane Mweni

texts.en:
Jane Mueni, age 36, runs a retail shop at Mlolongo, which is a busy market. She sells her goods to the residents and customers on transit from Machakos town to Nairobi city. She is a single mother of three children, Annastacia aged 17 years in form 1, Stephen aged 15 years in class seven and Dominic aged 12 years in class six. She was introduced to KADET by another KADET client.

Jane has been running this business for a period of two years and gets a monthly profit of Kshs 2500. This loan of Kshs 20,000 is her second loan with KADET after serving the previous loan well. She intends to use Kshs 10,000 to buy sugar, Kshs 5,000 to buy rice and Kshs 5,000 will be used to buy other small goods like matchboxes e.t.c. If the loan boosts the business, Jane will start selling ballast and sand for a higher profit.

Jane, who describes herself as hardworking and focused, dreams of having a wholesale business and selling ballast and sand to building people.

loans.use: To increase her stock of sugar and rice.

loans.name: Eddy Santiago

texts.es:
Eddy es un padre de familia de cinco hijos, casado, siendo su oficio la compra y venta de reciclaje de plásticos desde hace ocho años, viene trabajando solo,  ya que anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa de reciclaje.
Cuando inicio lo hizo con poco capital lo que necesitaba más dinero para la inversión. Lo que  Afodenic da el apoyo mediante su préstamo lo que da otro giró en su negocio comprando más plástico.
Este es su segundo financiamiento lo que comprara materia prima en la compra de variedad de plástico para seguir aumentando sus niveles de ganancias.
Como planes es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para la ayuda económica de su familia que es lo primordial.
texts.en:
Eddy is married and has five children.  He has worked buying and selling plastic recyclables for eight years.  He works alone now, but he used to work for a recycling business.

When he started his business, he had little money and needed more capital to invest.  Afodenic supported him with a loan, which he invested in his business by buying more plastic products.

This is his second loan.  He will purchase a variety of plastic products to continue increasing his income.  

He plans to continue investing in his business because financially supporting his family is most important.

loans.use: Purchase plastic products to increase sales

loans.name: Vidra

texts.en:
Vidra is a 55-year-old married man blessed with three children. He is living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.He has had a retail shop for six years, which has facilitated him in supporting his family.

Vidra intends to use the loan to buy sugar, salt and soap for selling in his shop.

loans.use: Buying sugar, salt and soap for selling in his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction on a room

loans.name: Soria Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

La señora Soria tiene 37 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación procreo 4 hijos, dos ya son mayores de edad y están estudiando en la universidad y los dos menores en  colegio. Su marido es agricultor.
 
Se dedican junto con su esposo a la cría de  animales porcinos y vacunos, también al cultivo de productos de temporada invernal como maíz y maní ya que las tierras que siembran están situadas en lomas y montañas, su esposo trabajan  desde las 4 am en  el ordeñar  el ganado y continua hasta las 15h00 con la ayuda de sus hijos  en sus otras ocupaciones del campo, doña Soria mientras ellos se dedican a las faenas del campo se encarga de vender la leche que sacan a diario y de atender sus animales mas que todo las que están cerca de la casa como los cerdos y las aves.

Este crédito lo van a emplear en comprar simillas, abonos, y  fumigantes para tener una muy buena cosecha. Es su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the parish of Quiroga, of the city of Calceta, where people mostly make a living in agriculture, raising animals, and selling their products, the communal bank Quiroga meets every two weeks.

Mrs. Soria  is 37 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has four children, two who are adults and studying at the university and two who are younger and in high school.  Her husband is a farmer.
 
Her and her husband raise pigs and cattle and also cultivate winter products like corn and peanuts since the land they cultivate is hilly and mountainous.   Her husband works from 4 am milking livestock and continues until 3:00 and his children help him with other things on the land.  While they are working in the fields, Mrs. Soria sells the milk they get each day and takes care of the animals, mostly the ones closest to the house like the pigs and birds.  

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and sprays to get a good harvest.  This is her fifth period with the communal bank and she likes the ease of the loans.  Her dreams are for her children to be professionals.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, and sprays.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 32 years old and is married, with four children between 3 and 13 years old. His business is well-organized. Jean Bosco sells sacks to the wholesalers who want to bag charcoal, rice, sugar and so on.  His business is open from 6am until 5pm every day. He employs two people and has 3 years experience in his business.

Jean Bosco has requested a loan from KIVA. via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more sacks to sell. With this loan,  Jean Bosco will increase his business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks to sell.

loans.name: Leydi De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Leydi es una mujer trabadora, que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y venta de ropa  con más de seis años en las ventas, iniciando con pocos capital, para lograr apoyar  a su familia. Su esposo es mecánico y junto apoyan  a sus dos pequeños.
Afodenic ha venido a fortalecer su negocio con préstamos que ah dado a plazos, ya que el cincuenta por ciento de sus productos es al crédito con pago de quincena.
Con este nuevo financiamiento  comenzara a construir un cuarto, en donde comprara materiales de construcción para iniciar, y lograr más espacios. Contenta por lograr el objetivo.
texts.en:
Leydi is a hard-working woman who has worked in sales for more than six years selling cosmetics and clothing. She began with little capital but desired to help support her family. Her husband is a mechanic and together they support their two small children.

Afodenic has helped strengthen her business with loans that it provides. Fifty percent of her products are sold on credit and she collects from her clients every other week. She will use this loan to begin construction of a room to have more space and she will use the money to buy construction materials. She is happy to be able to meet her goal.

loans.use: To add on a room in her home

loans.name: Rio De Oro Group

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Rio D. Oro, tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos D. 20 y 10 años D. edad. Lucia se dedica al engorD. y crianza D. chanchos, hace más D. 5 años, elL. compra los chanchos en L. ferias, los engorda y luego los venD. a las carniceras. Una tía le incentivo para que comenzara con éste negocio y le va bien. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en L. compra D. chanchos.
Lucía ingreso a Finca Perú, por L. invitación D. su cuñada, con éste es el tercer ciclo que está, le gusta porque le dan un capital para trabajar y pueD. ahorrar, aprenD. D. las capacitaciones que recibe D. su promotora. Su sueño es abrir una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa y que sus hijos tengan su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Lucía is a member of the 'Río D. Oro' (River of Gold) community bank.  She is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 20 and 10.  Lucía's business is fattening and raising pigs.  She has been doing this for more than 5 years.  She buys her pigs at livestock markets, fattens them, and then sells them to butcher's shops.  It was one of her aunts who motivated her to start out in this business and it is doing well.  She will invest her loan in buying pigs.

Lucía was invited to join Finca Perú by her sister-in-law.  This is her third loan cycle.  She likes being a member because they give her working capital and she is able to save.  She learns from the training sessions that she receives from her advisor.  Lucía's dreams are to open a grocery store in her home and for her children to own their own businesses.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Mariuxi Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

Aquí conocimos a la señorita Mariuxi, ella es soltera y tiene 20 años, vive en casa de sus padres. Estudia en primero de bachillerato en un colegio de Manta. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque los créditos les permiten a personas como ella estudiar y poder ejercer una actividad comercial al mismo tiempo.

Se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja dos días a la semana, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes y los accesorios, sus productos los deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente dice que le encanta vender.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas.

Sus sueños son seguir estudiando para algún día llegar a ser una gran profesional y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) meets every fifteen days in the parish of Eloy Alfaro in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year by both domestic and foreign tourists. Manta’s port, which lies on the Pacific Ocean, is one of the largest in the country and in all of the Americas.

It is in this place that one can meet Srta. Mariuxi. She is 20 years old, single, and lives at home with her parents. Mariuxi is in her first year of undergraduate study at a college in Manta. She is participating in her second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and likes the fact that the loans help people like her who study and manage a business at the same time.

Mariuxi sells Avon products from catalogs (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She sells door-to-door and works every day. Mariuxi says the products that she sells most are perfumes and accessories. Her products are offered on credit and she collects payments on a weekly basis. She says that she enjoys selling.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, and crèmes. Her dreams include continuing her studies so that she will be a successful professional someday and helping her loved ones.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, and crèmes.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La señora Nelly se dedica a la venta de calzados para toda edad.  El crédito lo necesita para comprar calzados deportivos para niños para obtendrá más ingresos económicos. Es casada. Su esposo es empleado en un colegio. Tienen dos hijos y viven en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO.
texts.en: Sra. Nelly sells footwear for all ages.  She needs this loan in order to buy athletic shoes for children so that she can earn more income.  Nelly is married and her husband works at a school.  They have two children and live in their own home in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.  This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO.

loans.use: To buy athletic shoes for children.

loans.name: Chini Maya

texts.en:
Mrs. Chini Maya K., a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishipati, lives with her husband and a daughter.  Sainbu-Bhaishipati is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.  Her husband works in a private office. 

Mrs. K. is engaged in goat farming.  Now she has two goats on her farm.  She sells the goats in the local market.  This business helps her to contribute something to improve the living standard of her family.  Now she is requesting a third loan of 10,000 NPR to buy a few more goats and grains to feed them.

loans.use: to buys baby goats for her business

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 28 años de edad, ella es soltera sin hijos.  Vive en casa de madre ya que su padre es fallecido, ella vive en el distrito de San José en una comunidad urbana mediana y cuenta con servicios básicos de agua y  energía eléctrica.

Marcela se dedica ala confección de artesanías textiles, esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace más de 06 años en la vivienda de su madre, Ella se viene capacitando de manera constante con la finalidad de ofertar mejores productos a sus ocasionales clientes.

Marcela esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles, para que ella pueda comprar materiales necesarios para la confección de sus artesanías, y de esta manera pueda cumplir con la demanda de clientes que actualmente tiene

Marcela es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder ayudar a su madre al sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Marcela is 28 years old, single, and has no children. She lives at home with her mother and her father is deceased. They reside in the District of San José, a medium-sized urban community that receives basic services such as water and electricity.

Marcela makes handcrafted textiles. She has been developing her business for more than six years from her mother’s house. Marcela is constantly learning so that she can offer better products to her occasional customers.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 600 PEN. This will enable her to buy the necessary materials for producing her crafts and meeting the existing demand from her customers.

Marcela is an earnest and hardworking individual. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can help her mother maintain their home.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making handcrafted textiles.

loans.name: Sembu Brima's Group

texts.en:
This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek of a loan of SLL 11,000,000. With the help of this loan, some of these teachers will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan in their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to either pay for their children's education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects. With their monthly salaries, they will gradually repay their loan to SMT. 

Sembu is the leader of this group of teachers. The 57-year-old has been in the teaching profession for 32 years now. A native of Mile Ninety One small town, Sembu is a husband and father of five children. Sembu has requested this loan in order to buy household items like a television and a generator. 

(Attached to the left of this photo are snapshots of David and Abass, borrowers who were not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: to buy household items like a television and a generator

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 48 years old, and lives in the Jacob Town area. She’s single with five children, ages 19 to 29, who all live at home with her and all are in school. Beatrice has been selling cooked rice for the past 13 years. She says there is not much buying during the rainy season. Beatrice started this business with the help of her sister, who gave her some money. 

Beatrice's main challenge is finding a means to send her children to school and take care of the entire family. Beatrice requested this loan to purchase more rice and other ingredients with which she uses to cook. She hopes to build her own house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and other ingredients with which she uses to cook.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 58 years old and married with ten children. She runs a sari-sari (general store) in the Philippines. She has been running her store for fifteen years and also earns an income from a coffee shop.

Herminia has borrowed and paid back sixteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She now is requesting a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari.

Herminia works hard to provide for her family. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Lamees

texts.en:
Lamees is a 28-year-old married woman, living in Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. Lamees took out a $1,000 loan from FATEN to improve her poor home furniture. Her husband, who is a Palestinian National Authority employee, has a decent salary but it doesn't help him improve the home furniture by paying in cash. By having a loan from FATEN to be repaid on a monthly basis, Lamees and the family can afford to improve their home furniture. Obtaining this loan is a priority for Lamees, so she can live with her family in better conditions. 

Lamees is a conservative woman; therefore, her husband is photographed instead of her.

loans.use: to improve her old poor home furniture.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Elena has a food shop or eatery that sells several kinds of dishes. She has had this business for four years. Elena has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed to make her dishes. Elena has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy costume jewelry sets & Pranday (an ornament used to tie back the hair) for resale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has one child who is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are her rent bills and food for the family.

For the past three years, Caroline has operated a cereal selling business, selling in a shop to her local residents. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and the fluctuation of product pricing. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of soya beans, maize and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of soya beans, maize and rice.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Lorna has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from FULLERLIFE, NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.
Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been a farmer for the last three years. He is 27 years old, married to a housewife and is blessed with two children.

He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. Being this is his second loan, he plans to spend the loan to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dreams are to be the best and most well known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Doña Sara es una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora , tiene48 años de edad, casada, vive con su esposo y su hija. La señora se dedica a la costura, también vende por catalogo, es una persona con grandes deseo de superarse, también es una líder comunal del sector de pozos de Santa Ana. La clienta se entero de la Fundación por medio de una reunión que hubo en pozos y le llamo la atención ya que ella tiene una pequeña empresa de costura donde hacen colchas, almohadas, cortinas, etc, pero no tiene como expandirse por falta de capital de trabajo, por su situación económica la señora pudo llegar hasta la primaria.
 Este es su primer crédito en la Fundación, será para capital de trabajo ya que tiene un negocio muy bueno de hacer colchas pero por falta de capital no ha podido cumplir con los pedidos.
  La solicitante tiene un taller de costura en su casa de habitación, es muy amplio y cómodo, lo tiene muy ordenado, desde hace dos años se dedica a coser se capacito en talleres que van a dar a Santa Ana.
La clienta se levanta desde temprano hace sus labores domesticas y luego se va a trabajar en su taller sale a las cuatro ya que su esposo llega a esa hora lo atiende y luego vuelve a trabajar hasta las seis
La clienta Sara piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima como lo que son telas, hilos, etc, tambien piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderia para ayudarse con las ventas de catalogo.
texts.en:
Doña Sara is a very hard-working and striving woman.  She is 48 years old and is married; she lives with her husband and daughter.  The Señora works doing sewing, and she also makes sales from a catalog.  She is a person who has great wishes to succeed, and is also a community leader for the Pozos neighborhood in Santa Ana.

The client joined the Fundación through a meeting which took place in Pozos which came to her attention as she has a small sewing business where she makes quilts, cushions, curtains, etc., but she has not been able to expand as she lacks working capital.  Because of her financial situation, the Señora has only attended school up to primary level.

This is her first loan with the Fundación, and it will be used for working capital as she has a very good business making quilts but has been able to complete her orders due to lack of capital.

The member has a sewing workshop in her home; it is very suitable for her needs and comfortable, and she keeps it well-organized.  She has been sewing  for the last 12 years, and was trained in workshops that were given in Santa Ana.

The client gets up early to take care of her domestic chores, and then goes to work in her workshop.  She stops at four o'clock as her husband comes home at this time, so she tends to him and then returns to work from six o'clock.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise such as clothes, perfume, and shoes, and to buy materials such as cloth and thread.

loans.name: Pedro Joel

texts.es: Pedro Joel de veintisiete años de edad vive junto a sus hijos; el elabora en su casa cepillos artesanales para usarlos para lavar ropa en los hogares, estos son de cerdas de nylon,  ya se hizo de mucha clientela, los distribuye en el mercado, en las tiendas, clientes que le compran por docenas pues son de muy buena calidad y los vende a excelentes precios; Pedro Joel es  un hombre dedicado al trabajo siempre dispuesto a salir adelante, para él el secreto del éxito es la perseverancia y responsabilidad, una de sus metas es expandirse con su negocio, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima, madera, nylon etc. Pedro Joel tiene la esperanza que con su esfuerzo logrará llevar a  su a hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Pedro Joel is 27 years old and lives together with his children.  He works at home making brushes by hand.  These brushes are used to wash clothes.  They are made from nylon bristles.  He has a lot of customers and distributes his products in the markets and in stores.  His customers buy his products by the dozen as they are very good quality and he sells them at very good prices.  

Pedro Joel is a man who is committed to his work.  He is always ready to get ahead in life.  For him, the secret to success is perseverance and responsibility.  One of his goals is to expand his business and so he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy a larger quantity of raw materials (wood, nylon, etc.)  Pedro Joel hopes that, through his hard work, he will manage to provide his household with financial security.

loans.use: to buy wood and nylon for making brushes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more poultry birds.

loans.name: Salin

texts.en:
Salin is 24 years old. She is married to Maurice and they have two children. Salin has a hawking (vending) business in Muhuru and has been doing this for the last six years. She sells a range of household products like sandals, padlocks, utensils, paper bags, and many more.  

She makes a monthly income of KES.6,000. She is taking out a second loan which she will use to buy more household products for sale.

She will use the anticipated profits to plough back into the business and also to cover basic needs for her family like food and clothing.

loans.use: To buy more household products for sale.

loans.name: Sonia Carolina

texts.es:
Sonia, por la buena atención D. nuestra institución, se ha decidido nuevamente a otro préstamo, porque quiere invertir más en su negocio ya que está bien para esta época por las graduaciones comprara: productos D. belleza, maquillajes, cremas, zapatos, y ropa, el propósito D. ella es tener lo necesario para ofrecerles a los clientes.
Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron mucho para crecer y tener más mercadería, este avance le ha permitido cambiar las condiciones D. vida D. su familia y a tener lo necesario para que no les falte nada.
texts.en: Sonia, thanks to the good attention from our institution, has decided on another loan once again because she wants to invest more in her business because during this season of graduations she will buy beauty products, make-up, creams, shoes and clothes to have what’s necessary to offer her customers.  Previous loans helped her much to grow and have more merchandise.  This advance has maD. it possible for her to change her family’s living conditions and to have everything they need and not lack anything.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: María's Group

texts.es:
María's Group está conformada por tres mujeres emprendedoras, en este grupo la presidenta es María porque ella es una mujer cariñosa, amable, sociable y buena. Vive con sus 4 hijos en Salcedo que se encuentra a una media hora de Latacunga en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador.

María se dedica a la comercialización de jugos y espumilla que es la clara del huevo y el jugo de cualquier fruto batido. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de frutos para aumentar su producción, lo que le ayudará a obtener buenos ingresos y así podrá darles el estudio a sus hijas.

Su sueño es poder ver a sus hijas profesionales y que su negocio siga creciendo economicamente.

Las otras dos personas del grupo se dedican a la confección de ropa y el crédito les servirá para comprar materia prima (tela de punto).
texts.en:
María's Group consists of 3 enterprising women. The president of the group is Maria because she is a loving, kind, sociable and good woman. She lives with her 4 children in Salcedo which is about half an hour away from Latacunga in the Sierra Centro of Ecuador. 

Maria produces juices and 'espumilla' which is egg white blended with any fruit. This is the first time she has worked with Fodemi. The loan she is asking for will be invested in buying fruit to increase production, which will help her obtain a good income and allow her to educate her daughters. 

Her dream is to see her daughters as professionals and that her business continue to grow economically.

The other two members of the group manufacture clothing and will use the loan to buy raw materials (knitted fabric)..

loans.use: to buy fruit to increase production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells ladies dresses and slippers at Besease near Elmina. She has been selling dresses and slippers for three years. Mary is married to a policeman and has one child. Mary uses her income to help her husband provide for their family. She will use this loan to purchase more dresses and slippers to sell. With the profit, Mary plans to acquire a shop in which to sell her dresses and slippers.

loans.use: to purchase more dresses and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child.   Liezel has a shop that buys and sells gold dust.  After she has saved enough, she sells it in bulk to the bigger gold dust buyers. She has had this business for 3 years.  

Liezel has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to to buy stocks of gold dust.  She  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Liezel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy gold dust to trade

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
René has more than two decades of experience in running his own business. In the past, he owned a restaurant, worked for insurance agencies, was a real estate agent, and within the last three years, took a break as a real estate agent to better understand the marketing industry. René began his business, Manfre & Associates Consulting Services, this year in hopes to get contracted through other insurance companies and brand his name. He said his business goal is to "help people help people " by being a company that understands where most businesses are in their process, their challenges and help them achieve their goals. At his business, René mainly deals with health, life and other insurance questions to place others in a better situation if possible. He also teaches other entrepreneurs how to use marketing and the Internet to stay in contact with their current clients and contact future clients. 

Currently, he has ten other consulting associates, under them, he employees about 30 people. The different associates have a vast history and knowledge ranging between home finance and investment properties. He added, they know what it takes to operate a business, cut costs and save funds. He is using the loan money to pay for small marketing, part-time staff development, and next year's business planning while between commission checks. He plans to help place the workers on salary to help his business grow. René is looking to hire at least five people, by 2013, he hopes to have 20-30 employees, and within the next three years, he plans to have 100 employees. 

René said obtaining this loan "is a great opportunity to get started. I think it's going to help me out a great deal. It'll give me the opportunity to grow." Without it, he would have had a slightly more complicated time putting together ideas that will help his business grow. "It gives me a little bit of a leap without stressing," he added. His background in different personal experiences along with his associates' gives the company an avenue to help.

loans.use: To pay for marketing and part-time staff development.

loans.name: Piece Group

texts.en:
Maria is in her late thirties and single. She has been selling cosmetics for five years. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. and  is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Marias’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She plans to use it to add more stocks of cosmetics for her business. Maria’s dream is to one day  be able to buy a motorcycle.

Maria will share this loan with her loan group, "Piece", which consists of 16 members who hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to add more stocks of  cosmetics

loans.name: Darika

texts.ru:
Дарике 55 лет, замужем, мать шестерых детей.  
Основная деятельность Дарики – это откорм и перепродажа скота.  Начатое еще в 1992 году с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS), хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.   Также, в сезон Дарика подрабатывает швеей и сезонно получает до 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Дарика обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов и коз. Доходы от кредита Дарика планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Darika is 55, married, and the mother of six children. Darika's main occupation is raising and selling livestock. Begun in 1992 with 2,000 somi (KGS), Darika's farm earns around 5,000 somi (KGS) a month from the sale of dairy and meat products. Darika also works on the side as a seamstress on a seasonal basis, and earns up to 5,000 somi (KGS) per season. Darika has gone to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 somi to purchase sheep and goats. She plans to use the receipts from the loan to acquire more livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his used clothes business by purchasing more stocks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells palm oil in large quantity to her customers. She prepares the oil herself and sells to retailers. She says preparing the oil is very costly. She needs a loan of $900.00 to enable her to buy more palm fruits.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nora Elia

texts.en:
Mrs. Nora Elia is married with two daughters, who are 20 and 17, and one son who is 18. Her husband works in construction, nevertheless, his salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses. To help her husband, Nora worked as a domestic worker but began to feel exhausted from the hard labor. And so, she decided to open her own business, selling tacos and hamburgers, in which pursuit, she also recieves her children's help in order to make it a success.

Unfortunately, her youngerst daughter is ill and in order to purchase the medication, Nora needed to spend all her money she had intended to invest in her store. In order to continue working, Nora is asking for a loan of $375, which she will use to purchase supplies.She is ready to re-pay this quantity in 6-12 months. With your help, you can help in the success of this business and in the improvement of the lives of this family, please do not hesitate and help Nora.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Nora Elia, es casada y tiene dos hijas de 20 y 17 años de edad y un hijo de 18, su esposo trabaja como albañil, sin embargo, con su salario no cubría todas las necesidades de su hogar, para apoyar a su esposo Nora trabajaba como empleada doméstica pero empezó a sentirse mal por el esfuerzo que hacia, ante esto decidió abrir su propio negocio con la venta de tacos y hamburguesas, donde recibe la ayudad de sus hijos y juntos han logrado sacarlo adelante desde hace un año que iniciaron.

Lamentablemente, su hija menor enfermó y al comprar el medicamento que necesita ha estado gastando el capital que reinvertiría en el negocio, para continuar trabajando solicita un préstamo por $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes hacer crecer este negocio y mejorar la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Nora.

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 25 years old, single with no children. She makes and sells intricate beadwork and weaving. Her group of women sells to foreign students at the Spanish language schools in Quetzaltenango, about a two-hour bus ride away. The group of women she belongs to is called "Mujeres Analizadoras".
A sample beadwork bag that she makes will fetch Q250, or US$32, but requires two weeks to make, and the material costs about 70 Guatemalan Quetzales, or US$10.
Maria Elena completed her high school education as an adult because she had to stop school at age 10 when her father died. However, by going to a special weekend program she was able to finish her entire degree. She dreams of helping other women to succeed in their business, especially by expanding into new markets. She was the recipient of a 6-month special scholarship for indigenous women leaders to study human rights in Guatemala.

loans.use: Purchase material for making intricate beadwork and weaving traditional Mayan clothes

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 30 years old and is married with 2 daughters, one who is 5 and the other just turned 9 months. Her husband, Paulino, works purchasing and selling bricks, a business which he carries out in the capital city.

Nelly is a hairdresser and has worked in this profession for the past 8 years. Coming from a poor family, she was only able to study up to her third year in high school. For this reason, she decided to study hairdressing and work in this profession to earn a living.

Due to her hard work and entrepreneurship, she has established a good clientele and has even managed to acquire another location that she is currently working on furnishing. Nelly needs a loan in order to purchase things like mirrors, chairs, and sinks so that she can open this new branch of her business.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for a beauty salon

loans.name: In

texts.en: Mrs. In S., aged 38, is a widow who sells rubber, earning around $12.50 per day in revenue. She has one child who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase two calves to raise and resell at the local market for a profit. She hopes that the proft will bring in additional income to support her and her child.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and resell for a profit.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Anna is 36 years old and is the mother of four children. Right now, she dedicates herself to working in her hair salon, located in her home. Her husband, Wilfredo, is an independent worker and has always supported her in every one of her decisions. For her, the most important thing is to contribute to her four children's progress so that they continue to study and become good men and excellent professionals. Ana studied hairdressing and beauty treatments and now works with great skill. That's why she has acquired the strong base of clients that she now has. She needs a loan to obtain more products for her beauty salon. She hopes for charitable support from your noble and kind heart.

Translated by the Princeton University Language Project.

La Señora Ana a sus 36 años, es madre de cuatro hijos. En la actualidad se dedica a prestar servicios en su peluquería, ubicada en su domicilio; su esposo, Wilfredo, es trabajador independiente y desde siempre la ha apoyado en todas y cada una de sus decisiones. Para ella lo más importante es contribuir con el progreso de sus cuatro hijos que aún estudian a fin de que puedan convertirse en hombres de bien y excelentes profesionales.Ana estudió en un CEO, peluquería y tratamientos de belleza, es por eso que se desempeña con mucha destreza en este rubro y ha conseguido a base de mucho esfuerzo lo que ahora tiene. Requiere de un suma de dinero para adquirir mayor cantidad de productos para la consolidación de su centro de belleza.Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble y bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Mr. Francis O. is a 47 year old man, married with 5 children, and lives in Benin City. He repairs wheelbarrows and undertakes other metal work. He is asking for a loan amount of $275 to buy an additional oil cooler welding machine. He learnt his trade over 3 years and started his business in 2004. He is a dedicated client of LAPO.

loans.use: To buy an additional oil cooler welding machine for his business

loans.name: Mey

texts.en: Mrs. Mey S., 38, works with her husband on their farm growing rice crops and raising horse making totally about $3 each day of income. This couple has seven children. One of their children works making incenses; another one works as a garment worker; one of whom is enrolled in school and the rest of which are married and stay separately. Mrs. Mey S. is humble to request for a loan to expand her livestock by adding more healthy horse to breed for generating more profit in the next twelve to eight months.

loans.use: To purchase more horses to breed.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Tín, 50, is a 3rd year member of TYM. She lives in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An with her husband and 4 children. All her children are grown up. Her previous loans were used to raise pigs. She is a hard working woman, she tends her pigs very well so they are big and meaty. Every batch of pigs sold brings her a few hundreds USD. She also sells vegetables to increase her revenue. Despite her 50 years of age, she is in good health and active. This time she requests a loan of 450 to buy breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tín, 50 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 3 của Quỹ. Chị sống tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An cùng chồng và 4 người con. Các con chị đều đã trưởng thành. Các vòng vốn trước chị đều vay vốn đầu tư vào việc chăn nuôi. Với tính cần cù chịu khó lại khéo nuôi nên đàn lợn nhà chị Tín lúc nào cũng béo tốt, khỏe mạnh. Mỗi lứa xuất chuồng mang lại cho chị vài trăm USD. Chị Tín cũng thường xuyên chạy chợ mớ rau, mớ cỏ để có tiền trả tuần. Bước sang tuổi 50 nhưng trông chị vẫn rất khỏe mạnh. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 450USD mua lợn giống

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena R. D. R. owns a beautiful restaurant in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She started the business three years ago and now has many loyal customers, who come to enjoy lunch, drink a beer, or eat dinner. They enjoy the warm and contemporary environment.

Milena is a 49-year-old widow with two children. She decided to open the restaurant because she loves to cook food and proviD. a service she can be proud of. She is creative and smart. She used the Internet to find a good design for her bar, and she came up with the theme for the decor herself. She works hard so she can send her youngest son to college, and she has no one else to rely on.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Milena is requesting a loan of $475 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to buy rice, beer, oil, sugar, and condiments for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy rice, beer, oil, sugar, and condiments for her restaurant

loans.name: Asha's Taifa Group

texts.en:
Asha is 31 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 14,12 and 9 years old. Asha hiring bicycles, she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more bicycles items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwajabu, Anna Makobora and Anna M., who have businesses dealing in bicycles hiring and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more  bicycles for hiring.

loans.name: Ana Dela

texts.es:
Mi name is Ana Dela B. C. and I am 32 years old. I am a merchant and I live in San Pedro Sacatepéquez. I earn a living selling traditional women's clothing. I launched my business 15 years ago, with a capital of Q.500.00.
