As time went by I started to get new clients and I am now selling in different towns and villages where I offer my products on the streets. About 6 years ago, my sister introduced the idea of also selling beauty products through catalogs. Since I already had a good number of clients, the products we well received.

Thanks to the Lord people have been ordering clothing and beauty products, therefore I am in need of more capital to be able to fulfill their orders. Now that everything has gone up in price one needs to invest more in the merchandise, especially if one wants to have the items clients request readily available. My goal with this loan is to be able to take advantage of the season, in which people request large orders, due to the town celebrations that are soon to come.

I always work hard to get ahead and take good care of my two children, especially now that I don't live with my husband.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Soy AnaDela B. C., tengo 32 años soy comerciante y vivo en San Pedro Sacatepèquez. Me dedico a la venta de ropa típica para mujeres, inicie desde hace 15 años, inicié con un capital de Q. 500.00, conforme fue pasando el tiempo empecé a ganar nuevos clientes y estoy vendiendo en diferentes pueblos y aldeas en donde ofrezco mi producto de forma ambulante. Hace unos 6 años mi hermana me propuso poder vender también productos de belleza por catalogo, y como yo ya tenia buen número de clientes fue bien aceptado por las personas que yo les ofreciera otros productos. Gracias a Dios, la gente me hace pedidos de ropa y productos, por lo que yo necesito más capital para poder cumplir con ellos ya que como todo se ha encarecido uno necesita invertir más en la mercadería, y tener siempre lo que los clientes piden, mis metas son que con este crédito pueda aprovechar esta temporada en la que siempre las personas hacen buen pedido por las fiestas de los pueblos que están próximas. Siempre hago mi mejor esfuerzo para salir adelante y mantener bien a mis hijos ya que no vivo con mi esposo por lo que tengo que velar por mis 2 niños.

loans.use: Merchandise Purchase

loans.name: Chai

texts.en:
Chai H., 50, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Chhun Oeun, and two of their children. She works on her farmlands growing rice and sewing palm leaves together. She sells the palm leaves as roofing material or as siding for a house and typically makes US$ 2 each day. Her husband makes US$ 1 each day as a farmer as well, growing rice and vegetables in his fields. One of their daughters works in a local garment factory and provides a little extra income for the family, but the family has been seeking out other ways to diversify their income.

They have asked for a loan of US$ 250 to purchase a cow to raise and sell for a profit when it is large enough. They would like to venture into this livestock raising business, and they hope that in the future they can continue to purchase cows to raise and sell. They believe that they can see a solid return on their investment and their income will increase. They hope that this opportunity will allow them to improve their standard of living as well.

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Aziza's Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Aziza  is 50 years old. She has one child, who is aged 15. She became a juice and snack (chapati) seller in 2001. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Aziza  now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mariam, who also has business dealing with juice sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to reach her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet A. is 39 years old and married with 4 children. Juliet lives in Sabo Oniba, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells electronics at Alaba International market, which is regarded as the biggest market in West Africa. Juliet is a LAPO client. Juliet has been in this business for the past 3 years. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy more electronics to sell. She expresses her profound gratitude to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more electronics to sell

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
Munavar is a mother of three wonderful kids. She sells men’s caps and belts at the market. She purchases her goods from other markets far from her home and sometimes from another country. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

She wants to expand her business with this loan and offer more goods to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for resale

loans.name: Abdurazok

texts.en:
M. Abdurazok is 41 years old and has a very collaborative and supportive wife who joins him in tending to their crops.  This couple has 4 children who are all in school.  He and his wife have been working in agriculture for many years.  It is their livelihood.  

He likes the earth to be well worked.  He plants wheat, potatoes, onions and carrots.  His wife and 4 children work for the family's daily income. The eldest child is 20 years old, and helps take care of the crops, but then has to go and study. 

Now, Abdurazok needs a loan of 3500 Somoni ($1050 USD) for the term of 12 months.  He is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing wheat and potato.  His goal, with time, is to plant larger quantities and educate his children.  With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
“I wanted to develop a store business in our village but lack of funds stop me to do so, “says Ester.

Ester is 51 years old and a mother of eight children: Jerry – 30 years old, high school undergraduate; Cristopher – 28 years old, college graduate; Maricel – 24 years old, college undergraduate; Rocky – 18 years old, a college student; Haidee – 16 years old, currently a senior high school student; Rhea – 14 years old, sophomore high school student; Jesrael – 11 years old, a graduating elementary student; and Mikaela – 6 years old, already in grade school. The level of living conditions for her family in Sitio Guingab is poor, and the condition of the place where they live is also poor.

Ester’s weekly income is only PHP1,500, and she needs to cover their daily family needs, allowances for her children, and maintenance of their store. Even their farming needs also depend on the income from her store. Thus, Ester decided to take out a loan that will be use as additional business capital to further purchase more stock and additional merchandise to sell in the village and this will definitely generate an increase in income.

“Love one another so that God will love us too” said Ester. For her, loving is one factor she considers towards the success of every endeavor.

loans.use: Additional Capital

location.town: Sitio Guingab, Masipi East Cabagan, Isabela

loans.name: Ageut-Akurut Ketty Group

texts.en:
Ketty A. (on the left) is 28 years old, married, and a mother of four. Ketty represents her fellow group members who are also involved in clothing sales businesses in Pallisa town. They travel to Mbale (a main regional town) to purchase their stock on Mondays every 2 weeks. From their sales, their profit margin ranges between 25-30%.

These ladies are using their loan funds to purchase dresses, shirts, trousers, skirts, and blouses. Ketty particularly dreams of opening up a 1st class boutique with a variety of new designer outfits sourced from overseas. She also hopes to build a house for her family. The income she earns from the business enables her to meet the family's day-to-day needs.

loans.use: Purchase dresses, shirts, trousers, skirts, and blouses for re-sale

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and cosmetics in her shop. Dina is 30 years old and single. She has no children. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling charcoal and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maritza Bernarda

texts.es: Maritza Bernarda S. Chavarría tiene 45 años, su estado civil es soltera. Y tiene 3 hijos. Todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Maritza es la venta de comida. Hace mas de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad y dio comienzo a esta actividad en su casa de habitación, y con la ayuda de los préstamos logro ampliar su negocio. Los propósitos para su  negocio es innovar con nuevas comidas y que sus clientes disfruten su comida. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que sin el dinero no puede lograr sus objetivos además tiene que realizar las compras de carnes, verduras y granos básicos. Doña Maritza desea poseer un restaurante para ofrecer su deliciosa comida. La cantidad  solicitada es de C$ 3.500 córdobas a un plazo de 6 meses.
texts.en:
Maritza Bernarda S. Chavarría is a 45-year-old single mother of three children. All of her children attend school. Maritza's area of work is food sales. She has been selling food for more than 15 years. She began selling food out of her home and, with help in the form of loans, managed to expand her business. Maritza is proposing to introduce new dishes to her menu, to ensure her clients enjoy their meals. The loan will be used for working capital, which is needed for her to achieve her goals: she needs a loan to purchase meats, vegetables and basic grains. Maritza wants to own a restaurant where she can serve her delicious foods. She is requesting 3,500 córdobas [approximately US$ 175], which she will pay back in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
In the town of Aloran, there lives a certain Mrs. Andresa G., 63 years old. She is blessed with 3 children. Her husband has no permanent job and works as a laborer on an on-call basis. Despite her age, she still works hard to support the family. 

Luckily, her business, which is a “sari-sari” (general) store, has been doing well. To expand her business and enable her to sell a variety of goods, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in March 2008. She was able to renovate her store and buy “kalan” (man-made pottery products made of clay). 

Now she is applying for PHP 15,000 to buy additional merchandise to sell, particularly soft drinks, canned goods, and other basic commodities. In the future, she plans to venture into copra (coconut) sales in addition to her “sari-sari” store. She also prays that her husband will have his own business one of these days.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sapini

texts.en: Sapini T., 43, is married with two children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public two days per week. SPBD loans are Sapini’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks, and this is her third SPBD loan. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about $166). The loan is needed to buy tools for her business (a shovel, rake, garden spray, chemicals, etc.), as well as to improve her home and pay for her kids' schooling.

loans.use: To purchase tools like a shovel, rake, garden spray, and chemicals.

loans.name: María Amparo

texts.es: María Amparo L. de 45 años de edad reside en Soyapango junto a su hija menor, de 18 años de edad; su esposo y su hijo mayor viven en Estados Unidos. A pesar que estos le brindan ayuda a María, ella posee su propio negocio el cual es una tienda en su propia casa. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir más en su tienda comprando más productos perecederos como pan, pastas, golosinas, jugos enlatados entre otros más. María necesita mejorar sus ventas y verlas reflejadas en sus ganancias, ya que lo que su familia le envía del exterior no le da a bastos con todos los gastos del hogar es por ello que espera ampliar su negocio a través de dicho préstamo y así obtener más ganancias y mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
María Amparo L. is 45 years old. She lives in Soyapango, together with her younger daughter, who is 18 years old. Her husband and older son live in the United States. Because they support María, she has her own business, which is a store in her own house. She requests a loan through which she will be able to invest more in her store, by buying more perishable products, such as bread, pastas, sweets, canned juices, among other things. María needs to improve her sales and see that reflected in her earnings, since what her family sends her from abroad is not enough to cover all of the household expenses. Because of this, she hopes to grow her business with this loan, have more earnings, and improve her financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable products

loans.name: Rosa Erlinda

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa Áreas tiene 35 años de edad, casada, habita en Laureles Sur en la ciudad de Managua, tiene dos hijos que los tiene estudiando. Tiene por meta en la vida que sus hijos se preparen para que tengan un mejor futuro, también construir su casa como el patrimonio que posee.
Doña Rosa al ver que  la búsqueda de trabajo estaba difícil surgió la idea de crear su propio negocio en la venta de  ropa y cosméticos y que la misma vez pueda encargarse de sus hijos y los quehaceres del hogar. Iniciándolo con fondo de préstamos y algunos ahorros que en su momento tenia, las cualidades de su negocio, este es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en comprar, ropa, perfume, cosméticos, cremas entre otros que pueda generarle buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Áreas is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Laureles Sur in the city of Managua. She has two children who are in school. Her goal in life is to help prepare her children so that they can have a better future. She would also like to build her own house as her patrimony.

Upon realizing that seeking employment was difficult, Ms. Áreas decided to create her own clothing and cosmetics business so that she could work, while at the same time look after her children and complete her household chores. She started her own business with loans and some money that she had saved up at the time. This is her fifth loan cycle with Afodenic, and she will invest the loan in purchasing apparel, perfume, cosmetics, lotions, and other products that will generate good profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apparel, cosmetics, and perfume

loans.name: Tresita

texts.en:
Tresita B. is from the village of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Tresita is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Tresita owns a general store. She sells a variety of different products to the local community. Tresita has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Tresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Tresita is requesting a new loan of PHP 4000. These funds will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Tresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora started her fish sales a year ago at Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana. She gets her stock of smoked fish from Yeji and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish. Because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base that travels from the other part of the community to buy her fish. She is now 42 years old, married and the mother of five children. Currently, four of the children are in school. She wants to use the loan to buy more assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She belongs to the village bank called Emmanuel.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Elba Dolores

texts.es: Elba Dolores L. D. M. tiene 46 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos. Elba desarrolla todas las actividades labores dentro D. su misma casa ya que posee una tienda, venta D.  pupusas y venta D. tortillas, todos estos negocios son atendidos por ella, el crédito Elba lo solicita para compra D. materia prima D. pupusas y tortillas ya que no es suficiente la producción que hasta el momento saca, Elba ya obtenido créditos anteriormente los cuales ha cancelado, siendo muy puntual en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elba Dolores L. D. M. is 46. She lives in the Ahuachapán department with her husband and three children. Elba does all of her work in her own home. She has a store, she sells “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables), and she sells tortillas. She runs all of these businesses. The loan that Elba is asking for is to buy raw materials to make pupusas and tortillas because her current production is insufficient. Elba has had previous loans, which she repaid with very punctual payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married and has two grown children. She is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells children’s clothing in Angolenko, one of the busiest city markets. Anna owns 3 vending facilities in the same marketplace. She has been running this business for 15 years. Currently, she has about 70,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her net profit is about 5,000 Grivnyas a month.

Anna is requesting a loan of 12,100 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for the coming fall season. She is hoping to diversify her inventory and boost her sales as a result.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid K K. is twenty-eight years old, and a hardworking businessman. He is married with two children, one girl and one boy. His daughter is going to school. He is also looking after eight additional dependents who are in school.

For over three years, Rashid has owned and managed a shop where he deals in phones and phone accessories. He is using the loan to purchase phones, as well as accessories such as batteries, chargers, ear phones, etc. The loan will increase his capital as well as improve his stock.

Rashid is an open-minded person who is helping his relatives by supporting their children who want to study. He is active and hardworking, and has a structural setup through which he hopes to complete the constructions that will generate enough income to support him and his family in the future.

loans.use: To buy phones and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel tiene 20 años, es una joven muy tranquila y alegre, vive en la casa de sus familiares y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Su trabajo es el tejido artesanal, labor que viene realizando desde que tenía 10 años cuando ayudaba a sus padres a terminar los pedidos que tenían. Ahora tiene su propio puesto de artesanías, el cual está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), donde atiende con mucha alegría a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre las prendas que mejor les quedarán, lleva 5 años con este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que tiene que cuidarlo, aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas. Para el futuro, espera hacer crecer su negocio y tener una tienda más gran de ropa artesanal.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprara más lana para mejorar los tejidos que realiza.
texts.en:
Mabel is 20 years old. She is a very calm and cheerful young woman who lives at home with her family. What she wants most is to excel in life. Her work involves making hand woven articles, a skill she has been utilizing since she was 10 years old in order to help her parents complete their orders. She now has her own handicraft business, which is located in the Laguna Esplanade (a temporary site in the city of Juliaca where fairs are held).

What she enjoys most about her job is talking with her customers and advising them on what clothes best suit them. She has been in business for 5 years and the most difficult part is having to manage her vending post all day. Yet she knows that she must work very hard in order to achieve her goals. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and open a large store that sells handmade clothing.

This is Mabel’s first loan with MFP. She hopes to make her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank, whom she admires and respects greatly. With her loan of 700 soles, she will buy more wool to improve her output of hand woven fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Nuevos Senderos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevos Senderos está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca al sur del  país,   esta ciudad es considerada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad además, aquí podemos disfrutrar de  paisajes hermosos y lugares turísticos  para ser visitados por turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

Este Banco está formado por un socio y trece socias que están dispuestos a salir adelante con sus negocios, familias y llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida, viven en diferentes partes de la urbe cuencana.

La señora Marcela Elizabeth  N. T. es socia del  al Banco Comunal  Nuevos Senderos, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca en el  sector del Mercado 12 de Abril, ella tiene 25 años de edad, se encuentra felizmente casada y fruto de su amor concibió dos  hijos de  4 y 2 años de edad, la relación con su esposo es muy sólida siendo el pilar principal de su hogar, él trabaja en su propio taller de latonería; aún no tienen casa propia por lo que deben pagar arriendo.

Marcela es Psicóloga Clínica lleva dos años ejerciendo su profesión, montó el consultorio en su propio domicilio por lo que no paga arriendo, permitiéndole ahorrar ese dinero para los gastos de su hogar y para mejorar el espacio físico de su  consultorio.

Marcela  se lleva muy bien con todas las socias creando un buen  ambiente de amistad, nos comenta que este es su tercer ciclo junto a su banco comunal y  asegura que los prestamos que la fundación le ha entregado le han permitido ir adecuando el local donde montó su consultrorio, con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue va a invertir en la compra de instrumental necesarios para las terapias con sus pacientes para darles un mejor  sevicio.

El gran sueño de Marcela es que cada día le vaya mucho mejor para comprar un local y montar su consultorio.

La señora  María Beatriz S. Z. es otra socia del Banco Comunal Nuevos Senderos,  vive en el Sector El Vergel en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, fruto de su unión matrimonial concibió tres hijos de 18, 8, 6 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja en un taller de latonería y por las noches estudia en la Universidad UNITA,  sus dos hijos menores estudian  en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a la mecánica y es una persona muy colaboradora en casa; no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en la casa de sus suegros.

María tiene un comedor  ubicado en el redondel de las bodegas de ETAPA, lleva trabajando dos años en él, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m. nos comenta que por las vacaciones el negocio decayó un poco y espera que en el inicio de clases mejore.

Este  es su primer ciclo en la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR y se animó a ser socia de la fundación por las facilidades para obtener el crédito y la oportunidad que le da de invertir en su negocio, con el préstamo que la fundación le entregue va a invertir en la compra de menaje de cocina  para su negocio y  para la matrícula de su hijo en la Universidad.

Su gran sueño es ampliar su restaurante y contar con un local propio para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y ser más competitivo.

La señora María Virginia  O.  M. es otra socia activa del Banco Comunal Nuevos Senderos, ella vive en el sector el Control Sur en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 45 años de edad, se encuentra casada, de su relación conyugal concibió cuatro hijas de: 27, 24, 23, 11 años de edad, sus hijas mayores se encuentran casadas, excepto la  primera y la última que viven con ella, además nos comenta que aún no consigue cupo en el colegio para su hija menor pues desea que siga con sus estudios,  su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada,  mantienen una buena relación conyugal compartiendo las responsabilidades económicas y del hogar,  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

María tiene un negocio de  comida rápida, ofrece  salchipapas, chuzos, hamburguesas, colas, etc., lleva veinte  años en esta actividad, su horario de trabajo es de 4 p.m. hasta las 9 p.m. de domingo a domingo sin descansar un solo día,  nos comenta que le va muy bien por eso cada día busca dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

María mantiene una buena relación con todas las socias de su banco, este es su tercer ciclo en la FUNDACION ESPOIR  y se siente muy agradecida por los préstamos obtenidos pues le han permitido estabilizarse económicamente,  con el nuevo préstamo que la fundación le entregue lo va a invertir en la ampliación de su negocio, compra de bebidas gaseosas surtidas, aguas naturales y productos desechables. Su gran meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Senderos Village Bank is located in the city of Cuenca in the southern part of the country. The city is considered a World Heritage Site and has beautiful scenery and tourist attractions that are visited by domestic and foreign tourists. This bank is composed of one male member and thirteen female members that want to be successful in their businesses and achieve a better quality of life for their families. They live in different parts of Cuenca. Mrs. Marcela Elizabeth N. T. is a member of the Nuevos Senderos Village Bank and she lives in the Mercado 12 de Abril section of Cuenca. She is 25 years old and is happily married with two children, 4 and 2 years of age. Her relationship with her husband is very solid and is the foundation of their family. He has his own metal-working workshop.They still do not own their own home and have to pay rent. Marcela is a clinical psychologist and has been in practice for two years. She set up her office in their home to save on rent and to be able to fix up the space. Marcela gets along very well with the other members, creating a friendly environment. She tells us that this is her third loan cycle with the Village Bank and she says that the earlier loans from the bank have enabled her to improve her office space. WIth the loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR, she will invest in the purchase of instruments necessary for her patients' therapy to be able to serve them better. Marcela's dream is to buy a piece of land and build her own office. Mrs. María Beatriz S. Z. is another member of the Nuevos Senderos Village Bank and she lives in the El Vergel section of Cuenca. She is 38 years old and is married with three children, 18, 8 and 6 years of age. Her oldest son works in a metal-working workshop and at night studies at the UNITA University. Her two younger children go to school in the city. Her husband is a mechanic and is very helpful around the house. They do not own their own home and they live in their in-laws' house. María has a restaurant located by the traffic circle at the ETAPA warehouses. She has been working there for two years and her work schedule is from 8:00 am to 4pm. She tells us that during summer break, business fell off a bit and she hopes things improve once classes begin. This is her first loan with FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR and she wanted to become a member because of the easy access to credit and the opportunity that it would give her to invest in her business. With the loan, she will buy cooking supplies for her business and pay her son's university tuition. Her dream is to increase the size of her restaurant and own the property to be able to serve her customers better and to be more competitive. Mrs.María Virginia O. M. is another active member of the Nuevos Senderos Village Bank and she lives in the Control Sur section of Cuenca. She is 45 years old and is married with four daughters, 27, 24, 23 and 11 years old. Her older daughters are married except for the eldest and the youngest who still live with her. She tells us that she has not been able to get a spot in school for her youngest daughter who she would like to have continue her studies. María's husband is an employee at a private company and they have a good relationship, sharing financial and household responsibilities. They do not own their own home and are renting. María has a fast food business, selling hotdogs, hamburgers, sodas, etc. She has had this business for twenty years and she works from 4pm to 9pm every day. She tells us that her business is doing well since every day she tries to offer better service to her customers. María has a good relationship with the other members of the bank. This is her third loan with FUNDACION ESPOIR and she feels very thankful for the earlier loans as they have allowed her to get economically stable. With the new loan from the foundation, she will invest in the expansion of her business and will purchase sodas, juices and disposable goods. Her goal is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: office remodeling, kitchen supplies, soft drinks, paper plates

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a 51-year-old widow with six children. She is a hardworking woman who sells rechargeable phone cards and also makes photocopies of documents for her customers. She is requesting the loan amount 50,000 NGN to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and a photocopier. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and a photocopier

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is already 39 years old and is married to Graciano N.. They live peacefully in the village of Nagassican, Santiago City, together with their child, Reymond, who is already 11 years old.

Evelyn manages a home-based store and at the same time she is vending viands (tasty dishes) in order to have another source of income. She is thankful because her business is improving, but she still needs to continue improving it so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family.

Evelyn would like to obtain a loan of Php 5,000 as additional capital for purchasing her merchandise and for the improvement of her viands-vending business. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted for the welfare of her child.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her store and her vending business

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im N. is a 30-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. Besides her farm work, Im N. also sells fresh fish that she gets from her husband's fishing. This couple has two school-aged children. They live together in a medium sized home. Im N. thinks that the fishing business is the profitable part of their current family income. Im N. requests a loan to buy more nets and traps to supply her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To buy more nets and traps to supply her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es: Milagro G. D. Z. D. 57 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, y así mismo hace pupusas las cuales las venD. en el mismo lugar. Milagro es una persona muy alegre, la cual disfruta D. la compañía D. las personas, ya que en su caso vive sola y es la única que vela por su propio bienestar y sustento. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su tienda, lo cual le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias y D. esta manera podrá mejorar su situación económica actual.
texts.en:
57-year old Milagro G. D. Z. lives in Ahuachapán department. She runs a shop selling perishable goods, and also makes pupusas (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) which she sells in her store. Milagro is a lively person who enjoys the company of other people. As she lives alone, she is responsible for her own wellbeing and support. For this reason she is asking for a loan to buy more stock for her store which will allow her to earn more money and improve her current financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy ingredients to make tortillas and pupusas

loans.name: Dipase Jonathan

texts.en: Dipase Jonathan O. is a 43 year old father of 2 who is separated from his wife. He is the guardian of his children and a poultry farmer in Malanga, Busia district. Dipase says that life gets a little difficult because he has to be both father and mother. He says he is not in hurry to remarry; his main concerns are his poultry business and the well being of his children. Dipase would like a loan of KES 30,000 which will be used to finance the new vegetable business at his farm. He says the customer base is already set and business has picked up.  He needs to finance the business both in terms of labor (because he cannot be everywhere at the same time) and expansion of the planting area.

loans.use: expand into vegetable farming

loans.name: Florentina's Group

texts.en:
Florentina C. is from the village of Macatal, Aurora, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Florentina is the group leader for an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Florentina C.'s Group.

Florentina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Florentina owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Florentina has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florentina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florentina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Florentina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna D. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Vilageois depuis 7 ans. Elle fait de la broderie et vente de draps de lit. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes et de participer à la prise en charge familiale
texts.en:
Sokhna D. is a 29-year-old woman, married and mother of four children. She has been a member of a ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group for seven years. She does embroidery and sells bedsheets. Her earnings allow her to increase her savings level and participate in managing household expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her commercial activity

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo de cuatro años en casa de su hermana, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de costurería desde hace diez años. Estudió en un instituto de la ciudad de Chiclayo y empezó su negocio con una máquina de coser a pedal. Con el tiempo su negocio fue ampliandose, a la vez que se hacía conocida y ahora ya cuenta con una máquina de coser eléctrica y con una remalladora semi – industrial.

Ella maneja su negocio en base a pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Clara desea empezar a confeccionar sus propias prendas para venderlas por cuenta propia, por ese motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de telas y materiales para lograr su objetivo.

Clara es una mujer responsable, alegre y que gusta mucho del trabajo que hace. Sus clientes le tienen bastante estima y consideración, su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Clara is a 43 year old mother who lives in her sister's house, one hour outside Chiclayo in Cayaltí, with her husband and her four-year old son. For the last 10 years, she has worked as a seamstress. She studied in an institute in Chiclayo and began her business with one pedal-operated machine. As she knew it would, with time, her business grew and now she uses an electric machine sewing machine and a semi-industrial overstitch machine. She manages her business based on the orders she receives from her clients. Clara wants to begin making her own garments and selling them herself. For this reason it has become necessary to take out a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. She plans to use the loan to buy fabrics and materials to achieve this goal. Clara is a responsible, happy woman who very much likes the work she does. Her clients have a lot of esteem and respect for her. Clara´s biggest dream is someday being able to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and material for making garments

loans.name: Bertille

texts.fr: A. Bertille est née le 5 novembre 1952 à Parakou, dans le Nord du Bénin.  Bertille est veuve et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés.  Bertille vit seule avec ses enfants au quartier Cocotomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a deux ans que la famille s’est installée là-bas.  Bertille n’a fait que l’école primaire.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Bertille vend  des boissons de la SOBEBRA (Société Béninoise de Brasserie) et des plateaux d’œufs au parc MIVVO à Sèmè-Podji.  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et dans certains dépôts de boissons de Cotonou que Bertille s’approvisionne.  Bertille a 18 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et sollicite son premier crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
A. Bertille was born on November 5, 1952 in Parakou, in northern Benin. She is a widow and the mother of four children who all had schooling. She lives alone with her children in the Cocotomey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The family settled there two years ago. Bertille attended primary school only. To address her needs, she sells beverages from SOBEBRA (Société Béninoise de Brasserie) and trays of eggs at the MIVVO parking lot in Sèmè-Podji. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from certain Cotonou beverage outlets. Bertille has eighteen years of experience in this domain and is requesting her first loan from ALIDé to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beverages

loans.name: Mr. Touch Nak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Touch N. is the village bank president of a seventeen-member group and all the members live in Chheu Teal Phlouh village in Takeo province. The members of this group will each use the loan to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support their family’s standard of living, and they hope to increase their income to improve their family’s standard of living, too.

Mr. Touch N. is a farmer who own a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) piece of land he uses to cultivate rice. He is also a village chief who earns a small salary to support his family. This couple has five children, one of whom is a bodyguard while the other four are students in the local school.

Mr. Touch N.’s wife, Mrs. Touch Ouk, is a pig breeder. In order to support his wife’s business, Mr. Touch N. decided to ask for 400,000 Riels from AMK to buy pig feed.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for his wife's business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mr. Kong C. is 49 years old and his wife, Mrs. Pon Chhum, is 44 years old. They have been married since 1979 and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. Two of the children are married and live outside the family home, two are construction workers, one works in a garment factory and the other three attend school. They live in a small village along National Road Number Five about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Kong was not in the photo; his wife is pictured instead. 

Kong is a fisherman and his wife sells meatballs. Besides these businesses, the couple also grows rice on their farmland in the village. Kong is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase cows to use on his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase cows to use on his rice farm.

loans.name: Guadalupe María

texts.es: La Sra. Guadalupe María Moron R. de  40 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos. Cuenta con  casa propia de material noble ubicada en sector Cantoral de Santiago. Trabaja como operaria de producción desde hace 3 años en una empresa agroindustrial. Su conyuge percibe otros ingresos como obrero. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Guadalupe María, who is 40 years old, has 2 children and her own house made of durable material, located in the Cantoral sector of Santiago. She has worked for 3 years as a production operator in an agro-industrial enterprise. Her spouse receives additional income as a worker. Guadalupe is an enterprising person, who thanks to her effort, came to acquire her goods. She needs the loan to finish constructing her home, which was affected by the earthquake of 2007. Her dream is to actually finish building her home, with the goal of achieving a better quality of life. Guadalupe is very grateful for the help she has received by means of this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FINISHING RECONSTRUCTION OF HER EARTHQUAKE-DAMAGED HOME

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
El Señor Félix Pedro L. Rodríguez Labora como Supervisión de Seguridad  en el Mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua.
 El  tiene un hijo a su cargo, y este se  encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, arena, para reforzar las paredes de su casa de habitación.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor Félix Pedro L. Rodríguez Labora como Supervisión de Seguridad en el Mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua. El tiene un hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, arena, para reforzar las paredes de su casa de habitación. Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “MILAGROSA VIRGEN DEL CARMEN II”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. JULIA,  ella tiene 38 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 12, y 2 años de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella vende pasamanería y joyas, en el mercado de confraternidad; Nuestra socia elabora ella misma aretes, collares, pulseras en níquel, alpaca y alambre, también trae del departamento de Puno – Juliaca, diferentes artículos de todo tipo como pasadores, cepillos, corta uñas, escobillas, jaboncillos, pastas dentífricas y mucho mas. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y vender e su stand.
  
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II Communal Bank. She lives in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco, Cusco department. Our member is named Julia. She is 38 years old and lives with her common-law partner and her three children, who are ages 17, 12 and 2. She alternates between household activities and retail trade. She sells fringes, trims and decorations in the Confraternidad Market. She makes earrings, necklaces and bracelets of nickel, nickel silver and wire. She also transports all kinds of different items such as shoelaces, brushes, fingernail clippers, soaps, toothpaste and more from the department of Puno, Juliaca district. Julia is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to sell at her stand. She is grateful and appreciates the help offered through this medium. She is committed to achieving repayment of her debt within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell at her stand.

loans.name: Toi

texts.en: Toi T. N. was born in 1955. She has four children (2 girls and 2 boys). They are married and earn their own income. Her husband died in 1996. Since then, she has had to raise her children alone. Mrs. Toi has a store. Now, she has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2008 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she needs 5,014,000 VND to expand her store.

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Elena María

texts.es:
Elena es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Olmos, el distrito con mayor extensión territorial de la región, esta conformado por un pueblo central y por varios caseríos que distan mucho entre si, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece todo tipo de productos de buena calidad con un trato amable, lo que le ha permitido hacerse conocida en el medio y tener a un grupo de clientes fieles que prefieren su negocio. Esta actividad es una fuente importante de ingresos para la economía de su familia, por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacarla adelante.

Elena desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Elena es una mujer responsable y emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elena is a 31 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Olmos district; the largest in the region. It includes a central village and surrounding neighborhoods a good distance from there. The zone is located in the Lambayeque province, located one hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling basic need products and groceries out of her home for more than a year. There she provides good customer service and sells all types of good quality products. This has allowed her to become well known and maintain loyal customers who prefer to buy from her. This is an important source of income that allows her to provide for her family and move them ahead. Elena would like to expand her business by buying more products so that she can increase her sales and income. She is asking for her first loan, of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa. Elena is a responsible enterprising woman whose greatest desires are to continue to grow as an entrepreneur and provide a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Leila Rosa

texts.es: Leila Rosa tiene 37 años, por lo que su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, pues fue con fondos propios productos de sus ahorros y también con la ayuda de de su esposo que siempre le ha proporcionado ayuda cuando más la ha necesitado. Pues siempre se levanta temprano a las 7 de la mañana para tener todo listo hasta los quehaceres del hogar. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de granos básicos, cosméticos, ropa interior entre otras.
texts.en:
Leila Rosa is 37 years old, and she runs a corner shop. She started this activity more than 7 years ago, funding it both with her savings and thanks to the aid of her husband, who has always helped her out when she needed it the most. She always wakes up very early, at 7 am, to have it all ready, including her housework. Then loan she is requesting will be used to buy various products, among which basic grains, cosmetics and underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia A., from the village of Bugo, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City, is 58 years old, married, and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. Delia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

location.town: Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie C. is a 42-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and buying and selling eggs. She lives in Brgy. Kaungkod, Madredijos, Cebu. Tessie has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002, and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and by her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening and egg businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Tessie is now borrowing 20,000 PHP to use as additional capital. This will be her twelfth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Tessie hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Dora Margarita

texts.es:
Dora de 47 años, ella tiene un local de venta de plásticos como tarrinas, vasos, cucharas. Vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil. 

Empezó vendiendo bebidas, golosinas pero no tenia muchos ingresos así que decidió invertir casi todas sus ahorros y comprar plásticos para vender. Ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Cada tarrina la vende a $ 0.30, vasos a $ 0.15, platos a $ 0.15 c/u, en ocasiones vende al por mayor. 

Para comprar que su negocio este mas surtido quiere comprar con el préstamo plásticos,bebidas, en el futuro quiere tener una distribuidora de plásticos y así dar empleo a jóvenes emprendedores.
texts.en:
Dora is 47 years old and has a store where she sells plastic goods such as bowls, cups, and spoons. She lives in the urban area of Orquídeas de Guayaquil.

Dora started selling beverages and sweets, but this did not generate much income. She then decided to invest almost all of her savings so that she could buy plastics to sell. Now she works every day from 7am to 7pm. Dora sells bowls from $0.30/each, cups for $0.15/each, and plates for $0.15/each. On some occasions she sells in bulk.

She will use her loan to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing plastic goods and beverages. In the future, Dora wants to have a plastics distribution center and provide employment to young entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic goods & beverages

loans.name: Siulepa

texts.en:
Siulepa S. is 48 and married with eight children. Her business is selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Siulepa has many years of experience in this business.  

Siulepa needs a loan of 1500 Samoan talas to buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or about $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Siulepa joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Siulepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags

loans.name: Gbiril

texts.en:
This is 57-year-old Gibril.  He is married and has four children who are all adults living independent lives. He has seven additional dependents, who live with him because they are his relatives and he is the eldest in his family.  

In 2007, Gibril established a cinema, sports, and games business. He began his business after he retired from his job. He started this business because he needed to find a new way of earning a living.  Working 3 days a week and 4 hours a day, he earns about 1,248,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) every month from this business. He would like a loan 3,000,000 SLL. Gibril requires a loan in order to buy a satellite dish and decoder. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 249,600 SLL. In the future, Gibril plans to expand the cinema space, get new satellite channels, and open a new business for his wife. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sports and games items

loans.name: Utamaduni Group

texts.en:
Rehani S. is in his late twenties and is unmarried. He has been running a phone accessory shop for the past two years, where he sells chargers, phone covers and batteries. Rehani's shop is open between 6 am and 10 pm daily, and earns Rehani a good monthly profit.

This will be Rehani's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Rehani used the previous loans to improve his store facilities, as well as increasing his stock of spare parts, protective cases, batteries and chargers. Both loans have been successfully repaid. Rehani aims to use this loan to stock up on products and thereby increase sales and the business. Rehani's dream is to be a successful business man one day. 

Rehani will share this loan with his loan group, Utamaduni, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Rehani is seen in the back row, third from left, wearing white and green.

loans.use: To increase his stock of products.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is from the village of Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City, Mis. Occ . She is 42 years old. Patricia  is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Patricia works in Food Vending in her local community. Patricia has been in this business for about  7 years and earns approximately  5,000 PHP a month for this activity. 

In the year 2005 Patricia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This is her 5th loan taken  from PMPC. Previously she repaid a loan of PHP 7,000. This loan was used as additional inventory capital for her business  and the profit used to financially support immediate members of her family. Patricia is now requesting a new loan from PMPC amounting to 8,000 PHP. Patricia is an outstanding member of PMPC. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her Food Vending

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Y's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people. Mrs. Y P. is 58 years old and is the group leader for the loan, having been selected by the members of this group, which located in Preaek Ta Hing village, Kandal Province. 

P. earns her living by tailoring clothes to sell, while her husband, Mr. Ork Ang, 56 years old, works as a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to cultivate vegetables. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support the family. The couple has two children: one is a television repairer while the other is a student in the local school.

For the dressmaking business, P. will use the loan from AMK to buy more clothes to tailor and sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to tailor and sell

loans.name: Mwanaache

texts.en:
Mwanaache is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, food and hospital bills.

For over five years, she has operated a weaving business selling house mats, hats and clothes to tourists visiting her area of operation. Mwanaache faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the months of April and May, few tourists visit the country, hence less income, while during the months of November and December, the season is high because of the high number of tourists visiting the country, hence high numbers of customers which increases her income. She hopes to establish a grocery shop and open a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase weaving materials for weaving baskets, hats and clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to start a business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for weaving baskets, hats and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Grace Cherop

texts.en:
Grace Cherop K. is 28 years old and married to Daniel Misoi, who is a businessman earning additional income for the family. They have one school-going child of three years and they live in Cheplasgei Eldoret, Kenya. Grace has been operating a general shop for three years and earns a monthly profit of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Grace learned about KADET through a credit officer and is applying for her third loan of 37,000 KES from KADET. She intends to buy three boxes of cooking oil, four bags of sugar, five crates of soda and other stock that needs to be added. With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand the shop business. In the future, Grace wishes to have a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy three boxes of cooking oil, four bags of sugar and five crates of soda

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un padre de familia de 56 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, un distrito agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Chepén, en la región La Libertad. Una localidad situada a una hora y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de refrescos y papas rellenas en un quiosco situado en un colegio de mujeres de la zona en donde vive. El ofrece su mercadería a diario y la temporada de mejor acogida es la temporada escolar. Actualmente ya tiene más de seis años de experiencia y con los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Daniel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más insumos para seguir preparando refrescos y papas rellenas durante el verano. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Daniel is a father, he is 56 years old and he lives together with his wife and their children in the district of Pueblo Nuevo, an agricultural region in the province of Chepen, in the region of La Libertad. It is located one hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital region of Lambayeque. 

He sells fresh fruit drinks and stuffed potatoes from a food stall located in a ladies' college in the region where he lives. He sells his products every day, products that sell very well, especially during the school year. He has more than six years in the business and the income that he earns he is able to support his family. 

Daniel wishes to expand his business with the purchase of more ingredients and stuffed potatoes during the summer. He has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles in order to reach his goal.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his business.

loans.name: Ailliene

texts.en:
Ailliene N. is a married woman who lives in Crossing Moises, Brgy. Camangcamang, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a pig raising  business.  Her husband Nestor, who is 40 years old, works as a driver to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 1 to  20 years old. 

Ailliene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ailliene has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs so that she could continue to save up for future home repairs and the education of her children. 

Ailliene N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase feed and vaccines for the pigs

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

Carmen  es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudarse para seguir adelante con su negocio y así poder tener para mejorar su calidad de vida, ella tiene 54 años de edad, está soltera y vive con su hermano en casa de su familia.

Tiene un negocio de compra y venta de mariscos, tiene un local en su casa en el cual ofrece a sus clientes variedad de pescado y mariscos en general, trabaja cuatro días a la semana ya que hay días que hay veda y no se puede conseguir los mariscos ya que ella les compra a los pescadores que salen a pescar en sus pangas, nos cuenta que lleva ya 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que ha tenido días buenos y otros no tan buenos pero que ha logrado salir adelante a punta de trabajo y gracias también a los créditos.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón, y otros mariscos. Sus sueños son tener un gran frigorífico.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish on Portoviejo street, the members of the Crucita Community Bank meet. The area is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and are frequented by local and foreign tourists who know the locale as Crucita la Bella.

Carmen is a founding member of the community bank, and she likes it because she has been able to use the loans to help herself move forward with her business and thereby has been able to have a better quality of life. She is 54 years old; she is single and lives with her brother in his family's house.

She has a business buying and selling shellfish; she has a store in her home where she offers customers a variety of fish and shellfish in general. She works four days a week since there are days when there is a ban and she can't get the seafood since she buys it from the fishermen who go out to fish in their canoes. She tells us that she has been in this business for 20 years and she has had good days and not so good days, but she has been able to move forward because of her work and also thanks to the loans.

This loan is to purchase fish, shrimp, and other shellfish. Her dream is to have a large refrigerator.

loans.use: Purchase fish, shrimp, and more shellfish

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: El señor José Ramón tiene 29 años, es casado y tiene un hijo a su cargo. El señor tiene un taller de refrigeración  ubicado en su casa de habitación en el cual brinda el servicio de refrigeración y compostura. José dio inicio a su negocio hace 5 años, cabe señalarse el señor se dedicaba a esta actividad desde muy joven, pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Cuando dio inicio el señor no tenía suficiente capital pero con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado obtener clientes y mejorar su negocio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima como equipos refrigerantes, válvulas, filtros entre otros. El sueño es llegar a establecer un taller más grande y tener su propio local pues actualmente alquila.
texts.en:
Mr. José Ramón is 29 years old, married and has one son under his care.  He has an auto cooling system repair workshop which he operates out of his home.  José set up his business five years ago.  He has been working in this activity since he was very young and he has always been hard-working.

When he began the business he did not have enough capital but he was able to establish a customer base and improve his income.

He plans to use the loan to buy cooling equipment, valves, and filters, among other things.  His dream is to establish and own a larger workshop.  He is now renting.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 33 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 7 years old. Her business is well organized. She has two people to help her, and her business is open from 6am until 8pm every day.

Clarisse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more products like salt, sugar, rice and so on. With profits from this loan, Clarisse hopes to build a building for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Marisela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marisela A. realiza su trabajo desde hace 2 años  comenzó vendiendo interiores, ahora vende ropa en los pueblos los sábados y domingos. Su esposo la ayuda viajando hasta los lugares (Salitre, Yaguachi, Milagro etc.)
Unas de sus inconvenientes por ahora es el invierno ya que llueve mucho y los lugares donde vende su mercadería están inaccesibles llegar.

Con el préstamo  va a comprar ropa, pantalones, camisas y interiores. Unas de sus metas es obtener una cartera de clientes de unos  50 y entregar su mercadería hasta los días (jueves y viernes) en los pueblos.
texts.en:
Marisela A. has been working for two years; she started out selling underwear.  Now she sells clothes in the towns on Saturdays and Sundays.  Her husband helps her travel to the places (Salitre, Yaguachi, Milagro, etc.)

One of the current inconveniences she’s facing is winter; it rains much and the places she visits to sell her merchandise are inaccessible.

She will use the loan to buy clothes: pants, shirts and underwear.  One of her goals is to have a regular base of about 50 customers and to sell her wares in the towns on Thursdays and Fridays too.

loans.use: For pants, shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth de 26 años, nacida en el distrito de Quimbiri; convive con Rafael Quispe de 33 años de edad y tienen 03 hijos y cuentan con su propia casa ubicada en la localidad de Lobo Tahuantinsuyo caserío del distrito de Quimbiri. Lisbeth y su pareja Rafael son el pilar de sus hijos, ha Lisbeth desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a remover la tierra. ella es campesina y cuenta con 07 hectáreas de terreno cultivado con plantas de café y plantaciones de plátano; plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene removiendo la tierra hace 06 años en su propia parcela, pero en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los peones quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos hasta los tendales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de dichos frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en los distritos de Kimbiri y San Francisco; lugares donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Su dificultad radica en no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas; es por ello que acude a los créditos que facilita la Institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café ya que cuenta con 01 hectárea de terreno no cultivado. Este su Primer crédito de Lisbeth con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles solicitados, realizará el pago a los jornaleros quienes se encargaran en cosechar los granos de café.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is 26 years old and she is originally from the district of Quimbiri. She lives with her common-law partner Rafael Quispe who is 33 years old. They have 3 children and they have their own house located in the community of Lobo Tahuantisuyo, in the district of Quimbiri. Lisbeth and her partner are the support for their children. Lisbeth was taught by her parents at a very young age how to work the land.

Lisbeth is a farmer and she has 7 hectares of land to cultivate coffee plants and bananas. They are native plants in the jungle region of Valle Rio Apurimac. She has been working the land for the past 6 years and she has her own fields but during the harvest she hires two farm hands to harvest and transport the products to the distributors. What she most enjoys about her work is the harvest. She always feels that the months of heavy work bring have their reward with the quality of the harvest. The most difficult part of the work has to transport the products form her community all the way to the distribution centers located in Quimbiri and San Francisco. This is where she gets better prices for her products. Her difficulties lie in not being able to count on financial resources to cover the advance payment required by the laborers who help her with her harvest. This is the reason why she requests a loan from MFP (Kiva Field Partner). But her trop priority now is to plant more coffee on a hectare of land that is not cultivated. This is the first loan that Lisbeth has with MFP and she knows that if she pays it on time she will be able to access future loan with greater ease. With the 1500 nuevos soles she requests she will hire laborers to help her harvest coffee grains.

loans.use: to hire day workers to help with the coffee harvest

loans.name: Jivon

texts.en:
Mr. Jivon S. and his wife, Mrs. Souvpon Keov, live along National Road No. 1 approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have six sons. One is married, three are garment factory workers and the other two have full-time employment.  In the past, the couple used to be farmers but they stopped the farming business. Now, Jivon is a security guard and his wife stays at home. 

Jivon is asking for his second loan of $1,200 to purchase additional materials for his daughter-in-law’s beauty salon.
Wife's name as previous borrower - http://partners.kiva.org/lend/151239

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for his daughter-in-law’s beauty salon.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora Elena vende dulces, chocolates y otros por las fiestas y restaurantes en las noches, desde hace veinticinco años, vive en alquiler,  esta en su cuarta secuencia, también pertenece al banco de emprendimiento principiantes, esta en su segundo ciclo, ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable, la señora vive sola, es separada, sus hijos son mayores e independientes, y ella sola con su trabajo se mantiene también se dedica  al venta de quinua una vez al mes viaja a una localidad de la ciudad de Oruro a comprar quinua y después lo revende en la ciudad de Cochabamba, es una persona trabajadora y siempre activa, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería como dulces y chocolate para así tener variedad de productos para ofrecer a su clientes, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación  del crédito.
texts.en: Elena has been selling candy, chocolates, etc for parties and restaurants in the evenings for the past twenty-five years.  She lives in a rented place by herself, is separated, and her children are adults and independent.    This is her fourth loan cycle.  She belongs to the Banco de Emprendimiento Principiantes communal bank.  In the second cycle Elena proved that she was a responsible person and she alone supports herself.  She also sells quinoa and once a month she travels to a business in Oruro to buy quinoa to resell in Cochabamba.  She is hardworking and always active.  With the money from the loan she will buy candies and chocolates to have a variety of products to offer her customers.  She is grateful to the institution for the support given her by extending the financing.

loans.use: To buy candies, chocolates, and more

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto D. C. P.  D. 33 años D. edad es un habitante D.
