Bina is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She is a rice farmer who currently owns three-quarters of a hectare of rice field, which she hopes to cultivate. One of her goals in life is to give her children a proper education, and she and her husband work hard to achieve this.
Bina joined Kiva partner, CEVI, a microfinance institution in the Philippines, to gain access to financial services. She says that her previous loans have really helped her a lot, especially because of their low interest rates. Bina is now requesting to borrow 8,000 PHP. She will use this loan to supply her farm with seeds, fertilizers and other inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita T. is from the village of Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 51 years old. Florita is married and has 5 adult children. Florita owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products such as sugar, shampoo, soap & toothpaste. Florita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC. Florita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Florita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: James Group

texts.en:
Comfort is thirty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are between the ages of one and seventeen years. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the community. Her husband is a security man.

Comfort is a hard-working woman. She is into the palm oil production business. She has been producing palm oil for the past twelve years and has acquired rich experience in her business. Comfort buys her raw materials (palm nuts) from nearby communities. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

Comfort is the leader of a six-member trust bank group called ‘James’. The group is made up mainly of traders. They are requesting the loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy palm nut fruits to make palm oil

loans.name: Mr. Sros Chhun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eighteen people who live in Kaoh Prah village in Kandal province. Mr. Sros C. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members, who will each use the loan for different purposes. He is a construction worker, who earns a low income T. support his family. His wife, Mrs. Seynat V., is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where she cultivates rice T. also support her family.

In the rice field they have a problem because their field is far from an irrigation system, but they do not have enough money. Thus, Mr. Sros C. decided T. ask for a loan T. buy a hose, and he wants T. use the rest of the loan T. buy two bicycles for his education and transportation T. work for the children. He is a father of six children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other three are enrolled in the local public school, and the other is too young T. work or study.

On the day of the loan disbursement Mr. Sros C. was busy working. Instead, his wife, Mrs. Seynat V., received the loan for him. The phoT. above is of Mr. Sros C.'s wife.

loans.use: To buy a hose for irrigation.

loans.name: Merta Jati Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu S. is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Putu is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 'Merta Jati' (MUK-0026).

Ni Putu is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Putu owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Putu has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ni Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Putu is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK in the amount of 1,300,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Putu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Putu S. (0) merupakan 45 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Putu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Merta Jati (MUK-0026).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Putu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Putu bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Putu meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,300,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda P. is from the village of Baliwagan , Balingasag Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Luzminda is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana pertenece al Banco Comunal Florecer, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos que están estudiando, Yovana tiene una tienda en su casa hace 4 años, en donde vende abarrotes en general, gaseosas, helados, recargas, su negocio ha crecido poco a poco, Yovana abre su tienda todos los días. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de recargas telefónicas y tarjetas.
Yovana sueña con terminar de pagar su préstamo con el cual construyo su casa y educar a sus hijos para que sean mejores que ella.
texts.en:
Yovana, 31, is a member of the Florecer (To Bloom) communal bank; she has two children who are students. For the past 4 years she has had a grocery store in her home where she sells assorted groceries, soft-drinks, frozen treats, pre-paid phone cards; her business has been gradually growing. She is open for business every day and plans to use the loan to buy pre-paid phone cards. Yovana dreams with paying off her home construction loan and to provide an education for her children so that they will be better than her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pre-paid phone cards.

loans.name: Lesbia Esperanza

texts.es: Lesbia Esperanza tiene 48 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 25 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que es así que tiene esta actividad, en donde recuerda que su primer año le fue difícil pero conforme pasaba el tiempo pudo nivelarse y posteriormente sus ganancias aumentaron. Se siente muy satisfecha con lo que ha logrado, es por ello que en el futuro espera obtener su propia tienda, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería, con el propósito de aumentar sus ingresos como también mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Lesbia Esperanza is 48 years old. Her business is clothing sales, a business she started more than 25 years ago. She remembers that her first year was very difficult, but with time things leveled out and her earnings grew. Lesbia feels very satisfied with what she has accomplished. In the future, she hopes to have her own store. With this in mind, she commits to being punctual in her payments. With this loan, she will invest in merchandise with the goal of increasing her income and also bettering her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jeffrey Hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old. Veronica is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Veronica owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Veronica from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Librado

texts.en:
Librado A. is from the village of Acmac, Iligan City. He is 36 years old. Librado is single. Librado owns & operates a hardressing and beauty services business. He has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. He belongs to the third sex society which is why he has long hair and is wearing a woman's blouse.

In 2009, Librado joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. He is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Librado from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Acmac, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Miguel Isidro

texts.en:
Miguel Isidro G. Beltrán is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador.

Miguel is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Miguel also works in agriculture and raises pigs. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther. 

Miguel plans to use the loan to raise more pigs. He says that with the help of the loan, his business will be more productive. His goal is to have his own house within the next five years. 

After work, he likes to play the guitar.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Sereno Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Sereno C. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como conserje en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene  tres años de laborar para dicha Institución. En Ceprodel se le han otorgado dos créditos para mejorar su vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para seguir mejorando su vivienda y brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sereno C. is from El Sauce. She works as a caretaker for the City of El Sauce. She’s been thus employed for three years. Ceprodel has granted her two loans for home improvements. The requested loan is to buy bricks, cement and sand and to pay for labor costs to continue making home improvements and provide her children with a better living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement and sand and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkan, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 45 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Djinina, sous préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce d’habits de tous genres, du charbon de bois, du bois de chauffe, de céréales et des beignets à base de haricot et de mil.                                                                                                             
Ces femmes du groupe Benkan sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire, après avoie bien remboursés les deux prêts précédents.                                                                                        
DJOULE S. du groupe Benkan compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des habits pour toutes catégories de personnes.
Elle s’approvisionne essentiellement à Bamako et effectue sa vente au village et au marché de Fana, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Benkan are all married and on average they are 45 years old and have 2 children. They all live in large traditional families in the village of Djinina in the Fana and Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are known through family and neighbours and they sell clothing, wood coal, firewood, cereal grains and baked donuts. The women of the Benkan group are on their third loan cycle, following having successfully repaid two past loans. Djoule S. of the Benkan group plans on using her loan to purchase clothing of all kinds. She makes her purchases in Bamako for later resale in the market in Fana. She completes her sales in cash and credit to a clientele made up of both women and men. She forsees having a monthly income of 15 FCFA and it will be used to cover the daily expenses for the family adn the rest will be reinvested back into the business.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Hishigjargal

texts.en:
Hishigjargal R. is 39 year old and  lives with her husband and one daughter in the Hentiy province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband works as a chairman at the Judicial Decision Execution Agency of the local province. Her daughter attends a local elementary school. She operates a second hand clothes trading business in her town. She started her business in 2010 by renting a small stall in the local market to sell a variety of used clothing that have been imported from Korea.  At first, the working capital was 500, 000 MNT and soon grew to over 1 ,500 ,000 MNT. Within a short time, her business has reached at sustainable level and she was able to improve greatly her family's standard of living. Her earnings have enabled her to buy a new car for her family. Today, she focuses on her dream of owning her own house in the future. 

She is requesting a  2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of products in order to increase her product line for her growing store.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mrs. Mary L. (in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Mat Sos, live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1985 and have six children--four sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live in separate homes, two are fishermen, and other two are in school. 

Mary’s husband is a fisherman and she sells the fish that her husband catches in the local market. She is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase additional fishing materials for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing materials for her husband’s fishing business

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia was married 21 years ago to M. A. who is a private entrepreneur and is in the business of selling cooking oil. He sells oil packets and oil cans to his customers on demand. He has been operating his business from a shop in the market for over 5 years.
  
Safia is a housewife who stays at home and does her household tasks. She has given birth to 3 sons. Her eldest son has passed the 5th grade and helps his father in his business by handling her husband's shop in his absence and by serving his customers without complaint. Safia's two younger sons are enrolled in school and are getting their education. With her family, Safia has lived in the city of Gujranwala, in an area named Faqirpura, for over 10 years.  

Safia has applied for a loan for her husband's business from Kiva partner Asasah. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. Her husband will use the loan to purchase cooking oil in larger quantities and sell it through his shop. Safia is hopeful that through this investment her husband’s business will grow and earn him more income. She is very hopeful about the good outcome of her husband’s business. 

[Note: In the photo, the lady in the center holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Safia.]

loans.use: To buy cooking oil in larger quantities for selling

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a housewife, stays at home and does her household work. She is a very active and supportive lady who has been living in the city of Khanewal since her marriage with K. 21 years ago. Khanewal is a small city in Punjab province known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family.

Her husband works in Pakistan railways and also has a part-time business of tailoring. His shop is in the market and earns him good income. He specifically sews gents clothes and is very famous among his customers due to his quality work. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her elder son is also a tailor while her daughter is studying in eighth class.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business of tailoring. With the loan, he will buy another sewing machine and also hire a worker who will assist him in his work and in completing the work on time.

EID season is near and Nasreen is hopeful that during this season, her husband will get a large number of orders and an additional sewing machine will help him do his business more efficiently and in completing the orders as well.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for tailoring business

loans.name: Cesar Alejandro

texts.es:
Cesar es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Motupe, una zona conocida a nivel nacional por sus fiestas religiosas que congregan a miles de personas anualmente.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar maíz y otros cultivos, el ya tiene más de doce años de experienncia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la econnomía diaria de su familia.

Cesar desea brindar mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para instalar una nueva plantación de maíz, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Cesar is a father, 57 years old, and lives with his family in the Moyupe district, an area known for its religious celebrations where thousands of people congregate annually.

He grows corn and other things. He has been doing so more than two years and throughout has learned a great deal about farming. The income he makes is used to pay for daily expenditures the family has.

Cesar wants to maintain his crop land to install a new corn crop. To do this he requested Edpyme Alternative a 700 Peruvian Soles loan.

loans.use: To maintain his crop land to install a new corn crop.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Don Leoncio habitante de Comarca Triunfo #2, labora en su unidad de producción realizando actividades agricolas, sobre todo en los cultivos de raices y tuberculos, como también el manejo de su inventario ganadero, los que le sirven como su pricipal y mayor fuente de ingreso para la estabilidad laboral y economica del nucleo familiar, su familia esta conformada por su esposa y 3 hijos los que cooperan en los quehaceres de la unidad de producción.

Necesita este financiamiento para realizar compra de 2 vacas paridas y poder ahumentar su inventario ganadero y la producción de leche, lo cual le permitira mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia, espera ser beneficiaddo con el FONDO KIVA, para realizar la obra que tiene proyectada.  

Su mayor sueño es progresar y brindar lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Leoncio lives in Triunfo #2 region.  He works on his production unit doing farm work.  His main crops are root vegetables and tubers.  He also manages his livestock inventory which serves as his main, and best, source of income for the working and financial stability of his immediate family.  His family is made up of his wife and three children who help work on the farm.

Leoncio needs this loan to buy two calved cows to increase his livestock inventory and his milk production which will enable him to improve his family's quality of life.  He hopes to receive a Kiva loan so that he can achieve this.

Leoncio's biggest dream is to make progress and provide his family with the best.

loans.use: To buy calved cows

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en:
Adolf is 41 years old and married to a teacher with three children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a permanent house for residence and his family's dream is to build a bigger house. 

He is a motorcycle cyclist and has been in the transport business for two years now with a challenge from high license fees. His vision is to own at least three motorcycles. Adolf needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Embajadores 1 & 2 Group

texts.en: Odania is the coordinator of her group, Embajadores 1 & 2 ("Ambassadors"). The group is made up of Haitian members, all of them emigrated from Haiti during different periods. Odania's story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. Odania is excited to be seeking her seventh loan with Esperanza. Notably, she already successfully repaid her previous loan, which enabled her to expand her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. Specifically, she sells clothes, so the loan will be used to purchase jeans, shirts, skills, underwear and other things for kids, women and men. She will invest the profits from her business by buying more merchandise and she will save some money for her future plans. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena A. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 47 years old. Elena is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Elena runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Elena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Ollin Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Ollin" este grupo se formo en San Juan Coajomulco, Jocotitlan, esta formado por 10 mujures exitosas, son muy trabajadores y unidas se apoyan mucho, tambien se conocen desde hace muchos años por eso fue que se animaron hacer un grupo al que llamaron "Ollin", desidieron ponerse asi porque tiene un significado que esta en Nahualt, la palabra significa movimiento, y para ellas es un movimiento el que hacen un cambio para tener una mejora en este caso una mejora economica atraves del prestamo, la comunidad donde vive el grupo esta lleno de alfareros, agricultores y profesionistas, hay poco comercio dentro de esta comunidad, los nombres de las 10 mujeres que integran el grupo son los siguientes:
1.-Maura H. T.
2.-Antonia L. A.
3.-Maria Guadalupe H. H.
4.-Yazmin T. H.
5.-Alma Aurea A. G.
6.-Reyna H. G.
7.-Ma Francisca H. S.
8.-Maria de Lourdes G. G.
9.-Angela G. G.
10.-Marisol H. G.
Estos son los nombres de las mujeres que integran el grupo, cabe mencionar que hay mujeres de este grupo como doña Angela, Alma y Reyna que pertenecen a un grupo de danzantes aztecas, las señoras junto con otras personas son danzantes y tocan los tambores y hacen varios tipos de rituales en sus danzas. la Señora Angela es la encargada del grupo vive ahi en San Juan Coajomulco, tiene 47 años y 26 años de casada, ella es artesana y tambien es danzante azteca, tiene 3 hijos pero solo dos hijos dependen de ella, una hija la mayor ya es casada y los otros dos hijos estan estudiando la universidad en lenguas indigenas, vive en casa propia donde tambien es el lugar donde fabrica las artesanias, por ejemplo fabrica pulceras echas de maderas anillos, collares y aretes, el material que usa para fabricar son semillas, hilos, cuancas, madera etc. La señora Angela sale a vender por ejemplo en las ferias i de ves en cuando acomoda un puesto para vender, pero regularmente lo hace cuando sale a danzar en el centro y con la gente que se junta le ofrece lo que hace, lo dificil en su actividad es que a la gente le guste que le agrade el producto para que lo compre, el prestamo le va ayudar a doña Angela porque nos comenta que le da una fuente de ingresos para tener mas ganancias, la meta que tiene es llegas a tener un local y vender lo que hago como tambien ahi mismo en el local fabricar los aretes y demas. Con las ganancias quiere poder seguir dando el estudio a sus hijos para que no se salgan de la escuela y la terminen.
Doña Angela tambien es empleada domestica de esta forma es como ayuda a su esposo y asus hijos para salir adelante y los motiva para seguir echandole ganas.
texts.en:
The following group is called “Ollin.”  It was formed in San Juan Coajomulco, Jocotitlan.  It’s made up of ten successful, very hard working, unified, mutually supportive women.  They have also known each other for several years and that’s why they were motivated to form a group that they called “Ollin.” They decided to call it that because in Nahuatl that word means “movement” and for them this is a movement toward improvement each one makes, in this case an economic improvement through the loan.  The community where this group lives is full of potters, farmers and professionals.  There is very little commerce within this community.  The names of the ten women who make up the group are as follows:

1.-Maura Hernández T.
2.-Antonia López Álvarez
3.-Maria Guadalupe Hernández Hernández
4.-Yazmin T. Hernández
5.-Alma Aurea Álvarez García
6.-Reyna Hernández González
7.-Ma Francisca Hernández S.
8.-Maria de Lourdes García García
9.-Angela García García
10.-Marisol Hernández González

These are the names of the women who make up the group.  It’s worth mentioning that there are women in the group, like Angela, Alma and Reyna, who belong to an Aztec dance troupe.  They, together with other women, are dancers and drummers and perform various rituals dances.

Angela is the group leader.  She lives there in San Juan Coajomulco.  She’s 47 years old and has been married 26 years.  She is an artisan and also an Aztec dancer.  She has three children but only two of them still depend on her; her oldest daughter is already married and the other two are studying Indigenous Languages at the university.  She lives in her own house where she also manufactures the crafts.  For example, she makes wood bracelets, rings, necklaces and earrings.  The materials she uses to make them are seeds, thread, beads, wood, etc.

Angela goes out to sell them at farmers’ markets, for example, and sometimes is able to set up a stand to sell but she usually does it when she dances downtown and she offers her wares to the people who gather round.  The difficult part of what she does is that the people like the products she makes so that they will buy them.

The loan will help Angela because she tells us that it provides a source of income to have more profits.  Her goal is to have a locale to sell what she makes as well as being able to manufacture the earrings and all else there.  With the profits she wants to continue providing schooling for her children so that they won’t drop out of school and finish it.

Angela is also a domestic employee and this is how she helps her husband and her children get ahead and she motivates them to continue making an effort.

loans.use: To make bracelets, rings, necklaces, etc.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal T. is married to Fat-hi and is the mother of two daughters and three sons. Amal is a housewife and her husband is a National Palestinian Authority employee. Amal's oldest son got married and Amal took out a loan from FATEN to help her son cover the wedding expenses. He is an employee with a decent salary.

Amal is a religious woman from Rafah – that's why her husband appears in the picture here instead.

loans.use: To pay for one of Amal's son's wedding expenses

loans.name: Helena

texts.es:
Helena Perez Martínez  y su esposo se dedicaron  a desarrollar actividades  microempresariales, porque no tenían un  empleo para sostener a su familia  de 4 hijos, que se encuentran en las edades de 12 a 17 años. Con esta idea compraron una carretilla e iniciaron su negocio de vender frutas y verduras, este negocio fue creciendo y  lograron adicionar otro , con tal de aumentar el ingreso familiar entre los dos, fue así  como Helena empezó el negocio de ofrecer servicios de alquiler de lavadoras, con el que ahora tienen  5 maquinas que arriendan por día en la comunidad, donde es  ya, muy conocida.
Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprarán verduras, hortalizas y frutas  al por mayor para distribuir en tiendas, y además incluirán la venta de ropa especialmente para colegiales.  Su sueño es terminar de construír su vivienda, con su primer financiamiento logró utilidades adicionales que lo ayudaron a adecuar dos de sus habitaciones y también con este mismo financiamiento aumentaron su capital de trabajo.  Ahora sueña con tener un local adecuado,  para ofrecer sus productos, aunque su mas grande desafío es el poco capital con el que cuentan, por eso buscan apoyo en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para lograr aumentarlo.
texts.en:
Helena Perez M. and her husband decided to start a small business because they did not have an employment to support their 4 children. They are between the ages of 12 and 17 years of age. With this idea in mind they purchased a cart and they started their business selling fruits and vegetables. This business grew and they managed to acquire a second cart in order to increase the family income between the two. This is how Helena started her business, offering laundry services. She now has 5 washers that she rents out during the day within the community where she is very well known. 

This is her second loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and with it she will purchase vegetables and fruits in wholesale to distribute to store. They will also include clothing sales, especially for schools. Her dream is to finish building her house.  With the first loan she managed to add two utilities that helped her condition two bedrooms. That loan was also used as working capital. She now dreams of having an adequate store space to offer her products.  Her greatest challenge is the lack of capital funds, which is the reason why she seeks the support of Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables in wholesale

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn S. is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Mr. Vutha Chot, is employed as a truck driver. They have been married since 1993 and have three sons. Two attend school and the youngest is not yet of school age. The family lives approximately 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 so as to purchase a motorcycle for the family to use for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for the family to use for commuting

loans.name: Alexi Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Alexi ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 23, 22 y 20 años, dos de ellos viven con ella y estudian en universidad. El marido es chofer.

Ella tiene una tienda en su casa, allí vende productos de primera necesidad, artículos de bazar, ropa, zapatos, bisutería y ciertos medicamentos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 con la ayuda de su esposo cuando él puede. La mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y otros de los productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes,  artículos de bazar, ropa y zapatos. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal hace dos años y le gusta  la unión que hay en el grupo.
 
Sus sueños son tener una casa más grande, mejor construida y que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Nueva Generación community bank meet in Crucita parish, in Portoviejo canton, in a place called Los Arenales.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, for its rich cuisine and for the warmth of its people.

Here we meet 40 year-old Alexi who is married and has three children aged 23, 22 and 20.  Two of her children live with her and are studying at university.  Her husband is a driver.

Alexi has a store in her home where she sells essentials, miscellaneous items, clothes, shoes, costume jewelry and certain medicines.  She works every day, from 6.00am to 8.00pm, with her husband's help whenever he is able.  She buys some of her merchandise in the city of Portoviejo and the rest is delivered direct to her store.

Alexi will use this loan to stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, miscellaneous products, clothes and shoes.  She has been a member of her community bank for two years and she likes the unity that exists within the group.

Alexi's dreams are to own a bigger, better-constructed house and for her business to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, miscellaneous products, clothes and shoes

loans.name: Akouegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "AKOUEGNON" est formé de trois  personnes qui habitent  la même localité. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marcelline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marcelline, est mariée à un certain william. Le couple a deux  enfants à charge, qui ne sont pas scolarisés.  Marcelline, habite au quartier Sènadé  à Cotonou (Capitale économique du Bénin) avec ses enfants et son mari depuis deux ans. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de deux ans que Marcelline, mène comme activité, la vente de friperies à Cotonou. Parallèlement à cela elle vend des produits cosmétiquies . Marcelline, s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Marcelline, désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en:
AKOUEGNON group is composed of three people who live in the same community. The leader of the group, named Marcelline, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. The group is seeking its second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Marcelline is married to one William. The couple has two children to support, who do not attend school. Marcelline has been living in the Sènadé neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, with her children and her husband, for two years. The couple takes care of the various family expenses together.

For about two years ago, Marcelline has been selling used clothing in Cotonou. In parallel, she sells cosmetics. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. With the goal of bolstering her stock and better meeting customer demand, she would like to get a loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es: Dinora Elizabeth D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad, viuda, vive con sus dos hijos los cuales aun se encuentran estudiando. Ella posee una tienda que es la más visitada por los clientes, pues está ubicada en un lugar muy concurrido D. personas y además ahí reciben el mejor servicio; siempre está adelante D. su competencia tiene los mejores precios, un lugar muy higiénico y siempre encuentran lo que necesitan; Dinora tiene grandes metas y para ella, mientras más granD. sea su meta más pequeños se vuelven los obstáculos es por eso que le solicita a  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita abastecer su negocio con productos como granos básicos, lácteos, bebidas, productos instantáneos, golosinas entres otros; D. esta forma podrá satisfacer a su clientela y al mismo tiempo satisfacer las necesidades D. su hogar. Dinora tiene fe que todo este esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Dinora Elizabeth is forty-three years old, a widow, and lives with her two children who are in school.  She has a store that is well frequented by customers, as she is located in an area with a lot of foot traffic and offers the best service.  She is always ahead of her competition, offering customers the best prices, a clean establishment, and a place where they can find what they need.  Dinora has great goals and, for her, the bigger her dream the smaller the obstacles become.  This is why she requests a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to supply her business with items such as basic grains, dairy products, beverages, instant products, and snacks, among others.  In this manner, she can satisfy her customer base while concurrently meeting the needs of her household.  Dinora has faith that all her efforts will allow her to give her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: buy basic grains, dairy products, beverages, instant products, and snacks to supply her store.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Leonardo; el tiene 54 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de helados y venta de pasteles, el distribuye los helados y pasteles a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes del distrito de Urubamba y también lleva a lugares como Maras, Izcuchaca y Chinchero, el trabaja en forma independiente, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pasteles y helados.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, mantequilla, azúcar y fruta para preparar los helados y pasteles.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leonardo belongs to the San Jose de Urubamba Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Leonardo is 54 years old, married, and has three children.  He alternates his daily activities with his business of selling ice cream and cake.  He distributes the ice creams and cakes to different grocery stores in the Urubamba district.  He also takes them to places like Maras, Izcuchaca, and Chinchero.  He works in an independent manner.  

He wants to expand and improve his business of selling ice cream and cake.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies like flour, butter, sugar, and fruit to make the ice creams and cakes.

He is very happy about the loan, and he pledges to make all of his payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, butter, sugar, and fruit to make ice creams and cakes.

loans.name: Lourdes Jeaneth

texts.en: Lourdes is a single mother who lives in the Valle region of Honduras. For the past nine years she has made a living by selling men's and women's clothing, footwear and accessories out of her home. She has a loyal customer base and has successfully repaid four previous loans. Lourdes is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 with which she will buy merchandise to sell in her clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's clothing, footwear and accessories.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is very active and performs her daily tasks with a great sense of responsibility. She has given birth to a son and a daughter. Both of them are not of school-going age yet. Her husband has two businesses. He is a rickshaw driver as well as a fruit seller. He works very hard to fulfill the basic needs of his family. In the morning, he goes to the fruit market to sell his fruits and later he provides the transport services to the passengers. His rickshaw has grown rough and needs repair work, which is why Mariam has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband repair his business asset. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw, allowing him to run it more smoothly and provide better transport services to the passengers. He has been operating his transport business for many years and Mariam is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and increase his profits. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Mariam.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Iwale

texts.en: This borrower is currently in the business of selling a weaving bed sheet and she is requesting a loan to expand her business. She is 22 years old and married. Her husband also runs a small business. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: for buying more bed sheet for weaving,expansion.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. For the past 5 years she has had a retail shop where she sells AVON products like cosmetics & clothing. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock from AVON.

Grace is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock from AVON to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and 45 years old with five children (three are in school).

Virginia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase piglets and feed. She has been raising pigs for 10 years, and has taken nine loans from NWTF to build her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Salustio

texts.es: El señor Salustio trabaja en la policía nacional y también trabaja como electricista. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción, ya que realizara la construcción de gradas en su casa para tener un acceso más fácil y seguro al segundo piso de cu casa. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que obtuvo ya que pudo mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Salustio ha estado construyendo su casa desde hace tiempo y ha solicitado créditos en IMPRO desde el año 2006, con un historial de pagos excelente.
texts.en:
Sr. Salustio is employed by the national police and also works as an electrician.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials so that he can build a staircase, which will make it easier and safer to access the second floor of his house.  Salustio lives in his own home in the District of Las Lomas in the city of La Paz.  He is single and has no children.  

Salustio is very pleased with the loans he already received, which has allowed him to improve the conditions of his home.   He has been building his home for some time and has requested loans from IMPRO since 2006.  Salustio has an excellent payment history.

loans.use: to buy cement and stone for building a staircase in his house.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a hardworking and determined 26-year-old businessman who is single. For the past year, he has been in the motorcycle transport business to make a living. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have a fleet of motorcycles and a vehicle. His dream is to manage a chain of proprietary businesses. He is requesting a loan of 30000 Kenya shillings to start a business selling cereals. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now business oriented.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize and green peas

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is a 48-year-old married man with four children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.

He has been buying and selling beans and maize for five years, and this has helped him in educating his children. 

His hardships are price fluctuations and bad debtors, and his vision is a bigger and well established food store and an educated, poverty-free family.

Enock needs the loan to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 40   años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  La Sra. tiene educación superior
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/.  300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de maná (cereales)  como de fideo y trigo, una parte también la utilizó para el revestimiento de su vivienda.
Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar cincuenta bolsas de trigo y fideos,  para la producción de su maná, estos lo vende en Yunguyo, también vende en la ciudad de Cusco, en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo. 
Desea cambiar de giro y dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes, para generar mayores ingresos y poder cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distracción para ella.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “La Yunguyeñita”, located in the district and province of Yunguyo, deparment of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and with 2 children. She completed her higher education studies.

She works with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles, which was used for her business selling maná (cereals), like pasta and wheat. Another portion was used to make improvements to her home.

Elizabeth will request a new loan for 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to buy 50 bags of wheat and pasta for the production of her maná. She sells her products in Yunguyo and in the city of Cusco. Her children and husband help her with the business. She wants to change her line of business to the sale of groceries, which can provide better returns and will allow her to pay for her children’s studies.

What she enjoys about her Communal Bank are the meetings because they are a nice distraction for her.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of wheat and noodles.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina owns a variety store within the village of Villa Cruz San Mateo. She has had this kind of business for five years. According to her, she would like to improve her business through buying a greater stock of groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, ingredients and instant noodles to sell. Marcelina could not buy her stock groceries due to increase of household expenses, most especially the allowances of her student children and their school fees. 

With the situation they are experiencing nowadays, she is asking for additional capital amounting to P25,000. She hopes that she can make her retail shop grow so that she can support her two children in finishing their studies, and improve the standard of their living.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits,canned goods and instant noodles to sell in her shop

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is 53 years old. He is widowed and has eight children. He has been growing corn for 38 years. His net income for the last growing season was PHP 40,000.

Being a single parent is very difficult, but Norberto does his best to meet their needs. He works hard every single day to provide for the needs of his children.

Now, Roberto is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Ebtesam

texts.en: Ebtesam is a 36-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of four children. Ebtesam is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase new furniture for her house. One aspiration of Ebtesam is to do the needed maintenance for her home and get it painted. She is also looking to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture for her home

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es: La socia sigue con su negocio de artesania y venta de tejidos, la socia compra la artesania ya hecha y otro grupo lo elabora ella misma, la socia realiza bellos trabajos con sus manos hechos en lana de ovino, alpaca y sinteticos; ella hacegorros con diseños tipicos, guantes, chalinas, mantas cortas y largas. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de lanas de alpaca bebe, lana de oveja, lana sintetica, para la elaboracion de sus trabajos para estas fiestas navideñas.
texts.en: The member continues with her crafts and textile sales business.  She buys the crafts already made and the other items she makes herself.  She makes beautiful, hand-crafted sheep, alpaca and synthetic wool items.  She makes caps with traditional designs, gloves, shawls, short and long blankets.  She’s asking for the loan to buy baby alpaca wool, sheep’s wool and synthetic wool to make her crafts for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy baby alpaca wool, sheep's wool and synthetic wool.

loans.name: Francisco Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Francisco es productor agropecuario en su finca ubicada en el municipio del Santuario al oriente de Antioquia. En su finca tiene animales como gallinas, ganado,  pollos, cabras y peces. El señor Francisco ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a esta labor,la cual le ha permitido salir adelante con la compañía de su familia compuesta por sus tres hijas y su esposa. 
A sus 53 años de edad el señor francisco desea tener un mayor número de ganado que le permita aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera poder brindarles a sus tres hijas de 10, 15 y 17 años de edad una excelente educación y una calidad de vida maravillosa al lado de su esposa a quien tanto quiere.
texts.en:
Francisco is a livestock producer.  He works on his farm which is located in Santuario, in the east of Antioquia department.  On his farm he has animals such as hens, cattle, chickens, goats and fish.  Francisco has devoted most of his life to this work and it has allowed him to get ahead in life together with his family which consists of his three daughters and his wife.

At 53 years of age, Francisco would like to have more cattle which will allow him to increase his income and thereby provide his three daughters, who are 10, 15 and 17, with an excellent education and to provide both them and his wife (who he loves very much) with a marvelous quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Melita

texts.es: Melita, de 41 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además sociable y dinámica, es conviviente con Duilio, fruto de esa unión tiene tres hijos de 9, 6 y 4 años de edad, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. Melita se dedica a la venta de ropa de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, de todos lo modelos y marcas, para eso cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana que vive en la ciudad de Lima, quien le compra y le envía todos estos productos. De esa manera se ahorra gastos de viaje, para luego venderlo a sus amistades y vecinos, muchas veces dejando a créditos a 15 días. Lo  que le gusta de su actividad es el trato personal que tiene con sus clientes pues le permite socializar, ya que muchos son sus amistades, así como el conocer clientes nuevos que le buscan por recomendaciones, además de los ingreso económicos que le permite apoyar a su pareja, que se dedica al servio de taxi. Por lo contario, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es el atraso en el pago de algunos de sus clientes, pero eso no la desanima, por eso tiene planes de ampliar su negocio, queriendo abrir una tienda de venta de ropa en alguna zona comercial de la ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para poder concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en el crédito anterior. Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, pues los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa femeninas, en  mayores cantidades a menor precios, asimismo quiere  incursionar en la venta de lencería, de esa manera espera obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Melita, 41 years old, is a hardworking, sociable, and dynamic woman. She lives with her partner Duilio, and they have three children, aged 9, 6, and 4. Melita works selling all brands and styles of clothing for women, men, and children. Her sister, who lives in Lima, helps her with the business by buying and sending the clothing. This way she can save the money she would have to spend on the trip into the city. She sells the clothing to her friends and neighbors. She frequently offer 15 days of credit . She likes her job because of the personal relationships with her clients because many of them are friends. She also can meet new clients via recommendations from current clients. The job allows her to support her husband, who works as a taxi driver. One of her difficulties is clients who make late payments, but she still plans on growing her business. She hopes to open a shop in a commerical area of the city. This will be her second loan with MFP, and she hopes via this support she can begin to make concrete plans. She pledges to make her payments punctually like she did with her previous loan. She is happy with her community bank because she considers them responsible and loyal people. With the loan of 1,000 new soles she will purchase women's clothing at wholesale prices. She will begin selling lingerie, with will provide her with higher profits.

loans.use: Purchase of women's clothing

loans.name: Amgalanbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Amgalanbaatar, age 37, runs a taxi service around the districts of Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been running his business for two years. His daily earnings do not always pay for his family's necessities. 

He lives with wife and son in their house, which was built in the early 1980s. His family has been living in this house since it was built, and they have never made any improvements to it.
  
Lately his house has become very uncomfortable. It has become cold during winter and many parts are damaged. Therefore, Amgalanbaatar decided to make renovations to his house and he needs to purchase the necessary building materials to make these renovations. Then he will install a smokeless furnace in his living room. 

In the last several years, smoke and air pollution have become big issues in Mongolia. It comes from the slum district households that use coal and old cars in the cities. 

The loan Mr. Amgalanbaata is requesting will be dedicated to making renovations to his house and to buying a new smokeless furnace from a certified supplier.

loans.use: to make renovations to his house and to buy a new smokeless furnace from a certified supplier.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 54-year-old married woman with one child. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 13 years. Marina sells items like soft drinks, vinegar, soy sauce, and purified water. Marina earns about 4000 PHP per month with her business.

Marina is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as sugar, canned goods and soft drinks. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as sugar, canned goods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ana Jesús

texts.es: Ana Jesús,  es una señora muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, vive junto a su esposo y 8 hijos de los cuales los mayores le ayudan con el negocio. Ana se dedica a la agricultura de frijoles y maíz, lo que cosecha en su pequeño terreno, así mismo se dedica a la apicultura la cual es una actividad dedicada a la domesticación de las abejas, donde debe prestarles todos los cuidados necesarios con el fin  de obtener y extraer la miel. Ana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para la compra de granos básicos para sembrar, pesticidas y abono, así también para comprar un traje especial para realizar el trabajo con las abejas, un ahumador y otros materias más. El mayor deseo de Ana es mejorar sus ingresos y así poder vivir mejor junto a su familia.

loans.use: Compra de traje y ahumador para realizar trabajo de apicultura

loans.name: Juan's Group

texts.en:
Juan, Catalino and Alejandra live in Cerro Niño, a community that is 2 hours by a dusty road away from the nearest commercial center (where this picture was taken). Very few of the households in this region have energy access and they rely on ocote wood to light their households. Ocote sends out a lot of smoke and gives out very little light. This does not allow the family of Juan (he has three children) to have an adequate environment for any activities in their household. Ocote is also a health, security and environmental hazard. 

Juan works in the field, mainly with corn and consumes more than 8 pieces of ocote each week for lighting, his community and other households get these by cutting down trees in nearby forests. This mean of lighting is not only hazardous for Juan and his family, it is also dangerous because their households can burn down and it is also beginning to affect the environment due to the high deforestation that this activity is provoking in the surrounding areas. Deforestation also causes population and their homes to be more exposed to natural disasters. Cerro Niño is a community located in hill slopes so with out trees, landslides are more common. This is something that happened during Hurricane Carlota for example. People are left with out communication for weeks when this happens.
He is very excited on acquiring a solar home system to light up and to charge his cellphone for emergencies.

loans.use: Juan, Catalino and Alejandra to stop depending on ocote-pine for lighting and allows each of them to buy a reliable solar home system for quality lighting and cell-phone charging.

location.town: Cerro Niño, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Ester

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos residente no bairro 6 desde 2004.
É negociante de profissão e com o presente empréstimo pretende adquirir material de construção (chapas de zinco e barrotes) para cobrir sua residência.
No futuro espera terminar sua obra e estar devidamente apetrechada pelo todas as suas atenções estão viradas para o efeito, e para tal irá priorizar os reembolso .
O seu maior desafio é flexibilizar o reembolso do empréstimo de forma aceder aos outros subsequentes.
texts.en:
Married and the father of 5 children, he has lived in neighborhood 6 since 2004.

He is a trader by profession and with this loan he plans to buy construction material (sheets of zinc and beams) to create a roof for his house. In future, he hopes to finish the building work and fit out his home. All his energies are focused on this at the moment and to this end he will prioritize paying back this loan.

His greatest challenge to be flexible enough to pay back this loan in order to have access to subsequent loans.

loans.use: construction material (sheets of zinc and beams) to create a roof for his house

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina is 30 years old and lives in the remote village of Lessos. She has 2 children, whom she has raised by her own, like a strong and committed woman. Life hasn’t been easy for her, but she has found the way to come through, because she’s a fighter who loves her children. Edina wants to take the world by storm. She is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers throughout the food business. On her farm, she keeps cows and poultry and has a small cash crop garden and trees. To earn additional income, Edina arranges the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers and makes a commission on those sales. She has been doing this business for over a decade. She continually makes an effort to build strong relationships because reputation is everything in her line of work. Given that Edina can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to buy more produce from local farmers at fair prices and to use her good understanding of market conditions and prices to sell the produce at a profit. Your loan will help Edina’s clients to focus on production rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn a better income to uplift their livelihood. Edina dreams of leaving the business to her children, but before that, she wants to pay for their education so that they can be professional. You can get this mom closer to her dreams with just a loan. Support Edina’s dream by giving her a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals from farmers to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase onions to supply to hotels in Nairobi.

loans.name: Salu

texts.en: Salu was born 17th June 1975. She is married with two children, and lives in the village of Lalovaea. She runs a Flea market business, selling handicrafts  including kava bowls, samoan bags, elei printing and and a variety of other goods. Her current income provides groceries for the family and school fees for her children. She wishes to purchase fabric so she can create more items her customers want and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase 10 rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung is 41 years old and his wife 37 years old. They have two sons who are students at primary school. Hung sells pork at the local market. Their income is $10 per person/month. Hung hopes to get a loan of $75 so that he can stabilize his business of selling pork. He will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Selling pork

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
I have a small grocery business in my home, which I've had for a few months. it helps me to be able to pay for my children's studies. But now I need to buy more products to be able to provide better service to my customers, who are very good to me, since they come to buy from me an help me, since I have very little. Thank you if you can help me so my business can grow.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Yo tengo un pequeño negocio de una pulperia en mi casa, este negocio lo tengo hace unos meses, el cual me ayuda para poder pagar estudios a mis hijos. Pero ahora necesito comprar mas producto para poder dar un mejor servio a mis clientes los cuales son muy buenos conmigo ya que me vienen a comprar para ayudarme, ya que lo que tengo es muy poco. les agradesere si me puden ayudar para que mi negocio cresca.

loans.use: Purchase eggs, sodas, rice, sugaer, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina B. is 43 years old and lives in the Tajy Loma de Carapegua community. She is married to Mr. Calixto Rodriguez and they have two children that actually are attending college. She weaves artisan quilts and on the weekends she goes door to door selling them with the help of her husband.

Since young, she has dedicated herself to this activity which she learned from her mother. She comes from a humble family that due to their sacrifices was able to improve her quality of life. Due to low sales of crafts at one point, they had the opportunity to travel to Argentina to look for work. Over there Angelina worked as a domestic employee (maid) and her husband worked as a bricklayer.

After some time they were able to save a good capital and had the opportunity to go back to their country to dedicate themselves again to their commercial activity. The loan that they are applying for will be used to buy yarn for weaving.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Angelina B. tiene 43 años, vive en la compañía Tajy Loma de Carapeguá, está casada con el señor Calixto Rodríguez tienen dos hijos que actualmente están cursando sus estudios universitarios. Ella es tejedora de sobrecamas artesanales y los fines de semana junto con su marido realizan la venta ambulante (casa por casa). Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a esta actividad ya que lo ha aprendido de su madre. Proviene de una familia humilde que gracias a su sacrificio logró mejorar su calidad de vida. Debido a la poca venta de artesanía, en una oportunidad tuvieron que viajar a la Argentina en busca de trabajo, allí la señora trabajó como empleada doméstica y el señor como albañil, luego de un tiempo lograron reunir un buen capital y tuvieron la oportunidad de regresar al país para dedicarse nuevamente a su actividad comercial. El crédito que solicita lo utilizará para la compra de hilos.

loans.use: Buying weaving yarn.

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en: Mrs. Krishna Kumari M. is a 32 year old woman who lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district of Kathmandu valley. Thecho is one of the backward areas of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. M. lives in a single family with her husband, a son and a daughter. Her son is studying in grade 5 and her daughter is in primary school. Her husband's name is Ganu Ratna M.. He is a carpenter and opened his furniture shop a year ago. All the requirements of the family are fulfilled by the shop's income. Therefore Mrs. M. seeks a Rs25000 loan to buy timber to meet the demand for the furniture. Her husband makes different varities of furniture like beds, tables and chairs to sell.

loans.use: Krishna Kumari would like to buy timber for furniture work.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: I am the mother of two and live in the small town of Vehari in Pakistan. My family and I live in a small brick and mud house which we rent. My husband has been running a small juice and fizzy drinks stall in our town for the past couple of years. It gets really hot here in Vehari so sales are pretty good. We need a loan of $350 to purchase stock, including juice cartons and fizzy drinks. We get good rates if we buy in bulk. We took a loan last year and made a good profit on it.  I also chip in to generate some income for my family and sew women’s clothes when I am free from household chores.

loans.use: Purchase stock of juice cartons and fizzy drinks

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
This is 50 year-old Erica S. from Mbeya, Tanzania!. She is single with two children, aged 9 and 18, and has one other dependent, who is her nephew. In 2004 Erica established a farming business. Erica has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $550 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Comité Kyry Aty Group

texts.es:
The committee is comprised of 15 female employees of the Cabañas de Caacupé company. The majority of the members work cultivating and selling garden plants. They have been living in the neighborhood for a long time and help each other sell their products.

The group is currently in its 5th cycle of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Women Entrepreneurs) committee, in which each member receives an average loan of 920.00 Guaraní.

The committee started thanks to one of our representatives who campaigned in these women’s neighborhood. Beatriz, the group leader, says that the group of women has decided that this summer, they will display their products in the city of San Bernardino, which is the country’s top summer attraction.

They will invest this loan in the purchase of fertilizer, garden plants, and flowerpots. The women who own general stores will invest the loan in the purchase of sugar, meat, herbs, flour, milk, charcoal, and assorted beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Cabañas de Caacupé, la mayoría de las integrantes se dedican al cultivo y ventas de plantas para jardín, son personas antiguas del barrios y todas se ayudan para poder comercializar sus productos.

Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 5 ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendoras, y la misma están siendo beneficiada con un crédito promedio de gs. 920.000 cada integrantes.

El comité se inició gracias a la promoción que realizo uno de nuestros oficiales de crédito en el barrio de estas señoras. Beatriz, la titular del grupo, comenta que el grupo de mujeres en este verano, han decidido ir a exponer sus productos en la ciudad de San Bernardino, ya que esta ciudad es la atracción veraniega del país.

El crédito que solicitan lo invertirán en la compra de abono, plantas para jardín, macetas, y las señoras que poseen despensas lo invertirán en la compra de azúcar, carne, yerba, harina, leche, carbón, y bebidas de todo tipo.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, garden plants, flowerpots, sugar, meat, herbs, flour, milk, charcoal, and assorted beverages

loans.name: Thi Hang

texts.vi:
Mrs Hằng is 39 years old. She sells vegetables and also raises pigs to increase her income. She is married and has 2 children: one is in the work force and the other one still goes to school. Due to irreconcilable differences, she and her husband had divorced. She has become the sole bread winner in the house so she has to work hard to raise her 2 children. To help their mother, the older child has quit school and works to gain money. Despite her difficult living condition, she has never borrowed money. She has applied to SEDA for a loan of 2006000 VND to buy pigs for breeding.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hằng, 39 tuổi, buôn bán các lại rau củ quả, ngoài ra chị còn chăn nuôi lợn để tăng gia săn xuất. Chị đã kết hôn và có hai con, 1 đứa đã đi làm còn 1 thì đang đi học. Do không hoà hợp nhau, hai vợ chồng chị đã li hôn. Hiện nay, một mình chị phải vất vả làm ruộng, buôn bán để nuôi hai con. Để giúp đỡ mẹ, một đứa con chị đã nghỉ học để đi làm thợ. Tuy khó khăn vất vả nhưng chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Chị tham gia vay 2006000 đồng của chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc để mua lợn giống.

loans.use: buy pigs to for breeding

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 37 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 12, 9 and 7 years old. Helena is a timber seller, and she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

In the past, Helena has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more timber for her business.

loans.use: to buy more timber for her business.

loans.name: Margaritas De Xesampual Group

texts.es:
