When the Margaritas of Xesampual women entered the Agency of Solola I noted immediately the combination of young clients and adults inside the group. This usually forms an interesting combination, since the young women tend to listen to the oldest in "compromising" situations, such as when one asks a question in Spanish and the adult women tend to share their know-how with the younger women in moments during the training. Also, a combination of businesswomen and novices C. be found. This combination is something very valuable, since the experience and "tips" that C. be shared benefit the women without so much experience in business.

The great majority of associates inside this group work in the clothes business. They sell clothes, whether traditional clothes such as long skirts called cortes, typical embroidered blouses called huipiles, cinchos or straps, perrajes or scarves and blouses. Also some women resell western clothes inside their town. They buy these clothes buy in the capital or in the regional capitals in order then to sell them in their towns. In the group there is also one associate that has a shoe store.

One of the ladies that sell blouses said that she was going to invest all her loan to buy twenty dozen blouses at Q150 each dozen in order then to resell them for Q180. Another mentioned that with the Q3000 that she was going to receive, she was going to buy five dozen shoes to supply the inventory of her store. The initiatives and quantities vary depending on the businesswoman and the size of their business.

Something that does not vary a lot is the importance they put on covering the needs of their families and their children. Among the basic needs of each client are the expense of food, a college scholarship and gas or firewood. Nevertheless, the largest expense for all the clients is that of food. Feeding their extensive families is not an easy task.

Generating sufficient income in a small town to cover the expenses of an extensive family and also to have money to reinvest in the business is a difficult task. That is why support is important to these women; so that they C. continue doing well with their business and support their families.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Cuando las mujeres Margaritas de Xesampual entraron a la Agencia de Solola pude notar inmediatamente la combinación de clientes jóvenes y adultas dentro del grupo. Esto usualmente forma una combinación interesante ya que las mujeres jóvenes tienden a asistir a las más adultas en situación “comprometedoras” como cuando uno le hace una pregunta en español y las mujeres adultas tienden a compartir sus conocimientos con las más jovencitas en los momentos de las capacitación. También, se puede encontrar una combinación de empresarias consolidadas y principiantes. Esta combinación es algo muy valioso, ya que las experiencias y “tips” se pueden compartir beneficiando a las mujeres sin tanta experiencia en el negocio.

La gran mayoría de clientas dentro de este grupo trabaja en el negocio de la ropa. Ellas venden ropa, ya sea ropa tradicional como faldas largas llamadas cortes, blusas típicas llamadas huipiles, cinchos o correas, perrajes y blusas. También se encuentran las mujeres que revenden ropa occidental dentro de su pueblo. Aquella ropa la compran en la capital o en las cabeceras departamentales para luego venderlas en sus pueblos. En el grupo tenemos una clienta que tiene una zapatería.

Una de las señoras que venden blusas dijo que iba a invertir todo su préstamo comprar veinte docenas de blusas a Q150 cada docena para luego revenderla a Q180. Otra mencionó que con los Q3000 que iba a prestar iba a comprar cinco docenas de zapatos para surtir el inventario de su tienda. Las iniciativas y cantidades varían dependiendo de la empresaria y el tamaño de sus negocios.

Algo que no varia mucho es la importancia de cubrir las necesidades de sus familias y sus hijos. Entre las necesidades básicas de cada clienta están el gasto de la comida, la colegiatura y el gas o la leña. Sin embargo, el gasto más fuerte de todas las clientas es el de la comida. Alimentar a sus extensas familias no es una tarea fácil.

Generar la suficiente cantidad de ingresos en un pequeño para cubrir los gastos de una familia extensa y además tener dinero para reinvertirlo en el negocio es una difícil tarea. Es por eso que poyar a estas mujeres es importante para que así ellas puedan seguir saliendo adelante con sus negocios y apoyar a sus familias.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Bunnarith

texts.en: Mr. Bunnarith H., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Sokmoeun Soy, 31, who live about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1994 and have two sons, both in school. Sokmoeun has been a garment factory worker since 1993, and Bunnarith has been a motor remoque  (a motorbike with a trailer at the back) taxi driver for two years. He carries people and goods from his village to Ta Khmao market.  Unfortunately, his trailer is broken, so he is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase a new one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motor trailer..

loans.name: Sophois

texts.en:
Mr. Sophois M., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Sokhorn Sous, 26, live along national road number one about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Theywere married in 2000 and have three children: one son and two daughters. 

Mr. Sophois has been an electrician for three years. He does his job in the village and in Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Sokhorn sells Khmer noodles in the village. Sophois is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorcycle so he can to work more easily and spend less time in transit.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Neretse would like to increase his working capital for his small homegoods store.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann M., 49, is a cucumber farmer who lives with six children. Living in the Kampong Cham province, she is able to earn around $1 of profit per day and is aided by her children, who work as garment factory workers. 

Her husband is a rice farmer and the income he collects annually is just enough for the family. Mrs. Vann is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, of $300 to purchase a cow to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To purchase cow to plow the farmland.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde I. lives in Badagry in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 33 years old and married with two children. Kehinde sells building materials in her shop. She has been in this business for the past four years.

Kehinde is a LAPO client. She needs a loan for $850 to buy more building materials to sell. She thanks all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.fr: H. Frankline est née le 29/ 08/1979 à cotonou. Elle est mariée à ADOUKONOU Clément, chauffeur et elle est mère de 02 enfants: Horace, 08  ans est en classe de CE2 et Chancelle a 1an 5 mois.Très jeune elle a abandonné les cours en classe de CM2 et aidait sa mère à vendre dans l'un  des plus grands marchés de la ville de Cotonou, le marché Gbégamey.Voici 08 ans, elle s'est mise à son propre compte. Au départ, elle avait débuté avec la vente des fruits, ensuite les tubercules. Aujourd'hui elle ne vend que les céréales haricot, riz, maïs, farine de manioc séché et autres. C'est justement pour cette activité qu'elle sollicite ce second prêt en vue de réhausser son étalage et satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Frankline H. was born on August 29, 1979 in Cotonou. She is married to Clément ADOUKONOU, a chauffeur, and is the mother of two children: Horace, age 8 and in the 3rd grade; and Chancelle, age 1 year and 5 months. At a young age, she abandoned school in the 5th grade and helped her mother in commerce in one of the largest marketplaces in the city of Cotonou, the Gbégamey Market. For eight years now, she has been on her own. In the beginning, she sold fruit, and then tubers. Today, she only sells grain, beans, rice, corn, dried cassava flour, and so forth. It's only for this activity that she is requesting this second loan with the intent of enhancing her display of goods to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 sacks of rice and 1 sack of corn

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.en: "Las Vecinas" is a group of 15 people hoping to receive a loan.  For many members of this group it will be the first loan they are taking out.  Many don't have a form of income and are living in extreme poverty.  Martina E. is the representative of this group and is one of the members who has received a loan in the past.  She is the leader of the group because she has been very successful in her small business and someone the others can come to for advice.  Martina has two young children and is dedicated to send them to college.  She is on her 6th loan cycle and excited to keep on increasing the size of her business.  She has a business selling jewelry and specializes in wedding rings and other promise-type jewelry.  She finally feels able to proviD. for her two children, and for the first time in her life, feels like she can get out of her situation.  She dreams of traveling and owning her own thriving jewelry business.  Her main goal is preparing her children to get out of their poverty and giving them all the necessary education.  Everyone is the group is excited for this next step and ready to change his or her life!

loans.use: To buy products to create rings, bracelets, and other types of jewelry.

loans.name: 2000-8 Group

texts.es: En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado en el centro focal de Senkata a éste pertenece la asociación denominada “2000-8”, grupo formado por doce miembros que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad. La mayoría de ellas se dedica al comercio de una variedad de productos, que los comercializan en puestos fijos y tiendas de barrio, adquieren productos de mayoristas para luego venderlos por unidad. Ahora ellas necesitan mayor capital para comprar productos al por mayor de este modo sus ganancias serán también mayores y así poder generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The "2000-8" group, comprising 12 hard-working people, is based in the Senkata neighborhood of the city of El Alto.

Most of the members are in the retail business; they buy products wholesale and sell them retail via stalls and shops. Now they need more capital to buy products wholesale, which will give them a bigger margin and enable them increase their incomes for the benefit of their families.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Ato

texts.en:
Ato A. C. is married. His wife is sells chemicals. The highest level of education he has received is senior high.

Ato A. sells electrical gadgets and parts in Elmina, which he has done since 2004. He uses his income to pay rent, utility bills and other financial expenses for his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase more electrical items to meet the increased demand of his costumers. Ato A. plans to reinvest the profit back into his business.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio Pavón tiene 57 años, está casado, y tiene 3 hijos. La actividad económica de Don Antonio es la elaboración de canastas, por lo que el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de hace dieciocho años. En esta manera, sus propósitos para su negocio son de obtener los materiales a un precio más bajo para realizar la compra de materia prima, y producir los artículos equivalentes a la demanda. Más tarde con la ayuda de los préstamos de Kiva, Don Antonio solicita de nuevo financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos. El solicita C$ 9.000 córdobas a un plazo de 9 meses.
texts.en:
Antonio Pavón is 57 years old, married, and has three children. The economic activity of Antonio is that of making baskets, and he has had this business for eighteen years. His intentions for the business include obtaining materials at a lower price and producing his baskets based on demand. With help from Kiva’s loans, he requests additional financing to have working capital. This will allow him to buy the raw materials he needs to produce his goods. He is requesting 9,000 córdobas for a term of 9 months.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cristo Rey esta integrado por tres personas, todos ellos son vecinos y se conocen desde muy atras y se dedica a actividades diferentes.
La Sra. Gloria es la lider del grupo y tiene 68 años de edad, vive sola y tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos vive en la casa con su madre, el otro vive en Costa Rica, y cuando el puede le envia dinero para que pueda salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace 10 años.
La Sra. L. vive con sus dos hijos, ellos no estan estudiando en este momento le estan ayudando a su madre con su negocio que es venta de chicharras, ella tiene 55 años de edad, ella se quiere dedicar a la costura y venta de ropa para eso necesita el prestamo, su meta es poder darles estudios a sus dos hijos para que sean profesionales algun dia.
El Sr. Oscar tiene 29 años de edad vive con su madre y tiene dos hijos, la mama les ayuda economicamente. el se dedica  a la venta de lacteos y compra pescado en San Lorenzo para venderlo en diferentes comunidades. el necesita el prestamo  para comprar mas pescado ya que en estos dias la gente come mucho pescado por la epoca de semana santa, de las ganancias quiere comprar unas dos vacas para poder sacarles leche y asi producir lacteos.
texts.en:
The group “Cristo Rey” is made up of three people. All of them are neighbors and have known each other for a very long time. They pursue different activities. Mrs. Gloria is the leader of the group and is 68 years old. She lives by herself and has two children. One of them lives in the house with her mother, and the other lives in Costa Rica. When he can, he sends money so that they can go forward. She has sold cosmetics for 10 years. Mrs. L. lives with her two children. They are not in school at this time; they are helping their mother with her business, in which she sells cicadas. She is 55 years old. She wants to pursue sewing and selling clothes, for which she needs this loan. Her goal is to be able to provide her children with an education so that they can become professionals someday. Mr. Oscar is 29 years old. He lives with her mother and has two children. His mother helps them financially. He sells dairy products and buys fish in San Lorenzo to sell in different communities. He needs this loan to buy more fish since these days people eat a lot of fish for the holy week. From the earnings, he wants to buy two cows so that he can produce milk and, then, produce dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, dairy products, fish, and fabric and thread for sewing

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr:
Z. Léa est née vers 1966 à Agonlin, département de Mono. Z. Léa est mariée à AYIDONOUGBO Benjamin et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Z. Léa réside à fidjrossè en banlieue de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Z. Léa a pour activité la vente de poissons et de crustacés frits accompagnés de pâte de maïs. Z. Léa s’approvisionne en poisons et crustacés au marché international de Cotonou et aussi au bord de nos côtes lagunaires. Z. Léa vend également de charbon de bois. Grâce à ses activités Z. Léa arrive à aider son mari pour les charges courantes du foyer. Pour répondre au mieux à la demande de sa clientèle et faire croître ses activités Z. Léa sollicite actuellement un troisième prêt.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Lea Z. was born around 1966 in Agonlin, in the province of Mono. Lea Z. is married to Benjamin Ayidonougbo and is the mother of three children, all attending school. Léa Zanou resides in Fidjrossè outside the city of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. Léa Z. sells fried fish and seafood accompanied with corn dough. Lea Z. obtains her fish and seafood at the international market in Cotonou as well as along the coasts and its lagoons. Lea Z. also sells charcoal. Thanks to these activities, Lea Z. is able to help her husband with household expenses. She is asking for a third loan so that she can grow her business to meet her client's demand. In the local language, le Fon, Alidé means "There is always a way for the poorest". Bénin is a country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, with a GDP per capita of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans at 0% interest to those who are very vulnerable. It is also in a group who will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to those receiving micro-credit loans.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase charcoal, corn, fish and seafood for her business

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 54 year old woman who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Alia has owned a grocery store. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Alia has requested a loan. 
Alia is special in her work because she knows how to treat his clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. In the future, he plans on improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese M., 42, is married with four children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village community and general public, three days per week. She has had six previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 tala (~$110 US).  SPBD loans are Akenese’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for home improvements and school fees.

loans.use: To buy cement, iron roofing, electric chainsaw and pay school fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86600&_tpos=17&_tpg=2
María  es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas
María es casada tiene 65 años, tres hijos, todos mayores y casados.
María  trabaja con su hermano  en la confección de set para los baños, ella es socia minorista, ella distribuye a las tiendas la mercadería. 
María  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de materiales, como telas afelpadas.
Desde que María esta en Finca, ha sido de gran ayuda ha podido lograr muchas cosas materiales, como construir parte de su casa, aprendió a  desarrollarse en los negocios.  
El sueño María es tener un taller en su casa de confecciones de set de baños.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Las Orquídeas (The Orchids) Communal Bank. María is 65 years of age and married with three children, all of them adults and married. She works with her brother making bath sets. She is a retail partner and distributes her merchandise to the stores. María needs a loan of 1,000 Sols to buy materials such as plush fabric. Since she has been working with FINCA Peru, it has been a great help and she has been able to achieve material success, such as building a portion of her house and learning how to develop her business. Maria dreams of having a workshop in her house for making bath sets.

Click HERE to see her first loan

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric.

loans.name: Cándida

texts.en:
Mrs. Candida is a 48 year old business woman. She is married to Mr. Dionisio, who is 51 and works as a bricklayer. They have five children. José is 27 and works laying bricks with his father. Nancy is a 25 year old teacher. Juana is 24 and works in Spain. Enrique is 19 and Juan is 12 and attends sixth grade.

Mrs. Cándida began her activity in 2006, with much effort and help from her family, so that they could progress forward. Today she has a very well-supported small grocery store.

She applied for the loan to buy construction materials to make a new commercial space because her current one is too small. She hopes to finish her new space and increase her merchandise. Through this she hopes to increase her sales and income and the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make a new commercial space.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Villa Universitaria Group

texts.en:
All of the women of the committee Kuña Aty Villa Universitaria are neighbors of the same area, where they have their own small businesses. The women help each other as a consolidated group.

The participants are proud of the help they have gotten from the Fundación Paraguaya. They have been able to increase their sales and the quantity of production, and through this their daily sales. They thank the Fundación for the constant support and they promise to continue working to grow as a committee with responsibility and honesty.

1 Mirian B. - small grocery store 2 Cynthia M. - cosmetics sales 3 Digna A. - clothing sales 4 Gladys O. - milk and egg sales 5 Ana D. 6 Cristeta L. - small grocery store 7 Mirta M. 8 Maria J. - dressmaker 9 Ana M. - raising & selling chickens 10 Casilda M. - raising & selling chickens and pigs 11 Celsa L. - cook, food sales 12 Veneranda M. - plant sales 13 Zulma V. - charcoal sales 14 Juliana F. - chicken & pig sales 15 Carmen M. - convenience store 16 Petrona M. - dressmaker, general store 17 Elida M. - small grocery store 18 Gerarda M. - chipa (local bread) sales 19 Ana Maria M. - fruit and vegetable sales

loans.use: To purchase merchandise or raw materials for sale.

loans.name: Asharaf

texts.en: Asharaf is a young man working as an employee in the Palestinian National Authority. He is not married and lives with his father, mother, and two younger brothers. Asharf is the only source of income for the family, and he wants the loan to renovate the family house in order to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To expand his family's house and do some renovations

loans.name: Winfrida

texts.en:
Winfrida is a member of the Kihodombi borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is a 29-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 3 children. Her children are ages 11, 9, and 6. She also cares for 2 other dependents. 

 Winfrida started her own tailoring business 3 years ago. She works 10 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Winfrida’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to  buy more material. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Winfrida hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more  material

loans.name: Mighty Forth Group

texts.en:
Ernestina is 48 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children who are all still in school. She is a trader in vehicle upholstery materials. Ernestina is the leader of a trust bank group called Mighty Forth Ladies. She is seated first from right. The members of this group are mostly traders and food vendors.

They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from Kumasi and sometimes from nearby communities, and sell at the market square in their community. The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. It is in light of this that they are requesting for a loan to procure more goods to expand their business. The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. It is their desire to give their children good education.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Cristina Gregoria

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CRISTINA R. Q., ES UNA PERSONA DEDICADA AL NEGOCIO DE LA LIBRERÍA Y TIENDA DE ABARROTES, QUIEN CON SU SACRIFICIO Y ESFUERZO SUSTENTA A SU FAMILIA Y A SUS HIJOS QUIENES TAMBIEN LE AYUDAN A SOBRE SALIR EN SU EMPRENDIMIENTO. SU NEGOCIO ESTA UBICADO EN LA POPULOSA ZONA DE VILLA VICTORIA.

loans.use: Invertira en la compra de papeleria

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
Agueda es una alegre mujer de 49 años, vive con su hija, Mirtha de 12 años, en su casa propia. Desde muy joven fue independiente, siempre le gustó valerse por sí misma, es por ello que incursionó en diferentes oficios. Pero desde hace 15 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, siendo muy buena en ello. Hasta el momento le va muy bien y le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le permite movilizarse por la ciudad sin ningún inconveniente, aunque a veces el tráfico y el caos vehicular sean muy estresantes. Pero Agueda no sólo se dedica a su auto, ya que además en su casa realiza la costura de diversas prendas de vestir. Ella es muy feliz con su labor y en el futuro quiere tener una farmacia o librería, negocio que pueda instalar en su hogar.
Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP, ella es una cliente muy antigua de la institución, además de ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará una máquina de coser nueva para lograr mejores ingresos a su economía.
texts.en:
Agueda is a cheerful, 49-year-old woman who lives with her 12-year-old daughter, Mirtha, in her own house. From a very young age, Agueda has been very independent; she always wanted to be self-sufficient, and for this reason she has explored many different trades and occupations. For 15 years she has been in the taxi business, as she is very good at it. Business is going very well and Agueda likes her job, as it allows her to get around the city without any problems, but sometimes the traffic and the chaos in the streets can be very stressful. But Agueda is not only in the taxi business: she also sews various garments in her house. Agueda is very happy with her work and in the future would like to open a pharmacy or a book store, businesses that she could run from her home.

This is Agueda's tenth loan with MFP. She has worked with the institution for a long time and she has always been very punctual with her payments. With the money from this loan, she would buy a new sewing machine to earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de machine à coudre

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian A. makes a living selling grains in a local market, and has applied for this loan to buy more millet to sell to her customers. She is 30 years old, married to a soldier and the mother of five school-aged children. She hopes to build a shop with the extra income she earns from this loan. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more millet to sell

loans.name: Ifeanyi

texts.en:
Ifeanyi is 34 years old and married with one child. Her child is in school. Her husband is a government worker. 

Ifeanyi is a member of LAPO. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. Ifeanyi is very hardworking and she makes sure that she has food on the table for her family. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for a loan amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more groceries. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Fredelina

texts.en:
Fredelina B. is known as” Freding”. She is now 50 years old and has three children. She is married to Mr. Daniel B. and they live happily together in the village of Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. As parents, they are concerned with the future of their children so they are sending them to school. Two of their children already finished a vocational course and are presently working in a department Store. 

Her husband is a farmer and a caretaker in the Municipality of Quezon while Fredilina manages a sari-sari store in their village to earn additional income. She aims to improve her sari-sari store but she does not have enough money. She wants a loan of Php7,000 to increase her capital and improve her small business.

loans.use: addtional capital and the improvement of her sari-sari store

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia S. sells fresh vegetables in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. Fozia is 40 years old and married to a police officer. She has 6 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal for sell

loans.name: Laban Mburu

texts.en: Laban Mburu M. sells bananas with two employees out of a stall in the Mombasa market.  He has been in this business for the last six years, and manages the challenges of getting a good supply of bananas and strong competition from other grocery stores.  He would use a loan of KES80,000 to add to his stock of bananas.  Laban is married and has four children.  He describes himself as hardworking and dedicated to his work.  He dreams of educating his children and providing comfortably for his family.

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Davaasambuu

texts.en: Davaasambuu is 50 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs, one of western provinces of Mongolia. His oldest two daughters, aged 22 and 25, are employed, while the youngest two sons, aged 15 and 19, go to a local secondary school. He and his family live in a "ger", a traditional Mongolian tent. Davaasambuu operates a flour and noodle trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in his town. He started his business in 2000 and has built a stable business over the last nine years. Today he has much experience as a businessman and has a great reputation among his many customers and suppliers. His earnings have enabled him to improve his living situation and purchase a car for family use. Davaasambuu hopes to continue to expand his business in the future. He says, "My goal is to one day own the shop I'm working at now." Davaasambuu is requesting a 2,100,000 tugrug loan to purchase flour and noodles to sell.

loans.use: To purchase flour and noodles

loans.name: Chheoun

texts.en:
Chheoun C., 58, is married and lives with her one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. C. is in a business of weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of about $5 per day. She has been in this business since 2006. Her husband is a village chief, earning about $3 per day. 

C. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to deal with the necessary daily expenses. 

Therefore, C. is requesting a loan of $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw silk to produce Cambodian traditional silk for her new and existing customers. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: to buy raw silk

loans.name: Jovita Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Jovita Elena, tiene 36 años, vive  en el Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. La Socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo” .Es Casada madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando, presenta Estudios Superiores de Auxiliar en Docencia.

Motivada siempre por salir adelante, ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar , motivada siempre por su esposo , emprendieron su negocio de  venta de ladrillos llamado “Ladrillera Gasparin”, ya que cuentan con un terreno grande y con la materia prima como es la arcilla para la preparación de los ladrillos, iniciándose con un capital de 5,000.00 Nuevos Soles de las cuales poco a poco fue obteniendo muy buenos resultados y haciéndose muy conocida por vecinos , amigos y  transeúntes.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos, instituciones  y clientes fijos.

Con este crédito de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará  leña en tercios, latas, para hornear sus ladrillos, parte del dinero también lo invertirá en el pago mensual de su personal. 

Jovita Elena, se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así siempre.
texts.en:
Jovita Elena, 36, lives in Juanui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is a member of the "Honestidad y Trabajo" (Honesty & Work) communal bank. She is married and has two children, both of whom are students and still dependent on her. She studied to be a Teacher's Aide. Motivated to get ahead in life and facing the need to contribute to her family's economy, they started a brick selling business, called "Ladrillera Gasparin." They have a large plot of land that is rich in clay for brick making. They began with a 5000 new sol investment and gradually got good results becoming well-known by their neighbors, friends and passers-by. Currently, she continues with the same business, which is located in her own home; her main customers are her neighbors, institutions, and regular customers. She will use this new, 3000 new sol, loan to buy firewood and cans to fire her bricks; part of the money will also be used to pay her personnel's monthly salary. Jovita Elena is happy for the work and service she provides and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping people like her who want to work and succeed; she hopes they will always continue that way.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and cans.

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Chhem T., age 48, is a widow and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has young child. She is engaged in a business of selling fruits and vegetables in her province, earning an approximate income of US$ 5 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially on the children’s education. She has been with this business since 1999. The family’s standard of living has been improved since T. has been with this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale to make more profit. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Jorlyn

texts.en:
Jorlyn is a married woman with three children. She lives in a town in South Cotabato with her family. She is involved in rice farming and currently owns a hectare of rice field. She said that her harvest last time was good and she hopes to double it the next time. She said that all this hard work she does is for her family, especially for her children’s education.

Jorlyn is applying for a loan 6,000 Philippine pesos. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: Seed, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Emely's Group

texts.en:
Emely T. is from the village of Caliguian. She is fifty-five years old. Emely is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Emely T.'s Group.

Emely is married and has six grown children. To make a living, Emely owns and operates a general store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emely has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand product her offering. This will be Emely's third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación tiene 36 años. Doña Ana tiene 2 hijos y ella se encarga de proporcionarles lo necesario. La actividad económica de Ana es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio vendiendo pocos productos y con los financiamientos fue mejorando su inventario para ofrecerles a sus clientes lo que ellos solicitaban. Es por eso que solicita un financiamiento con el motivo de mejorar su inventario y comprar productos como granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, refrescos naturales  y otros. Siempre desea poder proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Maria has been working with Fundación for a long time. She is 36, has 2 children and she is the one who supplies what they need. Ana’s business is a general store and she has worked in it for more than 8 years. She began selling few products, and with loans she was able to widen her inventory to have the things that her customers requested. That is why she is asking for a loan-to expand her inventory and to buy more items such as: basic grains, soft drinks, juices natural drink, etc. She always wants to be able to arrange for improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem N., 50, is married and lives with three of her children in Siem Reap province. Working a farm together with her husband, Chem N. typically makes US$ 3.50 each day. Chem N. also sews palm roof panels to sell at the local market. Her family is also supported by two of the children who work as waitresses. Weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Chem N. included. In light of this economic difficulty, she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase fertilizer for their farm and allow her to sew more palm roof panels, which she believes can bring an increase in her daily income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and palm leaves

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en: This group loan is being requested by four people from Tramung Chrum village in Takeo province. Mrs. Pech M. is the group leader, selected by all the members who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She is a tailor in local village. She is also a farmer who owns one hectare of land, where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her rice field is not on time to plow. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Pech M. is seeking for a loan to buy a plow to use on her rice field. She is widow with four children, three of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, while the other is a plumber.

loans.use: To buy a plow to use on the rice field

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George N. is from the village of Linao East, Tuguegarao City. He is 33 years old. George is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, George ownsand& operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport  to local community members. George has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7200 PHP a month for these activities.

George joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. George has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. George is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by George from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Savoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mr. SavoeU. E. is the village bank president selected by the 22 members located in An L. Barang village in Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion to support their own purpose.

Mr. SavoeU. E., 55 years old, and his wife, Mrs. SU. C., are farmers who own 2.50 hectares where they grow crops and earn a small income to support their family. To support his farm Mr. SavoeU. E. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for a farm laborer.

The couple has three children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory and the third stays home and helps his parents with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay a farm laborer.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Juana es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde hace años logro tener su propio negocio alquiler de sillas y mesas, tiene la edad de 52 años, junto a su esposo siguen apoyando a sus hijos.
Las mejoras a su casa la ha ido mejorando  poco a poco, con el crédito anterior logro hacer la cocina, y divisiones   a su  casa lo que esta contenta. Con este préstamo quiere comprar las puertas de su cuarto, para poder dormir en mejores condiciones ya que por falta de dinero no lo ha hecho. 
Sus planes a futuro es captar más clientes en su negocio, para lograr mejores condiciones de vivienda, como la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is a hard-working woman, who established her own shop – chairs and tables rental – many years ago. She is 52 years old and she and her husband keep on providing for their children. Little by little she has succeeded in improving her house more and more. With her previous loan she was able to build the kitchen and partition walls, and she is happy about it. This current loan will be used to buy doors for her bedroom because she wants to sleep in safer conditions, and she lacks the required amount to buy them. For the future she plans to attract even more customers for her shop, in order to reach better living conditions and to provide for the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wooder doors for her room and improve her safety conditions.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng K., 34, is married and resides with her five children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment industry. She sells fish, vegetables, and food for an income of USD 10 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day.

 K. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more fish and vegetables to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more fish and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
P., aged 48, was married but divorced her husband years ago. She has seven children, four of whom are married and live separately, while the other three are single. 


P. is a rice cultivator who has been working in this sector for many years. The heavy rainfall season is good for planting; P. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mujeres Bienaventuradas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO MUJERES BIENAVENTURDAS ESTAN CONFORMADA POR PERSONAS MUY TALENTOSAS Y LUCHADORAS, UNA DE ELLAS QUIEN ES LA ENCARGADA DEL GRUPO ES DOÑA VILMA G., QUIEN  TIENE UN PEQUEÑA TORTILLERIA  EN SU CASA.  TIENE DOS TRABAJADORAS LA CUAL LE AYUDAN A QUE EL NEGOCIO CREZCA, CUENTA CON LA AYUDA TAMBIEN DE SU ESPOSO.  NO TIENEN HIJOS PEQUEÑOS TODOS SON MAYORES DE EDAD Y SIGUEN ESFORZANDOSE PARA PODER CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS Y METAS.  DOÑA EVA KELITA TIENE UNA TIENDA  TIENE 4 HIJOS, Y CUENTA TAMBIEN CON EL APOYO DE SU ESPOSO PARA PODER INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO, SU META ES SEGUIR CRECIENDO Y AGRANDAR LA TIENDA PARA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO Y SACAR ADELANTE A SU FAMILIA.  LA SEÑORA AURELIA R. SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE WAIPE Y DECEA AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO A SACAR ADELANTE A SU HIJO YA QUE ESTA EN EL ESTUDIO DE SU CARRERA.  SUS SUEÑOS SON QUE SUS HIJOS SEAN UNOS PROFESIONALES Y CON LA AYUDA DE DIOS DECEA SEGUIR VENDIENDO Y POR SUPUESTO NECESITA MAS CAPITAL PARA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA Y AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Bienaventuras” (Good Luck Women) Communal Bank is comprised of very talented and tenacious people. One of them, the person is charge of the group, is Vilma G.. She has a small tortilla shop in her house. She has two workers who help her so that her business grows. Her husband also helps her. They do not have young children. All of their children are adults who continue putting forth effort to be able to make their dreams and goals come true. Eva Kelita has a store and four children. Her husband also helps her to be able to invest in her business. Her goal is to continue growing and to make the store bigger. She wants to do this to help her husband and to get the family ahead. Aurelia R. sells fabric scraps, which are used mainly as rags. She wants to help her husband get her son ahead. Her son is studying for his career. Her dream is for her children to become professionals. With God’s help she wants to keep selling. Of course, she needs more capital to buy more merchandise and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a middle-aged woman whose husband appears on the photograph here. S. has spent almost all of her life cultivating crops. Growing potatoes is an activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant this crop twice a year and start growing in the rainy season. Her life partner is Samet, 30, a doctor working at the commune hospital. S. is a determined mother with a young child who depends on her income. S. will be using the loan she requested to buy fertilizer, insecticide, a pump, and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, a pump, and seeds.

loans.name: Yoram

texts.en:
Hard-working K. Yoram has been operating an agro-produce sales business from Kataruka village, Rukungiri, for a period of more than 20 years. With nostalgia, this happily married father of five children recalls how his business basked in high profit returns at its onset. Times have changed, however, as the business now is in diminishing returns earning him 200,000 Ugandan shillings, in sharp contrast to the previous earnings due to season changes.

Yoram is no exceptional herein in terms of doing business. What he is looking forward to now is the prospect of enhancing his business by buying fertilizer and improving production of bananas and coffee, which he grows most. With the auspices of this loan, he will improve on business expansion and production through mulching the plantations. He hopes to improve his revenue and also make himself more able to meet his daily life family necessities.

loans.use: For the purchase of agriculture inputs like mulches and fertilizer

loans.name: Peter Were

texts.en:
Peter Were E. is 31 years old and married to Mildred Atieno. Together they have one child who is two years old. He operates a barber shop as his primary business and a salon as a secondary. His business is situated in Huruma, near Redeemed Gospel Church, and most of his clients are youths and young boys. He gets an income of 7,000 KES per month and has been in this business for two years.

He came to learn about KADET LTD through an existing customer of KADET, and he does not have any history with any other MFI. Peter is applying for his first loan of 10,000 KES, with which he intends to purchase more blow-dryers and a chair. He plans to plough back the income he gets with an aim to grow the business.

In the future, he plans to own a beauty and fashion school so that he can nurture the talents of youths who are jobless in the community. He believes that this step will improve his business and provide a stable flow of income.

loans.use: To purchase more blow-dryers and a chair.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive S., age 34, has a mini-restaurant business. She serves a variety of different meals, such as chicken and pork adobo, afritada, and fried fish. Olive has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. She has four school-aged children and lives in the village of Poblacion, Iligan City. 

Earlier this year, Olive joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Olive is requesting her first loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and utilized as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and obtain working capital

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Marianette

texts.en:
Marianette A. owns and operates a business buying & selling fish and a fishing business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a week. In 2007, she joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in entrepreneurial business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI. 

Marianette is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fifth from ASHI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Having this loan will provide her with a chance to achieve her dreams in life: to have a growing business, a good life, and a financial means of supporting her family and funding the education of her two daughters until they complete college in order to get better employment in the future. Her inspiration to offer a good life to her children fuels her to continue to dream, believe, and survive.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her fishing business

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem R. is 43 years old and raises pigs in a village in Takeo province. She has been raising pigs since 2002 and is able to make about 2 USD of profit every day. Her husband, pictured here, works in construction. On average, he makes 3 USD of profit a day as well. Sem R. is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor S. is 44 years old and single mother to five children, all five of whom are single and four of them are working in different occupations. In the beginning of 2008, Sor S. built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells a few snack products to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. Most of the income in her family comes from her children. One of her sons is a blacksmith and he shares responsibilities of supporting the family with her. Currently, her son wants to expand his business by purchasing a machine. She hopes to encourage her son, but she has no cash to make that possible. So, Sor S. is requesting a loan to purchase a machine for cutting steel. With the remaining funds, she will buy a machine for grinding sugar cane and start a new business for herself.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for cutting steel and a machine for grinding sugar cane to start her new business.

loans.name: Mónica Marbella

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén.
 
La señora Mónica tiene 47 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 27, 21 y 20 años, todos aun viven con ella y  dos de ellos estudia en la Universidad. Su marido es comerciante. Está en el Banco Comunal  hace cuatro años y le agrada por las facilidades de pago y porque le brindan un buen servicio.

Se dedica al comercio, vede  ropa de todo tipo y bisutería. Tiene un pequeño local en su casa, allí llegan muchos de sus clientes que le realizan  sus pedidos y también sus compras. Ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente lo cual es una ventaja ya que a la vez que realiza sus cobros también utiliza este momento para realizar nuevas ventas. Compra sus productos en Portoviejo  y Guayaquil, trabaja sola todos los días y realiza los cobros los días sábados.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa como: pantalones, blusas, camisas, ropa de niños, etc. Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
Mónica, 47, is a member of the Nueva Jerusalén (The New Jerusalem) communal bank which meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s Nueva California neighborhood.  Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Mónica is married and has three children who are 27, 21 and 20 years old.  All of them still live with her; two are university students.  Her husband is a merchant.  She’s been in the communal bank for four years and she is pleased with the easy payment plans and because it provides a good service.

She is a merchant; she sells all kind of clothes and costume jewelry.  She has a small store in her house where lots of customers come by to place orders and make their purchases.  She sells her items on credit and collects weekly which is an advantage because she uses her collection visits to secure new sales.  She buys her products in Portoviejo and Guayaquil.  She works every day and collects on Saturdays.

She will use this loan to buy clothes like: pants, blouses, shirts, children’s clothes, etc.  Her dream is to have a commercial locale.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alavard N. is from the village of Gharibjanyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.   She is married with three children.  Alavard’s three sons are twenty, twenty three and twenty four years old.  She has a high school education and has been working as a farmer, growing vegetables and raising cattle for the past twenty two years.  

She dreams of saving enough money to help her sons build their own homes.  She currently supports her son, who is serving in the army, and provides agricultural produce to relatives living in the city.  She is looking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and feed.  With this investment she is expecting the family income to increase by twenty percent.  She likes the convenience of microfinance loans and is pleased with the services.  By growing her business she can continue living in Gharibjanyan, the place of her birth.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and feed.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 33-year-old father of one daughter and one son.  He previously sold fish from a small stall, but has now moved to a small store that belongs to his partner. Haytham requests a loan from Kiva partner FATEN to purchase a fish display refrigerator. 

Haytham has a permit to access the land on the other side of the wall, so he can transport fish from the fishermen every morning.  This allows him to sell fresh fish to his customers, which has in turn increased the number of his customers.

Haytham is pictured while at work.

loans.use: To purchase a large fish display refrigerator

loans.name: Sol De Los Andes Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento Sol D. los andes esta conformado por 8 integrantes todas mujeres, La señora Cristina es la presidenta del banco anteriormente participo en otra banca  la cual tuvo algunos problemas internos,  y esta señora fue una excelente cliente, en relación a su puntualidad y solidaridad,  la invitamos a formar un grupo nuevo y el resultado fue la banca sol D. los andes en la cual  ella fue elegida presidenta, es D. carácter muy jovial, entusiasta y perseverante, la señora cristina tiene el negocio D. venta D. saldos D. camas, ella compra D. las fabrica D. polar los saldos y deshechos D. camas a los que les pone borD. con su maquina D. coser y posteriormente los venD. en la feria D. la zona 16 D. julio. La Sra. Cristina con el dinero del credito comprara tela por cantidad, su familia consta D.  cinco miembros  tres hijos y su esposo, quien es D. actividad múltiple, es albañil, músico y arbitro, apoya a su esposa en el sueño D. hacer construir su casita que aún están pagando.
texts.en: The Banco D. Emprendimiento Sol D. los Andes (Sun of the Andes Communal Bank) is composed of 8 female members, and Cristina is the president of the bank. She previously formed part of another bank that encountered internal problems, but since her reliability and solidarity maD. of this lady an excellent customer, she was invited to create a new group, that is the Sol D. los Andes bank, of which she was elected president. A very cheerful, enthusiastic and tenacious woman, she engages in selling bedding overstock. She buys bedding overstock and remnants from the polar fleece factory, she embroiders them with her sewing machine and then she sells them in the traD. fair located in the 16 D. Julio area. With the loan she has requested Cristina will buy stocks of fabric. Her family is composed of 5 members, herself, three children and her husband who engages in different activities: he is a mason, a musician and a referee, and he helps his wife achieving their dream of finishing building the house they are currently paying for.

loans.use: To buy stocks of fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in Internet café business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Doña Ana, es una señora dedicada al cultivo agrícola y una tienda, tiene 61 años de edad, vive con un hijo de 38 años de edad, residen en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel. Doña Ana en temporada de cultivo siembra maíz y la tienda existe desde hace 5 años,  estas son sus ocupaciones diarias.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería y  abastecer su inventario, pues se ve en la necesidad de invertir ya que muchas veces se le agotan los productos, lo que le puede ocasionar molestia en los clientes, su iniciativa de inversión es buena ya que le permitirá está al pendiente de los gustos y necesidades de los clientes.
Su principal propósito en mantener el negocio competente, bien surtido para mejorar la atención y desde luego obtener mejores ganancias las cuales servirán para cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is a woman who is devoted to farming and managing a store. She is 61 years old and lives with her 38 year old son in San Rafael Oriente in the Department of San Miguel. Doña Ana is currently planting corn and her store has been in existence for five years. She manages both businesses every day.

Doña Ana is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to restock her inventory. She feels the need to invest frequently because she runs out of products, which creates an inconvenience for her customers. Her drive to invest allows her to cater to the tastes and needs of her customers.

Doña Ana’s main goals are to manage a competent business, remain well-stocked, and improve her service. Later on, she hopes to improve her revenues so that she can cover the family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Paulina Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Paulina;  La socia tiene 41 años de edad; La socia es soltera;  La socia  es enfermera de profesión, la socia trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud MINSA; La socia alterna sus trabajo con la compra y venta de ropas, ella tiene de forma independiente su pequeño negocio, la socia desea ahora invertir el crédito en la compra de mercadería, ella desea viajar y traer ropa para la venta, la socia trae todo tipo de ropas en especial para mujeres, sus principales cliente suelen ser sus compañeras de trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería (ropa).

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank “Choquequirao” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 41 years old and single. Paulina is a nurse by profession and works for the Ministry of Health (MINSA). She also works part-time buying and selling clothes and independently manages her small business. Paulina wants to invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise. She plans to travel and bring back all types of clothing to sell, especially women’s garments. Her main customers are her co-workers. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise.

Paulina is happy with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina L. is from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Cristina is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, detergents, shampoo, soap and candies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Cristina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, detergents and instant noodles. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, detergents and instant noodles

loans.name: Julio Herasmo

texts.es: El señor Julio tiene 55 años es casado, su esposa trabaja en el campo de manera independiente,tienen 2 hijos de 22 y 15 años ambos están en edad escolar, es maestro constructor, inicio esta actividad de la mano de su padre quien le enseño desde que el era muy joven, luego se independizo y empezó a realizar sus trabajos solo haciéndose conocido por la zona, tiene mas de 20 años trabajando y genera unos ingresos de s/500 semanales los desafíos que enfrenta es el no disponer de tiempo suficiente  para estar con sus hijos y poder cuidarlos, atenderlos y no poder apoyarlos en sus estudios superiores, su sueño en el futuro es poder comprar una unidad de transporte(camioneta) para el traslado de sus implementos de trabajo y poder ahorrar en el pago de transporte, el dinero lo invertirá en comprar  maderas que necesita para mejorar la calidad de su trabajo para brindar un mejor servicios a sus clientes y así ahorrar en alquileres de estas maderas, parte del dinero lo invertirá en algunas mejoras en su vivienda .
texts.en:
Julio, 55, is married;  his wife works as an independent field laborer.  They have two children who are 22 and 15; both are still school age.   He is a Master Builder.  He started this occupation hand in hand with his father who taught him when he was still very young.  Later he became independent and started doing his jobs by himself becoming well known in the area.  He’s been working for over 20 years and he earns about 500 soles per week.  

The challenges he faces are not having enough time to spend with his children, to care for and watch over them, and not being able to support their higher education.  His dream for the future is to buy a pick-up truck to transport his work tools and save transportation costs.  He will use the money to buy lumber he needs to improve the quality of his work and provide better customer service thus saving on rental costs of the wood.  Part of the money will be used to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy lumber and other tools.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. has four children. Her husband is a prison officer. Ekua uses her income to see to the well-being of her home.
Ekua sells smoked and fried fish at Abbina near Elmina in Cape Coast. She will use her loan to purchase more fresh fish to increase her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to invest in the sale of foodstuffs.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish.

loans.name: Corina Del Carmen

texts.es: Corina del Carmen  D. cincuenta y nueve años D. edad, vive con su compañero D. vida. Ella tiene una venta D. ropa D. todos estilos para damas y caballeros; Corina es una mujer emprendedora y sueña con sacar adelante a su familia, últimamente ha tenido más clientela y eso la llena D. satisfacción pues los clientes la prefieren porque les ofrece el mejor servicio, con ropa novedosa a buenos precios; ella quiere que crezca su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más ropa como faldas, pantalones, vestidos, camisas, blusas entre otros y D. esta forma satisfacer la necesidad D. los clientes y al mismo tiempo lograr llevar una seguridad económica a su hogar para darle una vida plena a su familia.
texts.en:
Corina del Carmen is 59 years old and lives with her life partner.  She has a business selling ladies' and men's clothes.  Corina is an entrepreneurial woman who dreams of getting her family ahead in life.  Lately, she has had more customers and this makes her feel very satisfied.  Her customers prefer to buy from her because she offers them good customer service and the latest clothes at good prices.

Corina would like to grow her business and so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy more clothes such as skirts, pants, dresses, shirts, blouses, etc.  This will enable her to meet her customers' needs and bring financial security to her household so that she can proviD. her family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, dresses, shirts and blouses

loans.name: Josselito Miguel

texts.es:
Josselito Miguel tiene 21 años, es soltero vive  con los padres en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar, no tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de maíz, papas y trigo.

Josselito se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y trigo, los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener sus propìas tierras para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta trabajar, hacer depoerte estar con su familia por son muy alegres.
texts.en:
Josselito Miguel is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar. He has no children.

The members of the V.R.C. cooperative Patrón San Miguel can be found in the Pailaloma precinct, 60 minutes from the Chillanes canton office. This communal bank has 13 members who work in agriculture, cultivating corn, potatoes, and wheat.

Josselito works in agriculture. He plants corn and wheat. He buys products in Chillanes and in San Pablo at the end of every month and sells them at the Sunday fair in Chillanes.

He is applying for the loan to purchase items needed for his crops, in addition to fertilizer and compost. The loan will help him economically to supply his needs and to increase production. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases and the variation in the climate. His dream is to have his own lands to continue planting.

He likes to work, do sports, and be with his family, because they are very happy.

loans.use: to buy items needed for his crops, in addition to fertilizer and compost

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel Avalo vive en la cuidad de Managua capital ce Nicaragua. 
El señor es padre de familia responsable con muchos deseo de superación tanto para el como para su familia 
El señor visito nuestras oficina para solicitar un crédito  ya que quiere hacer mejoras en su  vivienda
El señor con el préstamo va a compra materiales de cómo cemento , bosque, arena, y pagar mano de obra 
El señor va hacer aplicación en un cuarto de habitación
texts.en:
Miguel Avalo lives in the city of Managua, capital of Nicaragua.
He is a responsible father with a strong desire to overcome, both for himself and his family.
He visited our office to request a loan, since he wants to improve his home.
With the loan, he is going to buy materials such as cement, wood and sand, and hire labour.
He is going to apply this cement coating to finish off the walls of a bedroom.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Mr. Chann is a 33-year-old married father living in the province of Siem Reap. He owns a medium sized shop next to his house in the village where he provides boat repair services to the villagers. He started his business in early 2008, and the daily income he earns mainly serves to meet his family’s expenses. Mr. Chann is also a fisherman. His wife manages the household work and plants a few vegetables to generate some income. Mr. Chann has recently been catching fewer fish than before because his equipment often breaks down. Therefore, he would like a loan to buy additional fishing tools for his fishing business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Vicenta De Los Santos

texts.es: Vicenta De Los Santos tiene 40 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que inicio con este negocio en donde aprendió a tratar a sus clientes y además a proporcionarles lo que ellos le solicitaban. La ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado en donde ciertos clientes la conocen ya que además el carisma que la caracteriza es lo que le ha brindado la popularidad necesaria. El financiamiento es para la compra de cosméticos, calzado, tratamientos, sabanas y ropa general.
texts.en:
Vicenta De Los Santos, age 40, sells general merchandise.  She started this business over five years ago.  This business is where she learned how to treat her customers.  She also learned how to provide them with the requests they make.  

Her business is in the market where certain customers know her.  She is characterized by her charisma, which has brought her the needed demand in her business.

The loan is to buy cosmetics, footwear, treatments, sheets, and general clothing.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, footwear, treatments, sheets, and general clothing.

loans.name: Phearun

texts.en:
Phearun is 36 years old and his wife, Chanleap, is 32 years old. They have been married since 1998 and have two daughters. One is in school and the other one is still young. 

The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Phearun is a motor remoque taxi driver. (This is a motorbike pulling a trailer.) His wife is a garment worker.
  
Phearun is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase his neighboring land to expand his property.

loans.use: To purchase his neighboring land to expand his property.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-production business in the Philippines.

Josephine has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy supplies for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for two years.

In the future, she would like to repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Amistad Y Lucha Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. MARITZA ANGELICA, ES SOCIA DEL GRUPO "AMISTAD Y LUCHA", ES SOLTERA Y SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA EN UN PÚESTO QUE ALQUILA EN UN MERCADO UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE BELAUNDE EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
ELLA INCIÓ SU NEGOCIO CON POCA MERCACDERIA QUE OFRECIA A SUS AMISTADES, LUEGO SE LE PRESENTÓ LA OPORTUNIDAD DE ALQUILAR UN LOCAL EN UN MERCADO MUY CONCURRIDO, FUÉ AHI QUE OBTENIENDO UN PRESTAMO DE EDAPROSPO PUDO INVERTIR EN SU PEQUEÑO PUESTO Y POCO A POCO IR CRECIENDO. HOY EN DÍA CUENTA CON UN PUESTO MUY SURTIDO, CON VARIEDAD DE ROPA PARA DAMAS, CABALLEROS Y NIÑOS.
UNA DE SUS METAS ES PODER ADMINISTRAR SU PROPIA BOUTIQUE.
texts.en:
Sra. Maritza Angelica is a member of the group “Amistad y Lucha” (Friendship and Struggle). She is single and earns her living by selling clothes from a rented stall at a market in the Belaunde area of the District of Comas.

She started her business with little merchandise. Maritza began selling to friends and was later presented with the opportunity to rent a stall at a very busy market. At that point, she obtained a loan from EDAPROSPO to invest in her small business and has gradually grown over time. Today she has a well-stocked business and offers a variety of clothes for women, men, and children.

One of her goals is to manage her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothing so that she can increase her inventory.

loans.name: Able

texts.en:
Able is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 
Able has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy stock for his shop.
Able has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Able hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Bunthy

texts.en:
Bunthy is a "Tuk Tuk" taxi driver. His wife stays at home and does housework. They have three daughters. One is in school and other two are still young. The family is living about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City 

Bunthy is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy new "Tuk Tuk" to replace the old one. 

Photo: Bunthy is standing in front of the "Tuk Tuk" which he wanted to buy. He bought it, but he did not give any money yet. So, he is asking for the loan to pay for purchasing it.

loans.use: To buy a new "Tuk Tuk" (vehicle with sidecar) to replace the old one.

loans.name: El Puente De La Amistad Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama El Puente de la Amistad, está conformado por la señora Isabel va a comprar con su préstamo refrescos por caja, verduras, carnes, crema, queso y un bote de pintura, las señoras Ana María y Juana van a comprar maíz por bulto.
