La señora Isabel tiene 58 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er. año de primaria, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad ya trabajan, ellos viven en un pueblito muy bonito con muchos cerros llegan muchos turista a visitarlos venden artesanías de barro, ella vende comida y antojitos mexicanos, ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años aprendió en su trabajo de cocina económica, ella fue comprando poco a poco los utensilio de la cocina las salseras, sillas, ollas, cazuelas, cacerolas con lo que ganaba en su trabajo, su negocio esta a bordo de carretera, se hace de su casa 5 minutos caminando, ella ofrece a sus cliente que son los turistas dobladitas, picaditas, cecina, tlacoyos y guisados, a ella le gusta atender bien a los clientes darles un buen servicio y consentirlos darles lo que le pidan, su negocio es importante porque de ahí va sacando para lo comida y algunos gastos de la casa, ella se siente orgullosa de su negocio de ahí pudo darles estudios a sus hijos hasta la preparatoria, ella está muy contenta con este préstamo que va  recibir va a pintar su local para darle mejor presentación y los insumos para prepara la comida y seguir en su negocio con mejores guisados, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para volver a invertir. Sus sueños y esperanzas son comprar un terreno y vivir bien con la familia. las integrantes del grupos estan muy agradecidas con Kiva y Fundacion Realidad por su ayuda, con estos prestamos mejoramos y crecemos nuestros negocios para vivir mejor con nuestras familias.
texts.en:
Isabel, who is going to use her loan to buy cartons of soft drinks, vegetables, meat, cream, cheese and a can of paint, formed the solidarity group called El Puente de la Amistad. Members Ana Maria and Juana are going to buy a bundle of corn.

Isabel is 58 years old, she studied until the third grade, and lives with her husband and they have 4 older children already working. They live in a very pretty little village with many hills. Many tourists visit in order to buy pottery.

She sells food and Mexican antojitos (street snacks). She began her business 10 years ago learning through work how to run an economical kitchen. She bought kitchen utensils little by little, such as saucers, chairs, pots, and dishes to make casseroles, and sauce pans with which to do her work with the income she was taking in. Her business is on a highway, 5 minutes walking distance from her home.

She offers her clients who are tourists dobladitas (quick bread, rolled into circles and folded into layers), picaditas (tortilla boats with various fillings) beef jerky, tlacoyas (oval shaped fried cakes made from masa), and beef stew.

She likes to give good customer service to her clients, giving them what they ask for. Her business is important because from her profits she pays some of the household expenses. She is also proud of her business because her work allows her to pay for her children’s schooling, right through high school.

She is very happy because with this loan she is going to paint the premises in order to make a better appearance and she will buy supplies in order to prepare the food and will continue in her business with the best beef stew, and she will keep on investing the income into the business. Her dreams and her hopes are to buy some land and to live well with her family. 

All the members of this group are grateful to Kiva and the Fundacion Realidad for their help. “These loans allow us to improve and grow our businesses in order to improve the quality of life for our families.”

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, vegetables, meat, cream, cheese and a can of paint

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Lourdes has a retail shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stock from Avon and Natasha for resale.
Lourdes has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from Avon and Natasha for resale.

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Nao, pictured with her son at her home, is 46 years old. She and her husband Tol, age 42, have been married since 1984 and have one son and two daughters. One is a garment worker and other two are in school. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Nao and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, during the farming off-season, her husband does construction wO.. 

Nao is asking for her first loan of $300 in order to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is married to Jane and together they have two children, who are both attending school. He runs a food kiosk and has been in the business for the past five years. He gets a monthly income of KES 80,000 from the business.

This is Nelson's first loan term with KADET. He will use the loan amount to add stock like sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, and meat, as well as renovate the kiosk.

With the anticipated profits, he will expand the premises of his kiosk to expand the business. His dream is to be able to cater for his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase stock of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, and meat and to renovate the business premises

loans.name: Emilio Alejandro

texts.es:
Emilio de 22 años, con la ayuda de Dios y de su familia Pudo comprar una tricimoto para de esa forma poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Trabaja todos los días de la semana de 6 am hasta las 8 pm. Su único problema es la delincuencia del sector en el que vive. Está casado  su esposo se encarga de los quehaceres domésticos y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar una tricimoto para tener mejores ingresos. Su meta a alcanzar es poder terminar de construir su casa para poder vivir mejor y ayudarle a su esposa a establecer un negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Emilio is 22 years old. "With God's help" and that of his family, he was able to buy a three-wheeled motorcycle, which he has used to help his family get ahead. 

He works every day of the week, from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. His only problem is the level of crime in the area where he lives. He is married, and his wife takes care of the management of the household. He has a 3-year-old son. 

With the loan, he wants to buy another three-wheeled motorcycle so he can increase his income. The goal he is working toward is finishing the construction of his house, so that they can live better, and also helping his wife establish a clothing sales business.

loans.use: to buy a three-wheeled motorcycle.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
La señora Rigoberta es casada tiene 33 años, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 3 estudian, se dedica a la crianza D. animales, inició con el fin D. superar y lleva 8 años D. experiencia actualmente, espera en el futuro contar con capital amplio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra D. animales consistente en pollos D. engorD.. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, agropecuario, artesanía.
texts.en:
Rigoberta, 33, is married; she never went to school.  She has five children three of which are in school.  She raises animals.  She started out with the goal of improving herself and has 8 years’ experience to date; she hopes in future to have more capital.

She organizes a group to request a loan to buy chicks to raise.  The other group members are in commerce, animal husbandry and crafts making.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis, 28 años de edad, vive en Pueblo Nuevo, municipio de Estelí, soltero, agricultor. Sus experiencias atravez del préstamo Kiva hay sido mucha ayuda y beneficio para su vida y negocio el segundo préstamo lo utilizo para siembra de tomates y cubrir costos como el pago de mano de obra, compra de insumos para cultivar. Ahora desea ir ampliando poco a poco la siembra de tomates es por ello que solicita otro crédito para sembrar 1 manzana de tomate, compra de insumos, abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra. Esperar seguir sacando una producción de ricos y jugosos tomates de buena calidad y rendimiento.
texts.en: Luis is 28 years-old and lives in Pueblo Nuevo in the municipality of Estelí. He is single and a farmer. His experiences through the Kiva loans have been very helpful and beneficial for his life and business. He used the second loan to plant tomatoes, cover labor costs, and purchase supplies with which to farm. Now he hopes to increase his tomato planting little by little. For this reason he is requesting another loan: in order to plant a block of tomatoes, buy supplies and fertilizers, and pay for labor. He hopes to continue to reap a harvest of delicious and juicy tomatoes that are of good quality and yield.

loans.use: to grow tomatoes and pay for labor.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has four children.
 
Marcela has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Marcela has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marcela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 32 years old and married with one child currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.
Mary Jane has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, noodles, canned goods, purified water, etc. 

In the future, Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina was born in San Juan Guadalupe, Durango. She and her family arrived to Monterrey in 1984 looking for better opportunities and to improve her quality of life. 18 years ago she began to sell meat, but her customers are very far from she was living. She decided to sell other kinds of foods that is what she is currently doing. She is a very hard-working woman also she worked as house employee. In order to care for her children she began her own business at home. She cooks the meals and her husband every morning goes to the streets to sell them on a tricycle.

He requests a loan of $925 USD to purchase another tricycle for her husband to continue distributing her delicious meals to his clients. She also wants to buy an industrial stove that will allow her to increase his production. Maria and her husband need your help and generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Doña Marina nació en San Juan Guadalupe, Durango, en 1984 acompañada de su familia llego a Monterrey en busca de nuevas oportunidades de trabajo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Hace 18 años comenzó a vender carne cruda, pero como los rastros le quedaban muy lejos decidió vender comidas y es a lo que se dedica actualmente. Es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que también ha trabajado como empleada de casas, pero con el fin de no descuidar a sus hijos inicio su propio negocio en su hogar. Ella prepara las comidas y su esposo todas las mañanas sale a venderlas de manera ambulante en un triciclo.

Solicita un préstamo de $925 USD para comprar otro triciclo para que su esposo siga repartiendo las comidas a sus clientes, además quiere comprar una estufa industrial que le permita incrementar sus comidas. Doña María y su esposo necesitan de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase another tricycle

loans.name: Tupo

texts.en: Tupo is a happy mother of four kids and married to a man from the village of Leusoalli, where she runs her business of selling handicrafts. She sells more than 50-60 varieties of Samoan goods such as tie-dyed shirts, Samoan bags, elei lavalava and other items she makes for her business. She uses her income to help provide for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more Samoan shirts, which is a good-selling item that will increase her income.

loans.use: 10 Samoan shirts

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married and has one daughter. She started her business selling children’s footwear at one of the local markets in Melitopol because she loves kids. She has been in this business for 7 years. Presently, Nadezhda has about $4,000 in inventory. Her gross income amounts to $3,000 every month and her net profit is about $1,500.

Nadezhda means “hope” in Russian. Nadezhda realizes that Nadiya (Hope) Ukraine has been a substantial support for her small venture. She readily admits that lending services have helped her business grow and flourish.

Nadezhda has requested a loan for $900 to increase her product variety. She believes that kids are bright, funny, adorable, funky, and so much more and doesn’t want to offer them boring footwear. That is why she is planning to purchase a range of versatile athletic shoes, casual footwear, and sandals for all different age groups of children. We believe that increased funding will help her ongoing success and will allow her to continue to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: Increase product variety

loans.name: Djamil

texts.en:
Djamil B. owns a  vineyard and has run his business for 15 years. 
Djamil is 47 years old and is married with two children. The B. family  lives in Yenikand, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Djamil would like a loan of $950 to buy 250 vine-props to improve the growing of his vines.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his vineyard

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
38-year-old Merita is a mother of three and wife of a small farm owner. She owns a handicraft flea market where she sells Samoan handicrafts in a variety of styles and designs. Handicrafts all start from knowledge of the land and people and that’s what attracts so many outsiders to such beautiful art work.

Merita works hand-in-hand with her husband in supporting their family. She has requested a loan of US$ 900 in order to purchase more handicrafts, fabric materials, glue sticks and needles. The profit from her handicraft flea market goes towards paying school fees, household bills and especially toward her weekly loan repayments. In future, Merita hopes to look for an overseas market for her products, so that she can expand her sales to overseas countries.

loans.use: Buy more Samoan handicrafts

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein fixes car tires in the region of Borj El Barajneh. He also sells car products in his workshop. He therefore needs a loan of $1200 to purchase the required products and material for the sustainability of his business. His clients come from the neighboring area. Hussein is an old beneficiary of Al Majmoua. This is his 7th loan with the Institution, and he has a very good on-time repayment credit history. Hussein is a very hard-working and reliable 28-year-old young man.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest on a greater variety of products including Christmas items

loans.name: Rahimano

texts.en:
Rahimano is a very cheerful woman who loves children very much, as she is the mother of 4 children.  She and her husband try to do all they can for their lovely children.  He is a driver and helps her with the transportation of her goods from their home to her trade place.  

She buys her goods from suppliers from China.  She buys goods in bulk as she receives many orders from her constant clients.  She has a fast turnover and sells her goods in a short time.  

But now she has one problem - her small boy is seriously ill and she needs money for treatment.  She hopes to receive extra capital from KIVA to increase the volume of her goods to recieve more profit, which she plans to spend on her boy.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ni Luh Sutini

texts.id:
Apart from her regular job as a worker in local village administrative office, Sutini and her husband also have a pig farming business. At the moment she has 2 breeding pigs. A good team work with her husband makes this pig farming business successful and they can meet their household daily needs. They both live in a simple house with a 5 year old daughter. The proceed that they can get from the selling of piglets produced by these 2 breeding pigs in one year is IDR 4 million (approx. USD 420). This proceed is used to buy pig feed and to improve the pig hut. The future loan will be used to buy another breeding pig so they can improve the revenue that they get from the farming business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Selain bekerja sebagai karyawati di Kantor Desa didesanya, Sutini dan suaminya memiliki usaha memelihara babi. Saat ini Sutini memelihara 2 ekor induk babi. Kekompakan dalam berusaha bersama suami membuat usaha ini berhasil dan bisa memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Mereka tinggal dirumah yang sangat sederhana, dengan 1 orang anak perempuan yang masih berumur 5 tahun. Keuntungan yang didapat dari 2 induk babinya dalam 1 tahun, sebesar Rp.4.000.000,- dari penjualan anak – anaknya. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak dan memperbaiki kandang. Pinjaman kedepan akan digunakan untuk membeli 1 ekor induk babi lagi, agar keuntungan yang diterima lebih banyak dan bisa menopang kebutuhan keluarganya.

loans.use: To buy a breeding pig (Membeli induk babi)

loans.name: Neema's Neema Group

texts.en:
Neema is 37 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, aged 14, 9, and 5. Neema owns a small shop, which she started in 2008. Every day she works from 7:30 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Neema now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 34 years old and is married woman with 4 children, ages 12,8,5 and 2 years old.Hadija is fish and cassava seller, she started in 2008. Everyday, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Sakina's Tuamke Group

texts.en:
Sakina is 37 years old and is a married woman with 7 children. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 15 and 12 years old. Sakina is a tailor. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Adela, Grace, Hawa, Asha and Siwema, who have businesses selling charcoal and port, and operating a beauty salon and a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Thi Hien

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 020031), 38 years old, would like to apply for a loan of 354,000VND to buy fertilizer. Her average daily income is 60,000VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền (MS: 020031), năm nay 38 tuổi. Chị vay 354.000 VND mua phân lân phục vụ nông nghiệp. Mức thu nhập của chị là 60.000/ngày.

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Amina Kibirige's Group

texts.en:
Amina K. is the leader of a group of five women. She is 37 years old and is married with three children. The oldest child is five years old and is in primary school while the youngest is not yet in school. The community she lives and works in is an urban slum within a low-lying area that often floods during the rainy season.

Amina takes public transportation to town to purchase her goods and then uses luggage lifters to carry the products to her shop. Her shop is located near a school, so her primary customers are students.

Amina's two main challenges are the fluctuating costs associated with her products and the school holidays when her business is slower because of fewer customers.

Amina has been with MCDT since 2002 and has successfully paid back 18 loans. With these loans she has expanded her business a great deal and can now sustain herself and pay her children’s school fees. In addition, she has been able to construct a house for her family and has recently expanded her business to include a saloon.

Amina hopes to be able to finish construction on her house and to one day expand her saloon. This loan will help towards that goal.

loans.use: Increase retail stock

loans.name: Máximo Silvano

texts.es:
Máximo is 44 years old and a widower. He currently lives with his 3 children and his elderly mother.

He has always been a very hardworking person who does not allow himself to be defeated by trying circumstances. In spite of losing his entire crop due to freezing weather, he decided to raise animals, both small ones and larger ones, such as cattle. However, what he mostly does, because of its profitability, is raise guinea pigs. Every day he sees to their feeding, helped by his three children, who serve as his right arm to maintain the household.

When his wife passed away, Máximo had to take care of his family by himself and to this day he continues to do so because of the love he has for them. Being the only means of support for the family and his responsibilities as a father have motivated him to become reliable in meeting all his obligations.

Máximo would like to make improvements to his guinea pig breeding farm and his livestock stable and to be able to plant his fields for his own consumption. For this reason, he is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Máximo tiene 44 años, es viudo, actualmente vive con sus 3 hijos, y con su anciana madre.

Es una persona muy trabajadora, siempre está dedicándose a ello y no se deja derrotar por las circunstancias adversas, a pesar que ha perdido sus cultivos debido a la helada (perdió todas sus cosechas) decidió criar animales, tanto menores, como ganado, sin embargo, a lo que más se dedica, por su rentabilidad es a la crianza de cuyes, diariamente atiende su alimentación, ayudado por sus tres hijos, que son su brazo derecho para mantener su casa.

Al morir su esposa, tuvo que sobrellevar sólo a su familia, y lo ha vendido haciendo hasta hoy por el amor que le tiene. Ser el único sostén de su hogar y su responsabilidad como padre, le ha motivado a ser cumplidor de sus deberes.

Máximo desea mejorar su criadero de cuyes, mejorar su establo de animales y poder sembrar para consumo propio en sus campos de cultivo, por tal motivo es que presenta esta solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: Make improvements to his guinea pig breeding farm and livestock stable.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev N., 61, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband have been working on their farmland growing rice to earn a living, and they are able to make around $1 per day. They live with five of their eight children. Every month, their children always support them by sending around $50 to support the family. 

Mrs. Khiev N. would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, of $500 to purchase a horse and horse cart to transport passengers or goods for profit. She told a loan officer that in the future, she will run a grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and horse cart to transport passengers or goods for profit.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Monsieur D. Koffi est un homme passionné de football. Il est né le 17 février 1967 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de quatre enfants. Depuis 2005, il a crée un espace foot où il transmet en direct les jeux de football et autres films souvent intéressés par les jeunes. Il vend également des appareils électroniques et des antennes paraboliques.
Il dépend uniquement que de cette activité, et supporte seul les charges de sa famille. 
A l’approche de cette rentrée scolaire, il a des difficultés pour acheter des fournitures scolaires à ses enfants et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter deux décodeurs et satisfaire la commande qu’elle vient de recevoir. Ainsi avec le revenu de commerce il pourra acheter quelques fournitures pour ses enfants afin qu’ils puissent commencer les cours.
texts.en:
Koffi D. is an avid soccer fan. He was born on February 17, 1967 in Lomé, and is married and the father of four children. In 2005, he opened a soccer venue where live broadcasts of soccer games and other films that frequently interest young people can be viewed. He likewise sells electronics and satellite dishes. His family depends on this business for their sole support. With the approach of the school year, Koffi is having difficulty buying school supplies for his children and is requesting his first loan in order to buy two decoders to fill an order he has just received. With the profit from this venture he will be able to purchase some supplies for his children so they can begin classes.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of decoders

loans.name: Kassoumaye Fm Group

texts.fr: Kassoumaye FM est une petite radio communautaire qui participe au bien être des femmes et de la petite enfance par des émissions sur le VIH SIDA, la drogue, les mutilations sexuelles etc Les responsables de cette radio sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des consommables pour leurs émissions et les publi-reportages qui constituent une de leur rentrée de fonds
texts.en:
Kassoumaye FM is a small community radio station that contributes to the well-being of women and young children through broacasts concerning HIV/AIDS, illicit drugs, sexual mutilation, etc. The managers of this radio station are requesting this loan to buy consumables for their broadcasts and the editorial-style advertising which constitute one of their inflows of funds.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer consumables

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 49 años, es casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive solo, tiene inquilinos en casa, que son su compañía, su esposa y sus hijos viven en Lima.  Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cuando su esposa vivía en el pueblo sembraban en grandes cantidades, pero se fue a la capital para cuidar de sus hijos que estudian por allá. El ha sembrado 20 sacos de semilla, pero con operarios, contrata una persona para que prepare los alimentos para sus operarios, le agrada mucho la agricultura, es por ello que no puede irse con su familia, solo que tiene dificultades cuando los insectos atacan a sus plantas y ahí viene su preocupación al no tener dinero suficiente para comprar los insecticidas. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, ha venido siendo puntual en sus  pagos. Con el dinero va comprar insecticidas como el “Cursatil”, el kilo S/.70 y el “Fitoras” que sirve para la controlar el insecto llamada “rancha”, invertirá una aproximado S/.1.200.
texts.en:
Victor is 49 years old, married with four children. He lives alone but has tenants in his house which provide him company. His wife and children live in Lima. Since he was very young, he has worked as a farmer; when his wife lived in the village, they grew large quantities of crops but their capital has since gone to support their children in their studies in Lima. He has planted 20 sacks of seeds but has had to hire someone to prepare food for all of his workers. He loves farmwork which is why he can't go to Lima to be with his family. He struggles when insects attack his crops which is why he is worried since he doesn't have enough money to purchase insecticides. This is the second loan he has requested from MFP and he has been punctual in all his payments. With the loan, he will purchase insecticides like Cursatil, which costs ~$23/kilo and Fitoras which helps to fight of the "rancha" bug. He will invest about $400.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase insecticides for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruit and spices

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr: Demba Guissé est chauffeur de profession. Marié et pére de deux enfants, il tient une boutique de vente et de réparation de téléphones portables à  kolda, sur la route du camp militaire. Sa profession l'oblige à embaucher son frére dans sa boutique qu'il vient controler réguliérement. Ainsi cette activité lui permet non seulement de donner du travail à son frére, mais aussi de subvenir convenablement aux charges de sa famille. Ainsi il voudrait extendre son activité pour mieux répondre à la demande sociale assez importante et surtout conserver l'emploi de son frére.
texts.en:
Demba Guissé is a driver. He is married and has two children. He has a store where he sells and fixes cell phones in Kolda, on the road to the military camp. Because of his job, he has to hire his brother in his store which he checks regularly. Not only does this business allow him to give his brother a job, but also to adequately cover his household expenses. He would like to expand his business in order to satisfy his customers' demands and especially to continue to employ his brother.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and repair cell phones.

loans.name: Gullu

texts.en: Gullu M. is 56 years old. She is married with four children. She started her own business more than 20 years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family's expenses. Gullu sells washing powder, soap, shampoo and eggs that hew poultry produce. Her family is living with her husband's parents and the generated income allows Gullu to support her large household. Gullu dreams of her children getting a higher education. Today she requests a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months. She is going to use the funds to purchase a wider range of goods. With the income she plans to buy her own store and educate her children. Gullu thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time, as she did with her previous loan.

loans.use: purchase more bath goods and diversify food items

loans.name: Marcelina De Los Santos

texts.es:
La señora Marcelina de los Santos Q. se dedica en la ciudad de Managua a su actividad de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 15 años habiéndolos comercializado con mucho esfuerzo ya que es una madre con cuatro hijos que debe mantener y proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

Es importante destacar que actualmente la señora Marcelina ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de las frutas y verduras y con este crédito se beneficiará tanto ella como su negocio y su amada familia.
texts.en:
Señora Marcelina de los Santos Q. has sold fruits and vegetables in the city of Managua for 15 years. She has been selling energetically because she is the mother of 4 children whom she must support and provide the best conditions for their development. It is important to emphasize that Señora Marcelina has requested this loan from Ceprodel to buy fruits and vegetables, and that this loan will benefit her as much as her business and her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables
